Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: princess_mimi
Reviews.Content: We two "gal pals" stayed at this hotel for two nights and found it to be comfortable and very convenient. The room was a bit small, but had comfortable twin beds and a clean and adequate bath, with a good shower! The hotel is located with the front on Spuistraat, and the back overlooking the Singel Canal. We couldn't get a room with canal view, but really, didn't matter, since we were not spending much time there. It is an easy walk to the tram if you want to visit Leidsplein area, or just a few stops to the central train station. But the walk is easy, also. The strange thing is that wi-fi is free in the lobby area (for 30-minute intervals), but is charged in the room (if you choose). We didn't choose to have their breakfast, which seemed a little pricey at 20 euros. We walked thru the alley next to the hotel, to a wonderful little bakery/tearoom, Lanskroon, for freshly baked croissants and coffee. They have tables outside facing the Singel Canal, and a few tables inside. Lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Stay with problems, good location”
Reviews.Author: mankerholz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a cold March, and the heat in my room did not work. I asked for them to do something about it, but nothing was done, and that I could not be switched to a different room. Also, a person in a neighboring room was smoking, which made for an unpleasant smell in my room as well. The hotel is well located, near many good restaurants and convenient to public transportation. Normal, but not outstanding breakfast. Overall, a better hotel can be found for the same value.

Reviews.Title: “like home”
Reviews.Author: CandanN1 Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: NH city center,in the center,DAM Square,Joordan,9 streets,spui,kalverstraat...vb within walking distance,a little small but very clean and comfortable rooms,friendly and fast service at reception

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kenda_Mark Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: This NH Hotel, City Center is located in a very welcoming neighborhood of Amsterdam. 3 girls for 3 nights needed 3 beds. Overall a great value since we were traveling during easter break. I would stay at this hotel, same location again but would try booking through their web site and not hotels.com. Pros- 1.The location would be really hard to beat. The train station (Amsterdam Centraal) is a 10-15 min walk, the trams are 5 min away, with great exploring on foot or bike. 2.There are 2 very good choices for breakfast in the morning just outside the hotel, Le Pain & a neighborhood Backeri. There are also many good pubs in the vicinity. 3.The staff was very friendly. After giving us a small double room with a cot squeezed in, they gave us a triple room for 2 out of 3 nights. We agreed to switch by noon of the last night. They were also very helpful with directions and recommendations! 4.Mikes bike tours is just around the corner. Cons- 1.Unfortunately booking a triple room through hotels.com does not ensure that you will have a triple room, though you will pay the price for a triple. I spent a lot of time searching for a triple, so I was really disappointed! 2. The cot (extra bed) was uncomfortable. 3. Limited WiFi access-lobby only and for a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked.”
Reviews.Author: gonzfamilyexplorers
Reviews.Content: I read tripadvisor reviews every time I book a place. Since we were traveling without our kids this time and we opted not to drive, I chose this hotel solely because of its location. Imagine my annoyance, disappointment and anger to have come so far and to book in advance only to be told they overbooked and that they had nothing to do with the "booking" system because it was all done in Madrid(?), yata, yata, yata. Although I grudgingly end up liking the NH Museum Quarter, I cannot begin to tell you how disappointing it is to be bumped and I want to let them know what a terrible, terrible practice it is and how angry I get every time we have to take a tram to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what was expected.....”
Reviews.Author: drleb
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is rather good and the accomodations were fine in general, but with the exception of the 'trainee' Cindy (who was excellent in helping us with making reservations, checking us in (and upgrading our room), making us feel welcome), the staff was just not up to par. We expected that we would have some level of customer services, but too often, we would stand at the front desk for 5 minutes before 1 of the 5 people 'working in the back' would come out and give us a hand. Enough on the bad, there is some good reasons to stay here. As the other reviews say, it is very well located near Dam Square and several other attractions. We were able to make it all around the city on foot from this spot. The room was comfortable, and thanks to Cindy, we had enough room in there for the three of us. Parking is a bit sketchy (well secured underground lot) as it took us about 30 minutes to get our car out when we wanted to leave due to others blocking us in and the hotel not able to find their keys. Overall, I would not avoid this hotel since no one goes to Amsterdam for the 'hotel' anyway. It was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Shower/Tub”
Reviews.Author: cryptocat1
Reviews.Content: As with everything in Europe, the hotels are more expensive and provide less amenities and comfort than what we're used to in the United States. My Dad and I were starting a Rhine River cruise and we stayed at this property the night before our cruise began. All in all, this was a good, clean, and modern hotel. Particularly by European standards. The front desk staff were efficient, friendly, and helpful. We got a room package that included the breakfast. You definitely want this since purchasing the breakfast seperately would cost over $25 per person for a breakfast buffet no better than what you might find at a Bob Evans, Denny's, or IHOP in the States. A SMALL beer (10 oz.)in the hotel bar in the afternoon cost $6.50 USD. English language channels on the room's TV were limited to CNN International, BBC, and perhaps Bloomberg Financial. There were lots of European sports channels in the local language. The rooms were clean and modern and of average or above-average size by European standards but only half the size of that found in a "normal" US hotel such as Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn, or La Quinta. The room was hot (in March) and provided little or no means of getting it cooler (other than opening a window). The bathroom was extremely small and awkward to move around in but it was clean and "modern" (again, by European standards). The plumbing fixtures and faucets in the tub/shower are somewhat like a "Rube Goldberg" design - something out of a Peter Seller's movie and not readily intuitive for the average American traveller. but with a little experimentation, you'll "figure it out". Of great concern to all your family members should be the SAFETY aspects of the tub/shower. The floor of the tub is extremely slippery with no built-in non-skid material or rubber mat available to put down in the tub. In addition to that, the tub sides are extremely high - nearly 2 feet high - and quite difficult to climb in and out of. This tub design would NOT meet ANY U.S. safety standard. I was in the bathroom to carefully assist my elderly father to get in and out of the shower and he STILL slipped and fell on the floor, bruising his "rear end" very badly. And I was in their holding on to him! If I had not been there to steady and catch him, he very likely would have wound up in the hospital with a serious or life-threatening injury. This tub design is hazardous no matter what your age! As with most European showers, they seem incapable of designing one that does NOT spray water outside the tube enclosure and out all over the bathroom floor. This hotel was no exception. We had to use one of the large bath towels, along with the bath mat, to mop up all the water that went outside the tub while showering. One would think that a "4-star hotel" charging over $250/night could provide a better shower and tub arrangement than this! Don't count on it in Europe. The glass "shower door" only extended half-way across the length of the tub, allowing water hitting your body to spray out of the tub area and onto the bathroom floor. the hotel was located in a vibrant central part of Amsterdam near a canal and cafe's. In the hotel bar (where I got the $6 SMALL beer) they were selling a few assorted pastries on the bar counter. A single glazed donut was selling for 3.50 Euro! That's equal to $4.65 USD! Over 4 times the price that it would cost in a U.S. Duncan Donut shop. See the attached photo w/price list if you don't believe me! We ate dinner at a Burger King across the street from the hotel. 2 cheeseburgers, 2 small fries, and 2 small cokes cost $20 USD. Oh, and 2 small packages of ketchup cost $1.30 USD extra! Bring plenty of money with you to Europe! Overall, a nice hotel in a convenient location. Be careful in the Bathroom! Free WiFi (for only 30 minutes at a time) is only offered in the hotel lobby and you need to get a "voucher" from the desk staff. To use WiFi in your room is going to cost extra and is not included in the basic room charge. Europe still has not yet embraced the concept of widly available "free WiFi access" for hotel guests. A small wall mounted ice machine was available near the elevator on each floor but quite a walk from most of the rooms and NO ice bucket was provided in the rooms. You had to carry a couple of small room glasses to the machine to fill them up. Make sure breakfast is included in your room rate. Eating lunch or dinner in the hotel will be very expensive but there are several cafe's and casual restaurants across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good middle ranking hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: J0hnBy
Reviews.Content: A short walk from the main restaurants, central station and general amenities of Amsterdam, the NH City Hotel is handy, friendly, efficient, clean and a good base for business or tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: anoirtac
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within easy walking distance of the city centre. 5 mins to Dam Square, 15 mins to Anne Frank House, 5 mins to the shopping streets, 15/20 mins to Central Station. There were lots of cafe bars and restaurants on the same street as the hotel. The staff of the hotel were very friendly and spoke flawless English. The hotel itself was basic enough. The rooms were clean but very hot...we got a room with a window that didn't open and there was no air conditioning so my advice...request a room with a functioning window!!!! There wasn't much life in the hotel in the evening so we tended to always eat and go for drinks outside the hotel. It cost around 45euro to get from airport to hotel. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as a convenient city centre location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eddie033
Reviews.Content: Great location. the tram line 1 stops right in front... able to get around fast and quickly. the staff was very helpful roomare a bit small but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: gourmetwashington
Reviews.Content: This was a a very nice hotel in a great location. Shops, museums, tram - all very close. The rooms are small, but very clean and cozy. The beds are comfortable and we had a nice view from our room. There is fresh coffee and water throughout the day in the lobby. The coffee was probably some of the best I have tasted. I was extremely impressed by the staff. I requested a high floor upon check in located in a quiet location. This is exactly what I was given. I very much appreciate that when checking in. Most of the time, hotel clerks politely nod and then give whatever room comes up first, completely ignoring my request. However, at the NH, the clerk listened and them gave us a great room. Plus, I also requested an extra blanket and pillow, which were immediately brought up. We never had breakfast in the hotel, because so many yummy little restaurants were close by. This was a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable stay in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: carsten_lind
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ealily accessible near city centre. A 20 min. drive by taxi from the airport or a 20 min. walk from the central station. Very nice and helpful reception and the room was ready for us at 11 am at arrival, though they only promised at 3 pm. A very nice restaurant next door and a typical domestic restaurant across the street. Good breakfast buffet available at â‚¬15 a day. Very clean rooms. Only downside was the sunday, where our room only got cleaned round 5 pm - despite we asked them to do it round 2-3 pm. We consider it a fluke. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: obigesto i Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, we stayed in the superior room with a view to the canal, the room was comfortable and was actually large (larger than what we were expecting). service was good. The hotel was located around 5-10 min walk to the Dam Square. the only thing that we regret that the entrance of the hotel has no ramp, and because we were traveling using baby stroller it's actually troublesome to lift the stroller to go in and out from the hotel. Overall it's a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mschats
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this modest hotel is its location - very central and yet away from the hustle and bustle of the city square! Our room ( double standard ) was much smaller than we had envisaged, but good housekeeping and nice clean toilets and sheets, so worked ok. Oh, and also a lovely canal view which helped. Most of the city attractions were walking distance. 2 great restaurants right opposite the hotel - one serving authentic Dutch cuisine and the other Indonesian. Would recommend, but chose your room carefully!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: Neil0Jones
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel, with a number of years between each stay. The rooms were not good and we had to move 3 times. The hotel needs new beds. The check-in staff were efficient and didn't quibble about moving so often - I think they're used to it. The location is very central close to dam square. No porters to help you to take your suitcases up the flight of stairs at the entrance. Free WiFi in lobby was useful but still operate an old system of needing to enter a password that gives you 15 minutes. Breakfast very expensive so do your self a favour and eat at the lovely Belgian cafe a couple of hundred metres up the road. Cheaper and better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but expensive .....!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Reddy19
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family good hotel and also located in excellent location , front desk is helpfull...but very expensive .......!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: MarcHanlon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March along with a group if friends for 2 nights. We all wanted to be somewhere central with easy Access to Dam Square, Leidseplein & Rembrandt Square. The hotel was situated with an 10 minutes walk to each of the listed areas. The facilities at the hotel were adequate enough for what we wanted and staff were friendly and very helpful. All in all I would stay at the NH City Centre on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter1963
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located just a few minutes away from Dam Square and other attractions like the Flower Market, Redlight district and the Opera House (where next to it one finds the Flea market). Breakfast very good... continental or english. Staff is very friendly and we shall stay at this hotel when we visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Suburban_gay
Reviews.Content: Great money for value. Very helpful staff. Clean and modern rooms, clean and comfortable linen. Buffet breakfast was awesome! I couldn't get enough! Centrally located and well worth the stay. I will absolutely stay here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Bianca M
Reviews.Content: Our group of 31 spent three nights here last week. While the hotel looks a bit worn from the outside and has a rather dated lobby area, it is very clean and the rooms are comfortable and well appointed. The availability of in-room coffee makers plus the free coffee, tea and water available in the lobby during the morning hours were wonderful and most appreciated amenities. The location is perfect for touring all of the most important sights in Amsterdam, and we did not need to take public transportation at all. Everything was accessible on foot. The neighborhood is nice with a number of good bars, cafe's and even some excellent breakfast locations. The personnel at the front desk were very cordial and helpful as well. I recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A standard 4* hotel in a touristic city”
Reviews.Author: costinul_ala
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about this hotel. It fells right in the average of a four star hotel in a city like Amsterdam. Comfortably close to the center, nice clean and accessorized rooms, good breakfast, good bar service, free internet in the lobby, good staff On the other hand you have to pay extra for: internet in your room (it is 2012, please update!) and gym access. Maybe these things make up for the slightly lower price for the area. One other thing is that to check-in and out it takes a some minutes of waiting in line .... but not a disaster

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: flended
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip for 2 nights, very pleasant. Pros: Excellent breakfast choice, very queit on all floors, very helpful staff, free wifi (in lobby), room was spacious (room 346), comfy beds, excellent shower, very clean, location is great, walk out of front entrance and turn right, walk 2 minutes and your at a lovely little square with a book market and bars, cafes etc... Cons: Very limited wifi in rooms, free in lobby is ok, but I thought it might have been free all over, considering Amsterdam is basically a wireless city now, even in "high end" hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice city break!”
Reviews.Author: Wich456
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean spacious room with really nice polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel, very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: pinkmambo
Reviews.Content: Let's start by saying NH City centre is advertised as a 3 star hotel- and it is what you pay for, so manage your expectations. The hotel itself is tired and dated, though certain rooms have been updated- I took a superior room on the 3rd floor, which had wooden floors and a small and functional bathroom. Everything was extremely clean and well presented. The general walkway to the rooms though, felt like it was from the 70ies. The one thing that bothered me the most was that other hotel guests were smoking pot in their rooms- which is fine, except that their 2nd hand smoke managed to make it all the way through my bathroom, which is an extremely confined space- a few minutes in there made you a little high! not great if you have to get ready to go for a business meeting and end up smelling of marijuana! Hahahahaha! In terms of location, it is about 10 minutes walk from Dam Square, across the canal from the '9 street's shopping district and also about a 15 minute walk to the museum district. Perfect central location towards everything. However, amsterdam is quite a small city and walkable to almost everywhere and the trams connect very well and are frequent. Overall, it was a good stay- the staff are extremely friendly. Check-in and out was exceptionally easy.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and cosy interior”
Reviews.Author: traveldigger
Reviews.Content: It seems from the pictures that this hotel has 2-3 double room types, which you probably can't choose until the arrival, but we were very happy with our room on the top floor. The only thing missing was a nightstand on one side of the bed which was pretty inconvenient. The bed was a little bit too hard for our taste, but we slept all right. Other than that, everything was great. I have to mention that hotel had a complementary coffee, tea and water in the lobby during the day, all together with cups-to-go. That was a wonderful touch and the coffee was really excellent. Other things about the hotel were mentioned before, its location is magnificent and you can't be closer to everything in central Amsterdam. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Lovely Helpful Staff :)”
Reviews.Author: Sineador88
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a great central location to everything. dam square is only about a 5 min walk. The staff were a great help. Tip: ask for a room on the canal side, you might have to wait a little bit but its well worth it. Rooms were well furnished and compact, everything you need is in the room. but its cozy! Would definately stay again and would recommend the NH city center to friends.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam_Chris123
Reviews.Content: I often stay in hotels in Amsterdam and this one is one of the better hotels. The staff is quite friendly, the rooms are spacious and clean and the hotel itself is perfectly located in the center of Amsterdam and yet quiet. There are a lot of bars and restaurants around and you can have a long nice walk by the canals. If in town, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Efficient, Clinical Hotel in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lancashireexile
Reviews.Content: Stayed a single night during a trip to a sporting event. As I have relatives in the city this was simply a place to drop the bag, sleep, wash and eat breakfast. In fact it served its purpose pretty well. The hotel looked to be a fairly recent conversion of an elderly building. Certainly neither the bedroom or the public areas showed the signs of wear and tear you sometimes associate with the frenetic tourism of Amsterdam. The hotel location is excellent. Spuistraat runs up to the Central Station area but is sufficiently far away from there, the Dam Square and the Red Light district to avoid the noisier tourist excesses. There are a number of traditional bars and some long established if now pedestrian restaurants in the immediate area. The Amsterdam Museum which gives you an excellent introduction to the city's history is just up the street. You can walk to most of the major cultural sites and into the quirky but chic Jordaan district but if you feel lazy the tram stop is about twenty metres from the front door. Service at the Hotel was brisk, efficient and friendly; English speakers of course have no linguistic problems in Amsterdam. The bedroom was a modest size with a view over roof tops and rear entrances. The bed was comfortable and the room clean. I slept well despite the hotel having a number of guests who were out late. The bathroom was shower only and a little cramped. The buffet breakfast included hot and cold food and allowed for some substantial eating if you were so inclined. Service there was also amiable and efficient. Central Amsterdam isn't cheap but this wasn't bad value given the demand for hotel rooms from tourists. I don't normally need hotel accommodation when staying over but this is certainly worth considering again for its location, facilities and price. The range of hotel options and facilities does increase as you move out from the city centre but if you want to be close to the tourist action this is certainly worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Canal View, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: AberystwythWelshgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a weekend trip in Amsterdam. Nice and clean room, with a lovely canal view. Staff very pleasant. They also kept our bag during the day!

Reviews.Title: “Simply but ellegant”
Reviews.Author: loek111
Reviews.Content: Hotel more or less in the City Centre close to the shopping area. Quiet street, no noise. Room are clean but old. Hotel is with charisma but all is old. Employees are trained friendly. Hotel is easy to reach by car and public transport. For business and pleasure the hotel is usuable. However I should never stay more than 2 / 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “OK...... but great location”
Reviews.Author: oznick
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great location..... apart from that don't expect much; its old, run down and in a pretty poor state. In saying that however the staff were nice, the rooms was clean; even if the condition of the hardware was poor. If you can get a good deal/rate then consider it; if you want to spend a lot of your time in the room; look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “excellent location , great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Keith M
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 3 night stay here , it is in the perfect location , 5 min walk from dam square , 15 min walk from central station room was small but very clean & comfortable , shower was very good with plenty of hot water wifi in the lobby would definitly return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Just across the road from Hard Road Cafe”
Reviews.Author: Jubylu
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location and modern rooms with marble bathrooms. Location was excellent and this is one of the best hotels i have stayed in whilst in Amsterdam. 5 min walk for the red light area but as this is really everywhere in Dam, you are completely central. The coffee shops align the street and i feel this is definitely one of the best the best to stay in. Most other hotels are basic and old. This is not. Its new and quite art deco.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: zia30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really very nice and REALLY EXCELLENT location. I stayed there for 2 weeks and it was just great! The first day I got a very large room but there was no view. The next day they gladly changed my room to the loveliest canal view although the room was considerably smaller and no space to move around but I didn't really care. Bed was very comfortable, room clean, bathroom small but nice. Internet as well was ok, you can get it free in the downstairs lobby. The morning breakfast was good, with choices and opened early, that was really convenient for me as I had early starts and it is so very quiet in the mornings, no crowds. The tram station Spui is just across the street and is really one minute walk which was just great! If you want to go to Leidseplein just grab a tram that takes you there about 3 stops further where you can find nice food and shops. Shops are all around. Great walks all around hotel and supermarket 4 minutes walk away. Flower market 10 minutes walk away. Location was just PERFECT! everything is so near and easy to access. The main station is 15 minutes away where you can grab a train to Schiphol.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel is great location”
Reviews.Author: katj85
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean hotel with large room. Right on the canal with beautiful views and only a ten/fifteen minute walk to red light district/station. Easy to find and staff were really helpful with maps etc. Free WiFi in foyer. Beds were two singles pushed together but was very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Poorty
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights earlier in January. Its a solid place to stay at a fair price. Very close (100m) to the famous Vondelpark in Amsterdam for running/jogging/relaxing and equally close to the Leidseplein for canels, entertainments (bars, cafes restaurants incl Hard Rock Cafe). Would recommend to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect !”
Reviews.Author: LeoOlgaAna
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect, except when a rat decided to appear in one of the rooms, at 3:00 a.m - we were 18 friends (5 families with 9 kids), staying in 8 differents rooms. But immediately the staff changed the room, making an upgrade with lots of apologies.

Reviews.Title: “4th visit”
Reviews.Author: hawk_roamer
Reviews.Content: In March we will make our 4th visit to Amsterdam and our 4th stay at NH City centre. The staff on duty during all our visits were excellent and very helpful when asked for help or recommendations. We have stayed on a different floor and different room each time and all were clean and in good order. Our last room had three large windows over looking the canal and was quite nice. Wish I could recall the room number but visited Dutch Flower shop which is just down the streent to often. Excellent location to everything in centraal Amsterdam. I'm a little sad to read a few recent negative comments but I'll have a fresh review in mid March on what we find this visit. The single biggest disapointment I have is not with the hotel but the over all trash in the streets and canals in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Really good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Claire W
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to Amsterdam in December last year for 2 nights, 15 min max walk from train station and took some amazing shots from our window of the canal and houses opposite. The hotel is in a good location everything is easy to walk to, me and my husband find the best way to explore cities is by walking and we found some brilliant little places to eat and drink! We're planning on going back again this year and using the same hotel, our room was quite small, but really how much time do you actually spend in your hotel room when your on holiday? The rooms we're modern,clean, fresh towels both mornings and reception staff are than happy to help. There's a great little pub across the road, with an amazing choice in beer and the house red wine is very cheap! If you like shoe shopping, you'll love Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: YODE77
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel during the new year. Our room was extremely small (I travel alot and never seen such a small room) and "old & dirty". When asked to change room, this was not possible. Bed linnen weren't change even ONCE! Floors in the room were not cleaned at all. Last day the cleaning didn't visit at all but simply left two clean towles outside the door. Its a big bummer because we decided to "UP" our booking for a more expensive hotel in order to enjoy a nicer room/hotel. This was not the case with this hotel. On the plus side, at least there was free internet in the lobby and personel were helpful. But that is about it. All in all, I wont be risking with NH hotels anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Located in a wonderful part of the city”
Reviews.Author: mackyUK
Reviews.Content: It was my third visit to this hotel and this is the second review that I have written, I give the hotel a 4 star rating back in 2007 and five years later I award 4 stars again. The primary reason for the 4 stars is because it's reasonably priced and it location is awesome. There is no need to grab a cab or a tram from the Central Station, just walk straight down the Spuistraat for about 15 minutes and you will arrive at the hotel. All Amsterdam's major tourists attractions are accessible (on foot) from the hotel and very close by are CafÃ© Hoppe, CafÃ© Spui and CafÃ© Luxembourg, just three of many great places to eat. The rooms are like most other hotels rooms in Amsterdam, small but cosy. They have a flat screen TV, heating, fridge, coffee and tea and the main bathroom essentials. My only minor complaint with the hotel is that many of the rooms do not come with a bath tub.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel near the shopping center”
Reviews.Author: Mahyar_rj
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 days in this hotel , it was very close to the shopping center and Dam square and far enough for resting in silent but the only problem was the walls of the rooms are so thin and you can hear the noise of other rooms , but every thing was perfect free wifi in lobby , great coffee shop near the hotel and you can find any brands in shopping street near the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, free lobby wifi and really weird toilets.”
Reviews.Author: psudino
Reviews.Content: I hope my title caught your attention. You'll see the commentary on the toilets in the cons section. Pros: 1. The location is great. This hotel is walking distance (within reason) of the majority of the main attractions in Amsterdam. 2. The rooms are quite nice. The showers are a bit small, but good enough. There are plenty of power outlets for all your electronics. They provide a sponge as a loofah, which does a good job. 3. The lobby has free wifi that is fast enough for VoIP calling. 4. The front desk staff was generally helpful, especially when arranging transportation to the airport. 5. There is a parking garage (for a fee) if you need it. 6. Much better price than anything comparable nearby. Cons: 1. We arrived via a rental car that we were returning right away (thankfully, considering Amsterdam is one of the scariest cities I have ever driven in, and I am used to NYC traffic) but trying to find a place to park was nearly impossible. We ended up parking in a taxi pickup stop, we think, with my wife staying in the car until all the luggage was in the hotel room. Then we swapped places and I returned the car. In short, no parking on the street. 2. Toilets. Ok, this is a first for me, I do not think I have ever had a need to review a toilet on Tripadvisor, but these were so weird that I have to. This is a little gross, but the toilets had a shelf that all your business went on until the flush pushes it off and away. The problem is when one has to take a #2, it just sits on this shelf with no water to take away the smell or anything. I had a normal bathroom experience and had to constantly flush the toilet because I started gagging. I do not why anyone would design a toilet like this, but the better question is why anyone buy toilets like this? So gross. Even though I spent most my review describing poor parking and an odd toilet, I do recommend this hotel. The location, price and nice rooms make this a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “pretty stay”
Reviews.Author: travelerpeter194
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel. Friendly and helpful employees at the reception. A very nice and clean room. Excellent breakfast. Free parking inside. This is an advantage due to the fact that Amsterdam's parking rates are sky high. The hotel is situated in de center of the city. We are sure to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Giving you the elementary comfort you need on a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Frederik F
Reviews.Content: I was there in October for business and booked 1 night. It is about 10 to 15 minutes walk from Amsterdam Centraal. The receptionist is kind and is well-informed to give you the most practical advise for dinner outside, as the hotel is not providing dinner in-house. The room was clean but small and a bit noisy. For one night only it is giving you the elementary comfort, but i wouldn't be happy with it if i would visite Amsterdam for 3 days or so. Breakfast is pretty expensive and the breakfast area can use some renovation. Globally, it's a good hotel for a short stay for business purposes, and perhaps for weekendtrips if you have another room then the one i had.

Reviews.Title: “NH Amsterdam City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Antero T
Reviews.Content: After our unsuccessful booking to another hotel in Amsterdam we managed to get a room in NH City Center Hotel. The location was excellent very close to the centre of Amsterdam. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, cozy and silent. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel ad we can recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Mac4SouthWales
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at hotel for business over many years and recently returned after a 2 year gap. Firstly the receptionist recognised me after after the 2 year break, which is a good detail. The hotel is an average 3-4 star hotel, rooms vary from small to spacious and it is hit and miss what you get. The rooms are clean and can get warm in the summer as well as noise from the street late at night. This is a central hotel so expect this. What the hotel has going for it, is location, you can easily to walk to tourist attractions and bars from the hotel. Breakfast is typically expensive though there are plenty of options close by, if you eat on the move, I highly recommend the pastry shop to the left of the front entrance on the corner. The hotel is a good 10-15 minutes walk from central station. I would recommend the hotel for a cheap long weekend get away and want convenience and clean rooms. If you want something more upmarket then you need to look elsewhere. I have no problems staying at the NH and have organised weekends for my parents at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Alvinerius
Reviews.Content: But it is not that good for the money you pay. The bathroom wasn't nice, the sheets on my bed had a hole. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Girls trip to AMS!”
Reviews.Author: OOFA2
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early in the morning and our room was ready which was nice considering the long flight from Chicago. We had room 107. Lovely corner room facing the canal. Very nice room. Our fridge had broken the 2nd night and took almost a 1.5 days to fix. Little annoying to have our food in the lobby. After a night on the town I just wanted to relax and have a snack in my room. The shower has great pressure and nice and warm, but it tends to get the floor wet. Easy to get to from the airport at the SPUI stop on the tram. From airport take the train to city central, then get on tram 1,2 or 5 to stop SPUI. Once you get off cross the tracks and head toward the bar HOPPE. It's a few doors down from this pub. Walking distance to the Anne Frank Huis. Tram 2, 5 will take you to the Van Gogh museum. Great little pub past the "9" shopping district called De Jordaan. Eddie is the best beer tender ever!! There's plenty of food, grocery stores, shopping and pubs. This was the perfect location. Plenty of places nearby to grab breakfast vs eating at hotel which was pricey. The only negative I have about this hotel is the internet was horrible. Took forever to do anything online....sooooo slow!! Very frustrating. I would come back in a heartbeat and stay again! I work for the airlines and have already recommended to several crew members.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miss Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location a 5 min walk from dam sq / ann franks house and 10-15 from the rail station. There are lots of good restaurants in the street. It was very good quality. So clean, well maintained and decent, with lifts and very comfortable beds. There is a buffet breakfeast that started at 7am till 11 and had everything you could want hot/cold English/Continetal food. For 3 nights we paid Â£301 for two in a twin B&B WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY...

Reviews.Title: “Can't really get any better !! Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Evren S
Reviews.Content: Great location with good quality rooms and cute view of the canal. Helpful staff,nice breakfast,LESS THAN 5 MINS walking away from mainstream Amsterdam,museums,shops etc..Only little request for the next time maybe, we couldn't quite understand why the room wasn't hot although the radiator heater was on..air-conditioner could be a better idea for freezing winter nights of Netherlands. A really good detail which we can add to the 'pros' list; transportation from Amsterdam Schippol Airport to the Hotel is very very easy and efficient. Will be back for the winter of 2012!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Deeoh-11
Reviews.Content: Lovely big rooms, central location. Love this hotel I have stayed there a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline Bargain, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dhailia
Reviews.Content: Bagged this hotel through Priceline for about Â£50 a night for a twin room. Although a bit away from the centre, the hotel is located right next to Vondel Park, and the Van Gogh and Riksmuseum . The area is great for finding places to eat, shops and for pottering about, seeing the sights. Amsterdam city centre really isn't that big and walking in from the Hotel to the Train Station took only about 20 mins. I would recommend asking for a room on the upper floors, as it is quieter and there is a better view. We were lucky enough to get a little outside balcony area too. The room and bathroom was immaculate. The room itself was large, the air con worked well and the black-out curtains made it a little too easy to sleep in. My only complaints would be; the bed wasn't firm enough for me, and i ended up with a sore back from having slept sunk into the mattress. I was disappointed there was no UHT milk in the in-room drinks supply- Creamer just isn't the same in a cuppa. I'm not sure if they were training up new staff or what, but at reception it took AGES for anyone to serve us. We waited about 15-20mins at the desk waiting to check in. The check in desk wasn't busy either, it was just us and two American gentlemen who were served before us, despite coming up to the desk about 5 mins after we'd started waiting. All in all for the price we paid- an absolute bargain! When i go back, i'd be more than happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMS is strange period.”
Reviews.Author: UKUSTRIPS
Reviews.Content: If you love AMS you will be happy staying here. It stinks of weed. I think its a great place for 20-30yr old people looking to party. Just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Layla_baku
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel in the end of october 2011. The location is really good, but this is only good thing about this hotel. The room is tiny and very old. I think it is too expensive for such an old hotel. Breakfast is also quite expensive, for 19 euro you could find much better breakfast in all cafes around. On my last day the elevator was out of order and I needed to go downstair with heavy luggages by foot. And last and the most terrible experience form this hotel, that when I tried to check out they realised that they don't accept visa electron cards, but they took it as a garantee and never mentioned that, Moreover they reject to give me a recipoe that transaction is unsuccessfull, hope that my money is still on my cards. At last in a hurry to my flight I needed to go thorugh all city center to find ATM(but daily limit to withdraw is only 250 eur in Amsterdam, be aware of that, so I neededd to withdraw money from all my 3 plastic card to get enough cash). There are many hotels with a better location and price around the city center. Don't choose NH city centre, it doesn't worth this price. Definitely, will never stay in this hotel and will not suggest it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MrsLW_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 20min walk from Amsterdam Centre Station. It is on the edge of the centre of Amsterdam away from the red light district. However this hasn't stopped a few 'red light' windows from setting up in Spuistraat near the station end of the street. Walking from the hotel there are a few buildings covered in graffiti - but don't let this put you off! The hotel is nearer the shops end of the street. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. Our room was on the second floor and was a basic double. It was a compact, clean room with a double bed, wardrobe, coffee making facilities, tv (which had BBC 1 and 2!), desk and a bathroom with a shower. There was a fridge in the room with water in - at an extra charge - we didn't drink it! Our room looked out over the Singel canal. We were away from the main night life but you could occasionally hear rowdiness! Nothing a pair of earplugs didn't sort out. Other hotel guests could be noisy - as with anywhere - the doors don't shut quietly!! None of this however spoilt our stay. There is free wifi at this hotel, only to be used in the lobby. You gain a username and password from a piece of paper in the lobby and get 30 free mins per login. Enough if you want to just quickly check your e-mails or update your Facebook status!! For any longer than that - you will have to pay (or keep adding in free 30min codes!) - but you are on holiday - get out and about!! I would stay here again as it was reasonably central for everything you will want to visit. There is a good tram network but we found that everything was in walking distance - furthest thing we went to was the Heineken Experience - a 30 min walk. Check out is midday but we were able to check out in the morning, leave our luggage in a secure room at the hotel and come back and collect it later in the day. We enjoyed our stay here and would definitely use it again if we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: AlbertWester
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel on the edge of the centre of Amsterdam. A perfect place to stay and to explore the innercity of Amsterdam. Very good rooms, good service and a very good Italian restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy accommodations, nice staff, safe.”
Reviews.Author: genjisan
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, central hotel in Amsterdam. I had no idea Amsterdam was such a tiny city so you can literally walk all around town. The room was small, but decent. It had a safe so that was definitely useful and handy. The staff was nice. The bathroom was a bit small but clean. Overall very happy! The only thing is that the cost of wireless per day was ridiculous, I think it was about $20/day so we just used the free 30 min. passes you are only supposed to use in the lobby. They have them at the front desk so I just grabbed a stack. It's annoying to keep getting kicked off every 30 min. and the connection was very slow. But if you brought your laptop just to check emails or check on what to do for the day, then it's totally adequate. Oh and there was no a/c or fan in the room. We didn't need it in October but we did have to keep the windows open which means you'd hear the traffic outside. It wasn't terribly loud but just so you know.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Love-travelling-080
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel in order to participate in the recent Amsterdam Marathon. The location is very very good, close to Dam Square, Central Station, the flower market, restaurants, shopping, etc..The tram lines are very close also (one or two blocks, depending on the line) and it was really nice when one is tired of walking all the day long. Many restaurants and shopping area nearby (Kaalverstraat), and the view of the canal facing the historic houses is breathtaking. The rooms have a good size, comparing with other European standard hotels. We did not have breakfast in the hotel. Bath is OK, we could use some ventilation - there is none so, ofter one week it is smelly. use a candle, and keep the door open. The nice thing is that we could use free Wi-fi in the lobby and the computer and printer in the lobby were very handy for printing our boarding passes. The hotel staff is professional, not friendly nor warm, just OK. As we were out most part of the day, it was great staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: DublinBanjoMan
Reviews.Content: Just back from a gerat weekend in amsterdam and stayed at the NH City Centre. Not the greatest of hotels, but good. This trip I was given a much larger room than usual for one person and I really appreciated it. The best part of this hotel is its location on Spuistraat, just north of Spuiplien. There are so many good resturants, bars with outdoor seating, 2 really good good coffee shops (yes, that kind of a coffee shop!), and the best breakfast restuarant in Amsterdam is around the corner at Broodjie Bert's, where the gorgozola, mushroom, bacon ommlette is truly a gastronimic experience when mixed with a cuppa cappucino. Close to the tram, you could do much worse than this property. There are other hotels that I think are much better, but its the location that makes this one

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, sparkly clean”
Reviews.Author: skiNebraska
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, reached by trams 1,2, or 5 from the train station. Pick up at least a 2 day city key at the I at the station. This hotel is about 2 blocks from the "action". Lots of cafes/resturants just across the canal. Allowed us to keep our luggage while we explored the city. Free wireless in the lobby, just ask the desk for the voucher. The picture doesn't do it justice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, Clean, Awesome Location, Good Food”
Reviews.Author: HealthInspektor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while babysitting three children. The staff was great, helped me out a lot. The food was really good. I thought the rate was great too. It's a safe, clean hotel in a great location. Walking distance to lots of great stuff, cafes, restaurants. Good place to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good NH Property”
Reviews.Author: psbradys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights during a major tradeshow. The location is excellent for getting trams to anywhere in the city. Get a Superior Room...the standard ones are really too small for a couple. Excellent restaurants on the same street and within walking distance. Kantjil for Indonesian food is a favorite! Free Wi-Fi in the lobby only, but works great with tables and chairs to accomodate laptops. Breakfast buffet is basic European with a few pluses like fresh fruit, scrambled eggs and bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: paul007bondjr
Reviews.Content: Overall enjoyed my stay atthe hotel. Good location, walking distance from everywhere. A bit of a walk if you want to go to the central station and so on, but I did not mind it as the streets were always busy and never felt the walk. The hotel has a very spacious feel to it and well kept and clean. The staff at the hotel were always friendly and helpful. The only negative thing that i have about this hotel is that I got to the hotel at 7 am after a trans atlantic flight, being a hotelier myself, i knew that the room would most probably not be ready. The receptionist did try upselling me to anothe room, which i declined. However, i was a bit perplexed when two couples came in an hour after me and they were upgraded and an early check in given!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for minimum stay...”
Reviews.Author: GeorginaTsioutsiouli
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel located in the city centre, that is clean, serves a good breakfast buffet and front-desk employees are willing to help you then you found it. Location is quite down town....about 15 minutes walk to the Amsterdam Centraal. Rooms are clean, but kind of small and pretty basic. And when I say small, I mean small. This was the narrowest desk I ever worked on...also amenities are pretty basic, just shampoo and bath gel. Breakfast is quite good with variety between healthy and unhealthy choices and coffee although served from a Douwe Egberts machine is drinkable. Front-desk employees were smiling and helpful and always willing to provide additional information and assistance. I would recommended it for 2-3 days staying...

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean”
Reviews.Author: fhayes7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good location for dam square and the trams. Its relatively quiet around the hotel but activity is only a 2 minute walk away. The hotel rooms are modern, small, comfortable and clean. The hotel is quite large but you dont see many other guests in the corridors etc. The staff on reception are friendly enough. We stayed here for two nights on a room only basis. It is a little over priced for what you are getting but it is ideal for a base but not if you plan on spending a lot of time there. I would stay here again providing the prices dont keep rising. There is a lovely bakery on the corner which i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendliest staff ever, never coming back”
Reviews.Author: jgNYC_11
Reviews.Content: When we arrived after a transatlantic trip it turns out that our rooms were not ready but that we could get in at around 3-4 pm (it was 12 pm). No apologies whatsoever. They wanted to put the room charges on the credit card again even though the room was already paid for, only upon insisting they did not re-charge. Then they wanted to put 50 Euros on the card upfront for incidentals. When I was leaving to bridge the time I asked the concierge how to get to the museum and she thought it was her position to teach me to say "please" and "thank you ". Never been treated that badly in any hotel, really felled abused and most unwelcome to the staff Add on top to that that there is no free internet (10 Euros a day) or breakfast (as it frequently is in European hotels) and that the so called free web in the lounge requires a log in sheet from the reception desk for every 5 minute time period, printing decreases the time you can go to the web as it is charged as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nelly65_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week, can't fault it. Mid range hotel great value, clean, good helpful staff. Very central with lovely views over canal and rooftops of city. Will use this hotel again. Helen Ayrshire

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Terri B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in good location close to lots of things.We didnt bother with the breakfast there was a fantastic bakery next door.The room was large and so was the bathroom,it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogerl5154
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was a recommendation by our cruise line. It was a good location, close to the action! The room was quite nice, very clean and modern. We went with the offer that included the Sunday brunch as Amsterdam can be very expensive. The buffet was good with many selections and good food. The only negative was the WiFi, which is available free for a very limited time in the lobby and is rather expensive to use otherwise. "Pet Peave" When you pay over $300 for a night they should throw in the WiFi. If we get to Amsterdam again we would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: irich04
Reviews.Content: Great location, on foot for the center, tram stop next street, polite staff

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Frank103
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights, service was friendly and efficient, my room comfortable and quiet despite the fantastic central location (2 mins walk from the famous flower market). There is free WiFi access in the lobby. Prices are fine for a good hotel in a city like Amsterdam although I do object to charging separately for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Functional--”
Reviews.Author: MaryKop
Reviews.Content: 20+ minute walk from main train station. Less than 5 minutes if you take tram (Buy tickets across the street from the train station; take #1,2 or 5 to Spui. Walk 1 block to hotel). Economy hotel at best. Smelled like MJ (doesn't everything in Amsterdam?). Elevators slow and require key cards. NO handicap access to hotel (at least not that we found). Rooms nicely sized, but A/C barely functional (and controlled by hotel) and streets are noisy. Beds hard and outdated (2 twins=1 "king sized" bed). We received a cot-literally-for our 3rd adult. Very uncomfortable. Bathroom small, but clean and efficient. Really large person would have trouble getting into shower. Staff friendly. Free WIFI in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Adricons
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money except for breakfast. Staff we very nice and friendly. Hotel is perfectly located and rooms are small but seemed new and clean. Would go back. There is a great breakfast a couple of doors along in a popular bar!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice room”
Reviews.Author: travelviking
Reviews.Content: Close to everything - and right by the canal. Rooms modern and clean

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: richieedwards1
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here for a couple of days on a trip to Amsterdam to celebrate our wedding anniversary. I booked the hotel before reading the tripadvisor reviews and it was a good job I did because, had I read all the negative reviews, I probably wouldn't have booked and would therefore have missed out on a cracking hotel. I advised the hotel in advance that this was a special stay for us and they not only upgraded us to a bigger, canal side room, but we arrived back to the room on the second day to find a card wishing us a happy anniversary along with some sweets and a souvenir fridge magnet. The hotel is in a great location, very central and it seems only a 10 minute walk from wherever you want to be, the rooms and public areas of the hotel are clean, tidy and very well appointed, the staff are very friendly and helpful, i wouldn't think twice about booking this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but location could be better”
Reviews.Author: boddicker52
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel for a fair price on Priceline, and overall I was satisfied. It is right off a tram stop, but removed from the Dam. Whenever I am in Amsterdam, I like to be closer to the nightlife and festive atmosphere closer to the Central Station. I did walk back here one night, and another took the tram to the hotel. They offer free internet, but you need to log on with vouchers that are only good for about 13 minutes. The room and hallways don't have the truly sparkling shine of some other hotels, but the front desk staff are very helpful. The air conditioning did not work and was very hard to figure out. Overall, if I won it again for a good price, I would be okay, but I rather try a hotel with a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. GREAT staff. I'd definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: Tahiri1321
Reviews.Content: I agree with some other reviewers that the hotel does not look much from the outside, but in this case it does apply that the inside is what counts. Our room was a good size one, when compared to European hotel rooms. Large flat TV screen. Really comfortable beds where we could rest, and heavy drapes of the kind that tempt you to oversleep. But the BEST two things were: 1. PERFECT LOCATION - in a nice but not overcrowded area, next to cozy coffees and restaurants, and within easy walking distance from all the main attractions. 2. GREAT SERVICE from the staff. We had a problem with the room safe that wouldn't open one night before departing, and were very worried because our passports were inside. We called reception and within 10 minutes the hotel manager was in our room, in a very friendly mood although it was late at night; a master key, and opened it for us. We were really grateful, as we had witnessed a horror story of a friend that once had the same problem in other country (a so called good hotel chain as well), but it took them 3 days to get the safe open.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view !”
Reviews.Author: CMPP
Reviews.Content: We stayed just 3 days at this hotel and although the room was really small, it was nice and clean. I was not expecting such a small room but the view of the canal with all those beautiful houses was really nice. It was my first time in Amsterdam and one advantage is that the hotel is near square Dam where you can go to Madame Tussaud`s museum and there are lots of restaurants and even a big supermarket around. You can have your breakfast around the hotel without any difficulties (it will be cheaper). When I arrived there I didnÂ´t see the canal like the picture where I booked the hotel (thatÂ´s because itÂ´s not the main entrance of the hotel, so when you arrive youÂ´ll see the canal at the back, donÂ´t worry). The only inconvenience I found was that at night going out nearby was not so safe ( it was only an impression, nothing happened at all). This was just at night, during the day it was perfect. Another important thing is that the internet conexion (Wi-fi) is very slow . It will be better only if you use at the lobby (free), so donÂ´t pay to use it in your room if you have a computer.

Reviews.Title: “Practical-Great Location But I Got Lucky”
Reviews.Author: Lex59
Reviews.Content: I lived in Amsterdam and was actually back to visit friends. I was really unwell and unfortunately had to still make sure I met up with all my friends. I even had a friend coming in from Belgium for what I thought would be the day but she stayed overnight with her BF in a separate room--which is how I know I got lucky! My room was a corner room. I honestly would spend most of my day in the room. I was too sick to go out and my friends were working during the day and having lived there I had no need to go explore, I mainly had dinner dates with friends. My room was very large for Amsterdam and I worked in an industry that had used almost every hotel in Amsterdam for events and seen the insides of most hotels. NH City Centre was where I felt was best for me. As stated, the room was huge and nice and had a very comfortable bed, ample desk, closet space and a nice bathroom. I thought the staff were great too, very international and I speak a lot of languages so I would go from Italian to Spanish to Dutch etc and they liked me a lot--I think coming in and speaking to two of them in their native languages (one Dutch) and asking for a good room helped. Now to tell you why I know I got lucky my friend and her boyfriend came and they came together and after a day of walking through the city (he is from Belgium) we went back to their room--WOW WHAT A DIFFERENCE! They had a tiny white boxy room. My room looks just like the room in the photos but I learnt those are the corner rooms ONLY. They also have parking BUT charge a lot for it according to my friend. I showed them my room and they were shocked to see the difference. As for dining-it is overpriced and small portions but decent in taste. Rooms Service, which I did need at the beginning when I was really not well, was ok but not great and it too was overpriced and came very basic-like if you order a salmon expect JUST the salmon not anything with it, you will have to request vegetables or something separately. The staff were really nice but I think that could be because I spoke to them in their languages respectively and they appreciated that-this is something the Dutch specifically love because they are very unaccustomed to having anyone speak Dutch and knowing I came with a non-Dutch passport but spoke Dutch impressed them a lot. BUT regardless they do go out of their way to help you. The internet is a nightmare. You have two choices--you can go downstairs and get these vouchers which give you FREE internet in the lobby or you can stay in your room and get the same wifi at a fee--go figure! All in all I would recommend it, especially if you can butter anyone up to give you a corner room. If not it is still worth it for tourists because Amsterdam is a place most people want to be out and about, for me, having lived there and being unwell, it was more important to have the comfort of the room. In either event I recommend it because it is central, clean and friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “A small space, but all amenities were in place”
Reviews.Author: aliveandfreelondon
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, really small rooms, but ingenious how they fit everything into the small space. Hot water showers was fantastic....and was really quiet. Lovely view of the canal from the room. Will i be back...hopefully, if i can afford it. My only grouse was that free internet was only available in the lobby, not in the rooms...was i being a Scrooge?

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: zijadana
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel! Price was reasonable and the location was excellent. The room was a good size and very clean. The staff was also very helpful and wifi in the lobby was excellent! Would visit again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “The threadbare filthy red carpet sets the tone for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: theinspectorcalls
Reviews.Content: My heart sank as I walked up the filthy threadbare red carpet of the stairs to the main door of the NH Amsterdam City Centre, because I knew this would set the tone for my two night stay here. And it did. The good - itâ€™s a great location, in a reasonable area and within a few minutes walk of the Joordan area (very nice), the 9 streets (quaint), the Red Light area (overpriced), and of course loads of lovely canals and bridges. Late check out which was agreed at checkin until 3pm without extra charge is excellent. They have a very convenient car park under the hotel but beware itâ€™s small and can hold only a few cars and costs â‚¬40 per night. Free WiFi in the lobby is good. The rooms vary in size and configuration, many with three beds. They are good to basic. My main dislike was the uncomfortable beds and the thin cheap towels. The bad â€“ breakfast. Do not prepay for this as they will discount it by 25% if you prebook at the lobby the day before. But donâ€™t, the breakfast is extremely poor quality and a complete rip off at â‚¬15 - â‚¬20. There are many many better places to enjoy breakfast within a few minutes walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, high prices, standard service”
Reviews.Author: NickSimper
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the downtown, in a quite area close to most amenities. The rooms are not too spacious, but there is enough place for two. The bathroom is in a good condition. The service is standard- not excellent, but not too bad. The personnel is kind. The only problems we had during our stay were about arranging of city tours and calling a taxi. There is a shuttle buss to the airport, but we were advised that it would be risky to order it if we do not have enough time in advance to our flight. Amsterdam is an expensive city, the prices in NH Hotel- too, but it is a little strange that guests must pay in addition for breakfast (15- 18 euro per person). Shortly said- NH is a standard hotel, where you can spend two- three nights... But there is nothing special or extraordinary- just a place for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: krishadv
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our kids in NH city centre for 3 nights. The hotel is very good for the family and I can fully recommend. Location is great just near Singel canal and very good connectivity (Trams 1, 2 and 5) to centraal station with the tram stop (Spui) just nearby. Hotel staff at front desk were polite and were helpful to provide us even early check-in and late check-out. Room was spacious, neat and clean. I will definitely stay again next time. We did not take the breakfast optional price as we thought the price was very high and there was no problem to have the breakfast as there are many cafe's nearby and a big supermarket at just opposite next tram stop (Dam).

Reviews.Title: “great location in downtown Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Stoks
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay and, as usual, it leaves little to complain about. The location is perfect, right in downtown Amsterdam but still fairly quiet (do keep your window closed if your room faces the street, though, because of service traffic early in the morning). Lobby decoration can be described as early 20th century. Bar prices are reasonable for downtown Amsterdam. Next door is a fairly touristic but very nice restaurant in a historic setting and down the street, on Spui square is a great place "Beiaard" to sample many different beers next to a tiny statue "Lievertje" that is still famous among former students. Breakfast is too expensive, though, considering what is being offered. I did not try the hotel's dinner facilities, but then, why should I in a place that has hundreds of possibilities in the immediate surroundings. This time, as well as last time I stayed at this hotel I noticed they seem to have cut down on staff: at times there was only one person at the front desk and no waiter in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no good service”
Reviews.Author: Markv4
Reviews.Content: The staff at the reception definitively need some hospitality training. They are NOT guest oriented at all! We had a problem with a reservation, non off the staff could help or at least apologies for the inconvenience... never seen this badly before!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: belandseb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located. It is within walking distance to all the major sights. The Spui tram station is right around the corner. The rooms are very small but was sufficient. The bathrooms were clean and hot water was plentiful. The wi-fi signal was very weak in the rooms so we had to go to the lobby to get a better signal. Definitely try the Indonesian restaurant Kantjil & de Tijger down the street. We went on our very last night and wished we had gone on all the previous nights.

Reviews.Title: “Pro: Location, Con: pver-priced ammenities”
Reviews.Author: whereshouldilive
Reviews.Content: NH City Centre couldn't be in a more ideal location: just off the madness of the Dam Square, but close enough to walk to all the sights (and the lovelier, quieter Jordaan area). For a business traveler: not bad because it is so central to all the areas and main train station. However, be aware that you must pay for wifi in your room. There is "free" wifi in the lobby - but only for 30 minutes (really, 20 minutes by the time you get connected -- very slow). Skip paying for breakfast - very generic, hotel food!! There's a lovely patisserie at the corner. For a tourist: a standard, chain hotel. Why not stay at another smaller 3-star? Sure smaller rooms, but you get the nice Euro experience and better breakfast and free, fast wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasing!”
Reviews.Author: Robin2008
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were really pleased with the NH. It's location in the city was fantastic: in walking distance from Centraal Station and all the usual city centre spots yet still in a reasonably peaceful neighbourhood. The room was surprisingly large, modern, clean and had a great view of the city. Every member of staff we dealt with was very friendly and they let us check out at 5PM on the Sunday afternoon which meant we could make the most of our final day in the 'Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable refusal to honour booking ....”
Reviews.Author: LeLoupDesMers
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. It is well-located, clean and was refurbished quite recently. The staff are pleasant and professional. It provides a solid three-star product at a reasonable price. However, NH have about six hotels around Amsterdam and they typically overbook. When you arrive they may well transfer you to another hotel. This is completely unacceptable in these days of internet booking and credit cards. It is a clear breach of contract and totally unbusinesslike. The transfer is made with lavish promises that it will not cost you more, that they will pay for a taxi etc. but these are mainly not true. If you want to select a hotel for you and your family or you and your friends and all stay in the same place, then do not book NH.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: VivienTO
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel. Major attractions were within walking distance. Streets towards the canal are worth visiting if you're into artisan goods. Breakfast had to be booked upon check-in at 15 euros per person, otherwise pay 19 euros if you decide on the day itself.

Reviews.Title: “Two star hotel in a five star location.”
Reviews.Author: MarcosSix
Reviews.Content: Location is great, right in the middle of everything you might want to see or do in Amsterdam. Staff was nice and arranged another room when we didn't like the first one assigned to us. The first one was big, but dark, had no view at all and we felt spooky. Really bad. The second one was tiny, tiny, small, but at least had a nice canal view. Free wifi only at the looby. Overall, a very basic hotel, with no frills, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and tidy room”
Reviews.Author: Tuike
Reviews.Content: NH Amsterdam City Centre's location is great for shopping ang sightseeing! We got a superior room with a canal view. Our room was very clean and for Amsterdam's hotel it was spacious. The beds were good (not old and too soft) and the room was suprisingly quiet even that it was at the frist floor. The canal view was lovely: water, boats, streets, bridges, trees, people and so on. We didn't have a breakfast in the hotel because it was so expensive. Near the hotel is many little cafes or restaurants, where you can have a breakfast or you can buy sandwiches and fruits from shop (there is a tiny fridge in the room). There are many rather good restaurants at the same street as the hotel. We used to have dinner near the hotel because we were so tired after long days. You get were spicy food from the Indonesian restaurant, which is almost opposite the hotel. It's very popular and there were many locals. NH Amsterdam City Centre isn't trendy or charming hotel but it's worth of money. The location is great, staff is helpful, lobby and the rooms are clean and the canal next the hotel is beautiful. If you are flying to Amsterdam, you better use shuttle bus (mini bus or large taxi)) which come straight to hotel (20 e for two-way ticket). Remember to book the return trip in advance( we did one day before).

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: Grendel456
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Amsterdam and the first time at this hotel. We would stay here again if we were to return. Rooms were small but clean and well appointed. Breakfast was good - but we have had better. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Close enough to trams, shops and restaurants but surprisingly quiet at night. For convienece we used a taxi to get to and from the airport as we were not staying long. However, it was an expensive option at c.48â‚¬ each way. If we went back we would probably investigate the bus or train as a cheaper option. The restaurants are bars nearby are very touristy but convient. We had a great meal at the steakhouse and there was a great bar right at the back of the square where they played great rock music. We went to the Van Gogh museum and like all attractions I would advise getting there early as it gets very busy and you can't get near the paintings.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in City Centre”
Reviews.Author: municali
Reviews.Content: After reading some previous reviews, I was a bit worried about the condition of the hotel, but we were extremely pleasantly surprised. The hotel is centrally located with great access to trams, restaurants, and sights. Our room was recently redone, extremely clean and spacious. While expensive (as is all of Amsterdam), I walked away from our holiday thinking this hotel was worth the money. The free wifi was a pain to sign-on, but a nice asset. Our only complaint was the lack of air circulation during a heat wave over Easter weekend; we were only able to crack our window which didn't cool the room to our liking. Overall, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Cpaws
Reviews.Content: We stay in Amsterdam a couple of times a year and have stayed at this hotel before but not for around 4 years. We decided to stay here for the location which is fab and near the places we like to go. I was worried with it being the Queens Birthday celebration when we were there that they may overbook the rooms and therefore, emailed a week before. Jill from reception was brilliant and checked us in so we would have a room as we weren't arriving until around 7pm. Easy check in and the reception staff were extremely friendly and efficient, we booked a superior room and it was great, canal view on the 4th floor, couldn't have asked for more. Room very clear and I thought is was a large room, especially by Amsterdams standards, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rosebud699
Reviews.Content: Pros Great Location was able to walk to alot of the main sites Good customer service available Free wifi printing(at reception only) Good size rooms Cons Very noisy in the your room Phones usage really expensive

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Gem”
Reviews.Author: MsLBL
Reviews.Content: Clean, Modernized hotel with a great location near the city center. Shuttle to/from the airport and short walk to tram stops. Great restaurants close by, with buffet breakfast in the hotel. Our Queen room with a canal view had a slightly soft bed and was VERY small, but upgraded to a spacious king room which was well worth it and had a wonderful firm bed. Would definitely stay there again. Prepaid room with easy check in. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: fmn13a
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited our needs perfectly. It was in a lovely neighbourhood in Amsterdam yet walkable disctance to the main areas and station. Hotel was clean and comfortable and a good price. Free wifi in the lobby. Breakfast was good choice and lots of it. Managed to get it for 15â‚¬ so cheaper than some hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: StratManLou
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel to stay in and strategically located. It still provides the peace and quiet that one searches for after a hectic day of walking and partying in Amsterdam. The staff are courteous and may be trusted, their management is cordial and in tune with guests requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great canal views, perfect base to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: marinellka
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, it's right in the centre of everything, close to all the attractions, the Red Lights district, Dam square and overlooking a beautiful canal. There are lots of coffee shops around and plenty of really good bars and restaurants, though Dutch food might not be to everyone's liking! In my opinion its the best location you can possibly wish for when visiting Amsterdam The hotel itself is not the prettiest of buildings, but quite modern and definitely what you would expect from a 3 star hotel. I was delighted that the receptionist could offer us a smoking room with a double bed and canal view. Exactly what we wanted! The view is to die for, the windows are really big and even if you stay inside for a few hours resting your tired feet, you still feel a part of the city life. The room was also warm, with a good shower and well stocked up. Of course the hotel is not perfect, as the rooms are not the largest or quietest in the world but you get what you paid for. I've also heard that more upmarket hotels charge an extra 50 euros a night for a canal view, so it's a massive advantage to get it for 'free' here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mustluvdogs0207
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Amsterdam and I got this hotel by naming my own priceline so it was a great deal for me! I was impressed with how cool and modern the room was.
