Although, the television was a bit dated for the room. The bathroom is pretty cool! It was big and spacious! Having internet access is very important to me and this hotel however did not make it easy to access the internet. It is "free" but they give you a voucher which has a code and password on it and it is valid for 30 mins. If you ask me, kind of annoying when you have to keep going down to the lobby to ask for more time! The #1 tram is located right outside the hotel and is very convenient. The #1 Tram also takes you to Amsterdam Central if you are going to catch a train out of the country. Within walking distance is a great bakery in the morning! It has a green awning and is past the McDonalds and is on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, terrible wireless, over priced breakfast”
Reviews.Author: HungryCharles
Reviews.Content: I think my one sentence review sums it up. But, more on the internet. It sucks. They give you 30 minute tickets to use the internet for free in the lobby but it is slow, slow like dial up slow. Then they'll charge you an arm and a leg for an upgrade which you can get in your room and is faster (so they say). True you can get free wireless at cafe's all over town but when you're rockin a laptop you don't want to lug that thing around. Oh yeah, and the breakfast is insanely expensive (19-21 euro I think). But then again everything is expensive in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: missysm23
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to everything, this hotel was a great find. 1 block from the tram and just minutes from any attraction or place you could imagine. On the same block, there was a great bakery, a restaurant that served authentic dutch cuisine and several cafes and pubs. Hotel was clean, staff was very helpful and friendly. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Guaranteed late arrival room was not provided by hotel.”
Reviews.Author: erikleeindianaUSA
Reviews.Content: I Had read a previous post about being overbooked and bumped to another NH hotel with caution. Sure enough, when we arrived the hotel said they had no rooms and gave us an "Upgrade" LOL to the Barbizon Palace by the train station. They provided a taxi for us at no cost to the other hotel. While tellling us we were upgraded, I doubt very seriously it was much of an upgrade at all. So be wary of not having a room when you get to this particular hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay, Plan to Return”
Reviews.Author: Speedball2
Reviews.Content: I just spent about two weeks at the City Centre and was very pleased. No problems recommending the hotel to others and I plan to stay there again the next time I'm in Amsterdam. I was given a small but comfortable room facing a canal. Other than the occasional late-night singers (this is Amsterdam, after all), the room and surroundings were blissfully quiet. The room was spotless and everything worked properly. Just a couple quick notes: --Pretty quick Internet service is available in the rooms at typical high prices. WiFi is free if you work in the lobby (there's a nice lounge off the main lobby where you can work) --Watch out if you bend over in the shower. If you have a big behind like me, you're likely to turn off the water or set it to scalding hot (the voice of experience here) --Note that there's another hotel just a few blocks closer to Centraal Station also called City Center. Make sure you go to the NH one. --Unless it's included in your package, you need to pay extra for breakfast. it's no great shakes -- you'll do better dining at one of the local hangouts close by --Unlike other European hotels, the staff really does read do Not Disturb signs on doors. You won't be pestered with maids shuttling in and out of your room if you want to work during the day. If you don't want service, the front desk will call to make sure you're not dead but they won't pound on your door. As for location, it's great. Lots of restaurants and the American Bookstore just to the south. Go east a couple blocks and you're smack in the middle of the shopping district. Walk north a couple blocks and you're at the Palace and Red Light district. Took me about 30 minutes to walk to the Rijksmuesum (the flower market is on your way). The tram is one block east and is (I think) three stops from Centraal Station on the 1, 2 or 5 lines. All in all, definitely a good value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Time”
Reviews.Author: KrissyT1985
Reviews.Content: No problems with this hotel at all got there and greeted by the friendly staff on reception, checked in and dropped off the bags. the walk we thought seemed like forever to the hotel from Centraal Station turned out to be half the distance we thought it was. Dam Square was about 10mins max, friendly pup to thr right when you leave the hotel and a great chilled out coffee shop if you go out to the left and immediate right to a little lane (Kandinsky) really chilled out a good pre rolls. The hotel is a bit loud at night but only with the window open, but it was also quite warm so we had to put up with it while the room cooled down. Looking to go back and would of been the place we were staying if we didnt know people who live in holland and have offered for us to stay there next time. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: nancemcd
Reviews.Content: Just home from another excellent stay in the NH couldn't fault it again. Arrived early and got into our room right away. Room had great canal view and plenty room, toilet and shower good size also. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!!! You must stay!”
Reviews.Author: LIA_9
Reviews.Content: What can I say for this incredible hotel?! We stayed for 3 nights and we were very satisfied with the room, the staff, the location, the service... Fistly, the staff was always ready to help us. The receptionist, under my request, found me a smoking -double bed - canal view room! Everything cleaned and organised very good. It had tv and also some equipment to do breakfast by yourself! The breaksfast was perfect. From the best I have ever seen. It had everything and it worths, beleave me. The location is very good... is in the center! You needn't take tram. Even from the central station to the hotel! It is 10 minutes. And the tram costs 2.60 euro... It is very expensive and the distances are nothing. To sum up, the hotel is perfect !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Great Staff :)”
Reviews.Author: NandLPaisley
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back after a two night stay. This hotel is in a fantastic location and all the attractions are easily accessed the hotel staff are always on hand to offer their assistance. There are plenty of Italian Restaurants across the road and also a few pubs up from the Hotel and also coffee shops. Amsterdam is a great place i would recommend if you want to do alot of sightseeing to purchase an iamsterdam card free travel on trams also. Everyone is soo friendly in this fantastic city. The Staff are great my partner was freaking out one night and the hotel staff brought up orange juice and gave her loads of assurance and spent time with us making sure she was ok. You really get what you pay for here It may be expensive but the service is outstanding all down to the great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: TAS121
Reviews.Content: Nice, very quiet hotel. Great price. Easy to find and get to with the tram, excellent beds, very comfortable. Right in Leidsplein near the museums and other attractions. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: sandraaw
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in general. A bit of a trek to the attractions. Rooms were clean and were cleaned daily during our stay but the cleaners would not always enter the room until asked - most hotels this is completed whilst you are out and about - this was not the case here. Upgraded to a superior room (large shower but without a bath which was a disappointment) - which was a waste of money on this occasion. Friends stayed in a standard double across the hall and it was as sufficient for a couples break away. (160E in the difference for a four night stay without breakfast) Nice but would not stay here again - too much walking to amenities for a relaxing break

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in good location!!”
Reviews.Author: cybergirlCumbria
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from this hotel,and it was my 5th visit over the years, Few things have changed,you can't get bar food anymore,and the bar only opens from 5 till 10pm,which was a little annoying,but not a big problem The hotel is clean comfortable,and staff are very friendly,and helpful,the bedrooms have been done up a bit since my last visit and are good,value,some of them dont have views but,since you will be out most of the day it dosnt matter,but i got upgraded to superiour room with canal view and the room was lovely. I would recommend this hotel to anyone,on a budget but with a hint of luxury thrown in, if you ask ,or book canal view room. The bathrooms are spotless, with good shower and clean towels every day,tea and coffee facilities in room and a large flat tv with quite a few channels. It is also a very secure hotel with cards not keys,that you use to get in hotel after 10pm and also for the lifts and door to your'e room, I will be coming back later in the year,to amsterdam and i will use this fantastic hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “The best my stay at Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: PavkaR
Reviews.Content: Very high quality hotel for very good price. Friendly personal, nice rooms with absolutly fantastic view to the Singel canal. Comfortable and large bed, very luxury bathroom, all was very clean and new. Very good breakfast! Superb location at city centre, 10 mins. by walk from Dam Square, 5 mins. (Two stops) by tram from Central station, only. All from AmsterdamÂ´s interesting places are a few minutes from hotel. Price is OK for this hotel quality.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service and Great room!”
Reviews.Author: WelshMusician88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Great location 30 secs from main tram stop and 10 min walk from Dam Square and some of the main attractions. Beautiful rooms with plenty of space and a great bathroom. We booked our room with expedia.com. and booked a double room. we had a double room but had 2 single beds pushed together. A litle odd but the beds were comfortable and clean. Had great sercurity which included key cards for main door after 10 pm and key cards for the lifts. The staff were great and easy to talk to with any problems we had. There wasnt a great view out of the room window but as we were out all day it didnt matter. A fantastic, brilliant stay!!! Well recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Needs”
Reviews.Author: MTLSteve
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We booked directly on the hotel website with an advanced purchase discount rate. We were 3 adults and had requested a room with 3 single beds, which we got. The room was surprisingly large, especially for European standards. Plenty of room to move around. Bathroom was simple but a good size. Plentiful hot water in the shower and amenities were refreshed daily (we were there for 3 nights). Bedding was very comfortable, good TV with good selection of channels. Flooring is all laminate floors, so no carpets. We didn't find our room to be exceptionally noisy (we were in Room 151). Our room did not face the street so that helped. There was occasional hallway noise, but nothing out of the ordinary. I'm a pretty light sleeper but had no problems with noise. Very clean, comfortable. Safe in the room which worked fine. I would not recommend this hotel if you're looking for luxury - but if you're looking for a dependable, clean, and comfortable room, this is more than adequate. We would book again in a heartbeat. Only slight concern is that the ventilation in the room is minimalâ€¦ our window did not open and there is no adjustable thermostat. Travelling in winter we found the temperature was comfortable (perhaps a little on the warm side). There is a computer in the lobby for guests to use (with internet and printer). Location was absolutely perfect for exploring Amsterdam. We could walk to almost anywhere we wanted to go, and were with a couple of blocks of many tram lines. Centraal Station is about a 15-minute walk. Around the hotel are plenty of cafes, restaurants, and pubs. It's on a very typically-Amsterdam street. It backs onto the Singel Canal, which is picturesque as most canals in Amsterdam are. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for clean, comfortable, and centrally located accomodations in Amsterdam. If you're looking for a luxurious retreat, this isn't your place, but it is more than adequate for what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and Good location”
Reviews.Author: sharzai
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel, originally we had booked a standard room but had been upgraded free of charge due to the hotel being overbooked. Rooms were very clean and comfortable and hotel was in a good location close to everything. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only negagtive things i would have to say regarding our stay at NH Amsterdam City Centre was that it was slightly noisy (could hear noise outside) and the taxi ride to the airport, booked by the hotel was awful, driver was talking on his mobile phone the whole time and speeding and also overcharged us.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls and poor customer service (but great location)”
Reviews.Author: FlytheTail
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights here and would consider it an "average" hotel in a good location. As others have noted, the walls and doors are very thin and one can hear their next door neighbors and any noise from the hallway. The first room I was given was the smallest room I've ever been in (apart from a bathroom), but fortunately they were able to give me a bigger room the 2nd day. Breakfast is a ripoff, so don't spend the extra money unless it is included in a discounted rate. The location is great and it is clean, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if travelling for pleasure but not for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Hazzles78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, never again. The rooms are too small, the beds are uncomfortable, and it's noisy. Paperthin walls so you can hear your neighbours and single glazing so lots of noise from the street. Other annoyances were lack of free in room Wifi and a very poor quality breakfast. I was given a single room for the first night because they were doublebooked I could actually stand in the middle of the room and touch the walls with each hand. I've stayed in some small European hotel rooms in my time but this actually made me feel claustrophobic. Location is fantastic for sight-seeing, this area of the canal belt is my favourite in all of Amsterdam. Be sure to visit Harry's bar for cocktails (just opposite the hotel entrance on Spuistraat).

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, READ THIS BEFORE U GO”
Reviews.Author: Ervis555
Reviews.Content: hotel location is perfect, close to everything, museums, shops, restaurants, shopping. room- very small, nr. 129, very cold bath, only good thing was the canal view. one peace of shampoon and shower gel for 2 people. did not tidy the room on the second day of stay. thin walls - could hear everything what your neighbours been doing, coming lste, hitting doors and etc. very expensive for this kind of room, make sure to get a good deal on the room, avoid the breakfast, because there are many nice cafes to have breakfast, hotel breakfast very expensive. you can get full english breakfast for 9 euros in the flower market cafe. all of this did not let us down, we were happy to be in AMS in s great location, that was our priority nr1. make sure u visit restaurant RANCHO for a dinner un the leidsplein food and bar area. avoid restaurants in the dam square, very price and the food is crap. drinks are also expensive, funny thing the was not working in the hotel, here u go NH :) if u need more info email me.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: englishrose712
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms, very comfy beds (and nice thick curtains so you get a proper nights sleep!) i was very happy with the hotel it was so central, we walked everywhere, nice places to eat nearby, the staff were very friendly, the rooms were very clean and well presented and the beds were very comfy. good shower too. Was good value compared to other similar hotels we looked in the area and we booked this hotel on the basis of the trip advisor reviews which didn't let us down! definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seat28B
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Amsterdam some years ago, I chose this hotel purely for the location and had low expectations of the hotel itself. I was not disappointed. The room was one of the smallest that I have encountered in many years of travelling, the public areas were unappealing and the breakfast was well below average. The trade off is the location which is slightly removed from the main tourist drags of Amsterdam, but still within walking distance of them. In addition, a 1 minute walk from the hotel brings you to many excellent cafes, bars and restaurants, most of which mainly cater to Dutch clientele. If you are visiting Amsterdam for the first time and are just staying for 1 or 2 nights, this hotel is worth considering simply for the location. However, for anything longer, find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: YogaGirlMI
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in September. The location is awesome, really can walk to just about anything. We booked a package through Delta so our package included breakfast each day. The breakfast was a nice hot and cold buffet which includes pastries, breads, lunch meats/cheeses, yogurt, fruit, eggs, bacon/sausage, pancakes, juice, etc. The secured parking at the hotel was about 32 euros/night. The room was clean however, we had a triple and weren't happy with the beds. The room had 2 twin beds shoved together and a third twin by itself. Having not stayed in a triple room before in Europe, maybe this is the norm? In any case, the beds were not very comfortable. We were disappointed that the window in our room did not open as it got rather hot and stuffy in the room. There was no in room A/C, however the downstairs breakfast room did have it. We stayed here with our young son and it seemed the hotel was a lot of business travelers and other adults. I don't think we saw any other kids during our stay. If you're looking for an awesome, central location, this would be a good choice. We wouldn't come back here because the beds were just not very comfortable and we weren't happy with the bed configuration. But, maybe this is just how triples are set up in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel loved it”
Reviews.Author: JenniferAnnetravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with two other friends on a sightseeing trip to Amsterdam. Having thought Amsterdam might be a dodgey kind of place we opted for this 3 star accommodation. We found this hotel to be a perfect location (provided you dont mind a short 20-30mins walk), so we could travel on foot to both the central station, and in the opposite direction from the hotel, the museum quarter. The hotel is in a good area (no red lights until you get nearer the centre !!!) and has a nice bakery a few doors down for breakfast and some restaurants you could have an evening meal/lunch in. Our room was very clean and had very modern decor with a flat screen TV. The bathroom was a good size and also kept immaculate. The only down side was that there was no breakfast, not sure if that is a common feature of hotels in Amsterdam though. Would recomend this hotel to anyone, it is good for the price and staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and staff were not bothered”
Reviews.Author: Ayoba
Reviews.Content: Travelled here as a group of four (2 couples) and booked two rooms through lastminute.com. On arrival around 9 pm we were told they were overbooked (can never understand how this happens in the times that we live in!). Sat around waiting for a taxi to take us to what was apparently a 5 star hotel for one night. We then waited around for almost an hour to check in there. Next day we had to check-out, store our luggage for the day, then relocate our luggage back to the orginal hotel. Wasted maybe 4 or 5 hours with all the waiting around, packing, unpacking, etc. What did we get from management as compensation? - A small tube of Pringles and a cheap plastic hotel branded suite bag!!! Must say I really felt appreciated.... Then to top it off I found the previous occupant of the room's customer survey card had not even been collected - shows how much they value your opinion! Its not like I wanted something for nothing... all I wanted was the hotel that I booked months in advance for the days that I booked it! Is that too much to ask?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PortugalTravelerP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the centre of Amsterdam - walking distance to most sites in Amsterdam. Very close to tram stop also. The room was small but with all the basics. Soft bed, good sleep quality. I had a view to the canal. Good service in general - staff is always ready to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GythaOgg1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the NH City Centre for 3 nights, and we were very pleased with the hotel overall. We had a standard room which was very comfortable and reasonably spacious - I was expecting it to be much smaller, but we had plenty of space. The room was minimally but nicely decorated in brown/beige, and had a nice big window which we could open - the window had a blackout blind and thick curtains, and despite our window facing down onto the busy Spui area the room was nice and quiet with the window closed. We had a double room which had 2 single beds pushed together instead of a double bed, however the beds were extremely comfortable. The TV in the room had a decent selection of channels. Bathroom was small but perfectly adequate, with a good shower, hairdryer and plenty of towels. The room included a kettle, fridge and safe - the fridge is very handy if you want to pick up food and drinks from the supermarket. The hotel offers smoking rooms. Staff were friendly and helpful. The location cannot be beaten - just up from Spui, 10 minute walk to Dam Square and 10 minutes to Leidseplein - there is also a tram stop very close to the hotel. Only drawback I can think of is that there is no air con or fans in the room - the rooms get very warm in the sun and a means to cool the room down would be ideal (I believe they have fans available from the front desk, but these should be provided in each room). Overall the NH City Centre is a pleasant hotel and we would definitely consider staying here again on our next trip to Amsterdam. Make sure to check the rates on different booking sites - we got an excellent rate through Agoda.

Reviews.Title: “Central for everything”
Reviews.Author: nancemcd
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice of hotel for location, comfort and friendly staff. We were allocated a room on first floor overlooking canal great view, room size was excellent, as were shower and toilet. This hotel is so easy to return to if you have had shopping trip and need to off load your buys. Staff were very friendly and helpful in anything we asked. As this is our 5th time in Amsterdam I must say this is the best hotel we have stayed at yet and hopefully we will be using it again.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok for the price, probably wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: JenTexas
Reviews.Content: If you're on a budget this is decent hotel to stay at. I booked the hotel on orbitz and they didn't have the reservation in their system but easily entered in all my information. It wasn't a problem and they were really nice and efficient. The staff were great the entire time. A few complaints though: Its been really hot in Amsterdam this summer and on their website they say that they have air conditioning. They do NOT have a AC control in the rooms so its really warm. The rooms are old and tired but clean. The TV was in an awkward place and I had to move the chair at the desk in order to actually see it from the bed. The bathroom shower took a while to drain too. ugh. They say they offer free internet in the lobby, but its in 30 min increments so if you have work to do, this can get frustrating. I think its 25 euros per night, which is ridiculously pricey. If you're looking for a no-frills place in a good location this is definitely a good option but I'll probably try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: charliechunk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a romantic break. The hotel was excellent, the rooms were very clean and tidy and the restaraunt was lovely too and it served a really good buffett breakfast. The hotel itself is central so not far to walk to any of the major attractions. I thought this hotel was good value and if we were to visit Amsterdam again, then we would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: anhei
Reviews.Content: this is a very nice hotel at a very central location in Amsterdam. Modern rooms and bathrooms, friendly staff and surprisingly quiet despite the location. Will go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dusty290
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night trip to Amsterdam, staying in the NH City Centre hotel. The reception staff were great and helpful and the room was fantastic. Whilst we were on the road side (as oppossed to the canal side) it was little noisy in the morning and you can't leave your window open during the night but that was the only thing wrong (and this isn't the hotel's fault at all, it is a city centre after all). The location was great and you can walk to everything from the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody and would happily stay here again when I visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “over priced but great location”
Reviews.Author: Rita900
Reviews.Content: Front desk Woman on arrival was not the friendliest. Had written prior to arrival requesting a canal view room as we were staying for 7 days wanted a view and received what I think was the smallest room in the hotel facing other room windows. No airconditioning in rooms, but in halls and lobby. Was given a fan so that made it easier to tollerate the heat in the room. Leave your bathroom door open and the constant fan does circulate air in the room. Can't get to the closet without moving the chair. l chair for 2 people. Rooms do need some updating. Had seen other rooms that were much nicer than our in regards to layout and space. Jennifer (trainee), Jill and Josh on the Front desk were just wonderful staff. Location is what makes this place. You can walk to all interesting tourist sites. Restaurants and cafe's galore. Beware, DO NOT GO to the Itallian Restaurant on the corner, Caprese, very overpriced and the portions were so small, I went away hungry. Service was awful, the waiter tried to charge us for our second glass of wine which we ordered and never did receive. The waiter was quite the smarty pants character not trained well at all. The "Five Flies" gourmet restaurant next door was just okay for us. We ordered a bottle of water never received, a half hour later the waiter asked is we wanted water on our table, we said no as we were half way done our dinner. Meal was nice presentation but again portions small. We had asked for the hotel special meal with the special price and was kind of given the impression that was not the thing to ask for. They did change the choice for us as we did not like the Guinea Fowl on the menu. Beautiful restaurant but pricy. The restaurant Haesje Claes across the street was a very nice, nice small rooms with very good service. We had the menu for 22 E and was very satisfied with the meal, typical Dutch meal. Humphrey's more modern restaurant, set price menu for everyone 23.50E good selection and the service was good and the food nicely presented. We also ate at a Rancho restaurant on a side street, good meal and a great price per person, menu once again. For lunch we stopped at a little Italian restaurant, (ll Palio) in the Leidsekruisstraat street, very old place, pizza was 5E, pasta 5E you couldn't go wrong. The pasta was almost twice the size of what I paid 14E for on our street and much more tastful. Went to the Windmill and beer brewry. Great place. Open from 3pm until 8pm daily. Recommend you sit at the bar inside talk to the bar tenders and people watch. We stayed for a couple of hours and it was alot of fun. Staff are great. Beer average price but you have to see it to believe it. Look it up on TripAdvisor to find you way there. Easy by tram. Down from our hotel was the Brown Bar Hoppe is a real beehive in the evenings and the bar itself is just beautiful inside. The cafe next door is also a pleasant place to stop and have a few pints and people watch. Went on a tour booked through the hotel. Tour company name was Lindbergh. The tour was Volendam, Marken and Windmill Village by bus and boat, 5 1/2 hours leaving at lpm in the afternoon. The tour guide spoke perfect English, Spanish and Itallian, nice and loudly for all to hear. That was the end of the good part of the tour. We left early, which was nice, arrived in Marken with another larger tour arriving at the same time to see the wooden shoe maker and shop. We had to wait outside till they finished. Half our group didn't listen and went in with the other tour. We went next and again two gentlemen held up the whole tour shopping and came out with nothing. We walked through the town, our guide never said one word about the town but went straight to the boat dock we boarded and off we went to Volendam. Arrived, nice boat ride, and we walked down about l block our guide told us to meet back here in l hour 20 minutes, have lunch and then we would do a walking tour and go to a museum. We had lunch, waited once again for everyone to arrive, walked through town, not one word from the tour guide about Volendam, entered the museum just before they were closing. There again was no information orated only pictures and things for you to read. We came out our guide couldn't find our bus. It was no where to be found. The other tour group gave us their bus to go to the Cheese Factory as it was close. Our bus showed up after we were all loaded and ready to go so he followed us to the factory. Cheese presentation was a talk as the factory was not operating. The fellow was very informative but again it was short and then we all herded into the shop to taste and buy cheese. We had to wait for the other tour to finished at the factory as we were taking a couple of their people on our bus, why not sure. Wasting our time once again. Off to the Windmills, and Village. Windmills, not operating, Village was closed, Even the bathrooms were not available. Our guide once again did not give any information about the windmills stayed by the bus and waited for us to come back from seeing really nothing. Disappointing for many people as they thought they would tour, or at least see a windmill in operation. I did speak to the guide and told her how disappointed we were in the tour. Her lack of information about Marken, Volendam, Museum, Windmills, and lack of control of her tour. To us it was a bus and boat ride not a tour and for this we paid 37Euro. The only talking she did was when we were leaving the Windmills and she described how the area once was under water etc. A talk the lasted maybe 4 minutes and that was it. Very poor guide, smoking constantly while waiting for us at each location, (not appropriate). We did find out if you go on the tour in the morning you do get to see the village and the Windmills in action and for 32Euros. Too bad no one told us that from the beginning. Our hotel did not know this either. Save your money go on your own if you can. It will be much more enjoyable. The plus was we met some very nice couples and also a couple of very rude men. The breakfast in the hotel is expensive but so are all the hotels for breakfast, there is a large choice and the convenience of not having to run out to find a place is worth it. Book your hotel bed and breakfast and it is cheaper for your meal. Staff in the restaurant again were very friendly and very efficient. Lobby computer access was very good, they could use one more computer and let you have abit longer. You get 15 minutes and it takes almost 3 minutes to log on. But it is free and that is good. Get you free ticket at night for the next morning as it can be very busy at the front desk with people checking in and out. We left to early for our paid for breakfast on the last day, but was given a picnic bag to go with fruit, juice and sandwiches, very nice touch, thank you. Taxi arrived on time and the check out was smooth. Nice hotel, not cheap, efficient staff in a great location. Would recommend for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well its a hotel, not a good one, but a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danthetravel
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny and tired looking, veiw from room was of other peoples windows (not nice or private at all) food was BAD. There is not iron, but there is an ironing room, which we found on the last day, a note in the room would have been helpful very good location

Reviews.Title: “Room that smelt like a festival toilet!!”
Reviews.Author: samantha7880
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a typical 1920's style building with all its features however it could do with a lick of paint in areas. It was beautiful with all you need in the rooms. BUT... The staff I talked with were not the friendliest bar one gentleman. After my first nights stay I was woken by the very over whelming smell of urine and faeces from the on suite bathroom. When I asked to change room the receptionist did not appear at all surprised nor did she feel the need to apologise! I was told no other rooms were available as they were expecting a tour group arrival that day but she would have maintenance and cleaning see to it. I returned to my room to find the bedroom window open but no evidence of any cleaning. Chat with reception left me in the same room waking to a gut churning smell and feeling like a nuisance tourist. As if this were not enough my friends had over 300 euros stolen from their room to which the unhelpful receptionist simply said that this is unlikely as nothing like it had happened in 25yrs. Rant over but be advised.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Good Price”
Reviews.Author: TonyD285
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH City Centre for three nights, June 6 through June 9. The room, typical of Amsterdam, was quite small but clean and pleasant. The bathroom was tiny but had all the amenities. Our window looked out onto a wall with the windows of other rooms. Thankfully, this made for a quiet stay as the street could be fairly noisy - several restaurants and bars. The breakfast buffet was excellent, the bar a quiet and enjoyable place to have a drink. Next door is a 4-star restaurant which translates from the Dutch as the "Five Flies." It was pricy but superb and I highly recommend it if you want a gourmet Dutch meal.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, UNCLIMATIZED rooms - but great location”
Reviews.Author: Nubiane
Reviews.Content: For a long-weekend trip to Amsterdam, we (mid-thirties-couple) chose the nh Hotel. We booked the hotel based on Internet-research via an online-system. When we arrived, our tiny (approx. 12mÂ²) room on th 5th floor was almost 30Â°C as it got full afternoon-sunlight. As there is no fan nor air-condition and only a small window to be opened, we were suffering a lot - Beginning of June is not highest temperature season, we will not imagne what happens in August! This room had also twin beds, although we've booked a regular double room. We switched rooms next morning to an equal room in the 2nd flloor - same temperature but different sun exposure - and a regular bed. We requested a fan at the reception and got it promptly delivered at our room- which made the stay a little bit more convenient. We therefore stayed in two rooms which both had following characteristics: - no air condition or fan - very small - large mordern flatscreen - clean - modern - great view - complete exposure to sunlight with no possibility to lower room temperature The hotel is located directly in the city center and in a very interesting area - which makes it PERFECT for tourists. Garage/ day: 35â‚¬ Staff was nice, VERY helpful and even did our room-switching move (we only had to prepare our suitcases) ----->AVOID in summer, perfect fit for citytrips in spring, fall or winter!!!

Reviews.Title: “NH City Center”
Reviews.Author: Kroesus
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very good location, breakfast is not very exciting. Hotel is located very central in downtown Amsterdam within the inner grachten, walking distance to museum area and central train station. Comparably quiet. Hotel itself offers a good standard concerning room and technical equipment, Wifi only free of charge in the lobby area, bar is closing very early, however no shortage of pubs, bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood, no gym and spa. Breakfast is not up to the standard, just basic dishes offered.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: sralls
Reviews.Content: Clean simple rooms in a nice hotel located in the centre of town. An easy walk with a heavy suitcase from the Spui Tram stop. Serves a nice breakfast with a resonable spread of items to choose from. For an Amsterdam Hotel the room had plenty of space (we had 3 in the room).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Modern, Clean, Reasonably Priced Rooms”
Reviews.Author: EBach_SanDiego
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. A newer building, more modern than many other hotels I've stayed in nearby. Clean bathroom, good Internet access. I had a nice size corner room. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “perfect great location”
Reviews.Author: redspacedust
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel for 2 nights with my partner and friends excellent location just off dam square 5 min walk. breakfast was excellant could eat as much as you like and plenty of choice. booked a standard room but for some reason we were upgraded to a superior. the room was spacious clean and had everything we needed. we arrived early (10.30am)and they let us book in early. staff very helpful and pleasant. would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, I recommend if youÂ´re not looking for a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: manu070
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice street, with lots of bars and restaurants, close to Dam Square and the Flower Market. The rooms are big, but a little old - the carpet floor, bathrooms. Nice and friendly staff. Basic but good breakfast. If I had to, IÂ´d stay there again, but aware that itÂ´s not a five star or luxury place.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, rude staff, but good location!”
Reviews.Author: MarinaFM
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights in April 2010. We were booked into a "superiour" room, but when we arrived they put us into another room at the first floor (the same floor of the lobby...) . It was the noisiest hotel i've stayed in for a long while. The room doors slam so incredibly loudly in the middle of the night and the recepcionist said that he didnÂ´t heard anything. Hear every one entering/exiting their rooms and peaple talking very loud at the hall (24 hours a day). When we check out the receptionist was OVER charging us â‚¬30,00 without a reason! The price is too expensive considering the Hotel should be 2 star and not 3... Very, very rude staff!!!! Only 2 of 6 were polite, the rest were very agressive, impatient...

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Banko-DK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business and extended the stay for the weekend with my partner and really enjoyed the hotel. The hotel is located in my favourite part of Amsterdam (close to Leidseplein/Vondelpark) and the rooms are extremely comfortable. Postiive: Good breakfast Nice and quiet rooms Good italian restaurant at the hotel Attentive staff Negative: No free wifi The hotel is very big, meaning you can easily feel a bit "anonymous" as guest, but all large hotels have this feeling if you are only staying a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: London_Kip
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very reasonably priced for its central location. Right next to the Leidse Plein. So I would recommend it for this reason! We got a very good deal which I was very happy about. I have been to Amsterdam many times so I can thoroughly recommend this location as it is safe and easy to move around the centre. You can walk most places from here and hire bikes nearby. There are many tram stops servicing the city from Leidse Plein area. Regarding the hotel, the room was very small and the A.C did not work, maintenance could not fix the problem, but it wasn't too much of an issue as we were not in the room too much. The hotel is furnished to a high quality and the breakfast was consistently good and very busy. However I have rated the service low as I felt that the reception staff needed to learn some manners as when we were queuing to check in we overheard one of the receptionists being quiet rude and direct to another guest who had some billing issues. This was not a great first impression.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: amphyUk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location right in the middle of the city centre. The room size was alright but the bathroom was a bit too small - no bath only shower. The shower corner wasn't properly covered so the floor could cover with water after you took a shower. The staff was very helpful and you can use the internet and print out for free for an hour which is very helpful. We went there in May so it could be hot at day time and we couldn't find a way to open the window. But in general we were quite happy as it is convenient and the room and bathroom is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: Nadine2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in March 2010. When we arrived the receptionist was OVER charging me â‚¬200. The rate we got orignally was â‚¬172 per night which was expensive considering the Hotel is not 4 star or even 3 for that matter! We were booked into a "superiour" room. This it wasn't! The room was up on the fifth floor and once you opened the door of the room you had 20 steep thin steps up before you could actually get into the room. Floors were dirty, light bulbs were gone, Toilet was dirty and in general the hotel was not up to standards. The only good thing about the hotel was the breakfast, but unfortunately the staff were very rude. Ok location but nothing spectacular. And the street it's on isn't very safe either.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i have stayed at in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lfcmad2002
Reviews.Content: I managed to get a superb deal via Onhotels for this hotel,The hotel is a 15 min walk from station,or a 5 min tram ride 1 or 5 from outside station (2.60 single) The hotel is located in Spui and this is great as it take 5 mins to walk to Dam Square and around the same to Leidsaplein.You can also get shuttle bus from Airport direct to the door.The hotel is very nice,staff are smartly dressed and orginized,Hotel has a double lift,Resturant,lounge.I stayed in a single room and it was very nice.Large single bed,desk,safe,LCD tv,nice bathroom with shower.Best sleep i have ever had as bed was so comfy.No noise in Hotel or outside,Well heated and also has windows that can open.Breakfast is well orginized with plenty staff on hand.Buffet inc breads,rolls,bacon,suasages,fruit,teas,coffee etc If you want central hotel with a Holiday inn type feel and can get good rates then this is the one to choose..I will be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “well located average 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: its a normal hotel very well located walking distance to everything if your main interest is shopping this hotel is one block to the main shopping pedestrian street lobby and hotel in general with lack of character rooms very simple but mine at least on the large side my rate was expensive for a 3 stars hotel isnt an hotel to remember but on the other side everything works smooth here and i found nothing particulary annoying for a short business stop over its a perfect hotel if you want to indulge yourself find another option internet at the lobby for a fee at this point i expect this to be free considering the rate

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations and Service”
Reviews.Author: Burtimus
Reviews.Content: The hotel's accommodations and service are excellent. Rooms are spacious by European standards. Single beds are pushed together to make a double bed. Internet in business center is available at 5 Euros for 15 minutes which is relatively expensive compared to rates at internet cafes. If breakfast is not included with room package, it can be purchased for 19 Euros, a bit expensive compared to breafasts in nearby cafes. Location of hotel is ideal to the nearest tram stop which is one block away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible beds.”
Reviews.Author: Risteardo
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel for it's location, but for the price they charge, I do expect to get a good night's sleep. We booked a double room so I expected a double bed. We got twin beds instead. I could have tolerated that if they were comfortable but they were terrible. They were way too soft and I woke each morning with a sore back, as did my wife. For this reason alone, I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachyf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days. Upon check in the staff where very helpful and spoke very good english like everybody in Holland. The room we had was small but big enough for a city break as you don't spend much time in you room. The bed linen was clean and changed often. The decor was simple and clean in the hotel and the room. The room had a hairdryer and a TV and also a free safe in the room. The location of the hotel is a 1minute walk to Spui 1 minute walk to Dam. It is a very cental location for all tansport so this makes it easy to travel to all the attractions that Amsterdam has to offer. I would definatley stay at this hotel again, it is very nice indeed. I am a well travelled person and have stayed in luxurious 5star right down to the worst hostels around the world. This hotel has everything you need in a city break hotel and would recommend this hotel for all including families as I noticed there was alot of families staying at this hotel when we where here.

Reviews.Title: “great views”
Reviews.Author: mrbighead
Reviews.Content: If you stay at this hotel ask for a room with views to the inside of the building. Forget about the channels, the fun is inside! My room had views to a girls room and every night I got to see this hot blonde getting naked. It was awesome!! I would recommend it to every voyeur in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chopperunderground
Reviews.Content: Huge, gorgeous room! would definitely stay there again. Great location, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “We love Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TomBamber
Reviews.Content: First time that we have been to Amsterdam as tourists as opposed to visiting on Business. The hotel is at "twenty to" on the map and within the canal region. We took a cab from the airport (45 euros). Checked in but the room we were allocated was very small and not somewhere we would like to spend any time. We were happy to pay for an upgrade but were offered a fantastic ground floor room overlooking the canal at no extra cost. Breakfast is 19 euros and great of you are starving - otherwise walk up the road for a cheaper croissant & coffee. The hotel is situated in a quiet upmarket area with plenty of quiet and relaxed bars and restaurants nearby. Dam Square is 10 mins walk, Canal cruise 5 mins walk, main shopping area 5 mins, i.e., its all there. Staff a really helpful. Couldnt fault it. Give it a go!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant first time in amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: bluestar001
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, rooms basic, they lent me a hairdryer! very close to various shops, canal flower market, coffee shops, mcdonalds, shopping centre, etc brilliant for couples, they

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinMoose
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a weekend break, location is excellent, staff were all very helpful and friendly, room was spotlessly clean and very quiet. best hotel we've stayed in the dam by far

Reviews.Title: “Valuable and central located”
Reviews.Author: Koreansk
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from the central station and very central located with many restaurants, bars, cafes surrounding and half side of building has a canal view if you are willing to pay little bit more. We were luckily to upgraded to triple room so very specious but, not sure about the size of double room. Reception is always busy with many customers and groups but, friendly enough and smile less. Flat TV, Kettle, Hair-dryer, Toiletries etc but, chargeable EUR 2 for a bottle of small water in the fridge and the fridge is empty except water. 3FL has an iron room where you do yourself. Corridor looks like nursing home and 2 elevators for about 5th floor building, EXIT sign visually OK. About EUR 90 per night during the weekend in central Amsterdam? It's very valuable and good enough even without breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: tryfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about half a mile from the railway station and ideally situated for visiting most of the main sights. We walked everywhere very easily but keeping our eyes on the ground to avoid the dog mess - more than any city we have ever visited! Although rather soulless, the rooms were very well-equipped and cleaned thoroughly every day. Breakfast was expensive at 19 euros so we avoided this and used the many cafe nearby. There are many good bars and restaurants very close to the hotel. There is free internet access for 15 mins at any time.

Reviews.Title: “WOW.......EXCELLANT HOTEL WOULD RECOMMEND....”
Reviews.Author: iluvamsterdam
Reviews.Content: wow,wow,wow,wow........what a great hotel, the staff are very helpful and the rooms are spacious. would recommend this hotel to everyone. the beds are comfortable and you even get a pillow menu. we stayed in room 25 and had a excellant view on the singel canel. the hotels breakfast is the best breakfast my husband and i have ever had in a hotel, the selection of food is huge, if you don.t find anything there you like to eat then you must be mad...lol also breakfast times are great as thay are from 7am-11am. this hotel is only a short walk (about 3min) from dam square. there is plenty to do and a must is the city bus tour which you also get a trip to the diamond factory in with the price of 12euro........this hotel is a must and i would highly recommend that this hotel would be ideal for anyone............................

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: michlaustn
Reviews.Content: We went on the 26th of December and left on 29th December. It is about a 20 minute walk from Amsterdam central train station, but so are the majority of the city hotels I guess. The hotel does not look to be much from the outside. However when you enter it is a nice surprise. The lobby is very nicely decorated with wood panelling. When we arrived, Christmas decorations were on display again nicely done and not at all tacky. The staff are very helpful and speak excellent English. If you require help or directions asking at the check-in desk is a great idea. In addition the lobby has a display stand with a number of advertisement cards for the local tourist attractions. The majority of these cards provide money off or free gifts. For example we used the card to get 5 euro off the entrance fee to the Torture Museum. The standard rooms are extremely pleasant. They are quite spacious and nicely decorated. Ours had a fridge, satellite TV with many English speaking channels, and tea/coffee making facilities. The standard rooms only have a shower, although ours was a very large shower. We were also provided with soap, shower gel and shampoo (all smelt of oranges and were quite pleasant). The rooms also feature one way window blinds and a radiator with adjustable temperature settings. WIFI is available, however it is a little expensive and costs 10 euros for 24 hours. However a computer in the lobby is available for guests to use for up to 15 minutes free of charge. If you find that the pillows provided in the room are not to your taste, then it is possible to contact reception and they can provide you with new pillows to your own taste (soft/fluffy/hard). However I do not know if this is a service for which you will be charged. Breakfast was great with a good selection breads. In addition to hams, chesses and preservatives. Bacon, Sausages and Eggs(boiled and scrambled) were also available as well as fruit juice and water. During the evening a bar is opened, however we did not visit so I do not know how much it costs. The location is good and generally within walking distance to most sights. It is close to the main shopping streets so if you fancy doing some shopping it is handy. H&M, River Island, Mcdonalds, Department stores and Subway are all close by. If you do plan on sight seeing, I would strongly advise that you get a city map from the hotel reception, it has all of the main sights marked on and the hotel can mark the location of fast food places and the hotel. We used ours to navigate to each of the sights, so it came in very handy, without it we would no doubt have become extremely lost. The only downside is that on arrival you are required to give a credit card number in, or to pay a 50 euro deposit to cover and costs that you may incur whilst staying there e.g. for using the mini bar or making phone calls. However when you check out you are given back the 50 euros you paid. If you plan on staying in Amsterdam and want a very central hotel within reach of almost all sights, then I highly recommend this hotel. In the future if I return to Amsterdam then I will be sure to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TripleDDDNashville
Reviews.Content: Booked on Priceline and was not disappointed. With the Euro so strong, we were lucky to get a break on the hotel. Our room was spacious, king bedded with a view of the main street.at the outdoor flower market. The hotel is within walking distance of Dam Square and the tram passes right by the door. Service was excellent but in Holland perhaps that is redundant. There are many cafes on the street near the Flower Market for a traditional Dutch Pancake breakfast. HIGHLY recommend this hotel when you want to explore Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good rates, decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JetsettingSi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with friends for a business trip which i extended for the weekend. The hotel was tidy, we had a twin and the beds were comfortable. The only quibble was that its location was a short way out of the city centre, but then that's were you get the value. Good hotel, good rates and I heard as I was leaving that they have a fantastic Japanese restaurant on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: happytobetheone
Reviews.Content: My children , my husband and me went for a summer holiday in Amsterdam and we enjoyed it a lot thanks to NH City Centre, the hotel we were staying at for a week. The location was great, the service was wonderful and we all felt so hugged and caressed. It was wonderful for us as a family, we really needed it and we recommend it highly. By the way, we paid 110 $ for a room which I believe is quite fair, through last minute travel.com. Although it is rated as 3 stars hotel, I would think it is a 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i cannot believe all the rubbish i read on here before i went”
Reviews.Author: britto_9
Reviews.Content: i have to say after all the comments i read i had a few resevations regarding rooms smell and size , i looked at the pictures and thought well they look ok to me after all i am only sleeping there. anyway everything was perfectly fine in my opinion ! comfy beds, nice quilts and bedding all super clean, fresh towels hot water, tv,saftey deposit for free, Also not mentioned anywhere in details was that we got supplied with shower gel,shampoo, and a hairdryer was in room too. breakfast was included in our deal and was a good start to the day. whether we just was lucky with our room i dont know ,we never had a few but to see amsterdam you aint gonna see it from your room r u ? oh a bit of sarcascm thrown in. location ,room, breakfast, security,staff all great..

Reviews.Title: “Cosy yet Stylish”
Reviews.Author: tulieps
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with 3 pax, interior was stylish yet cosy. Greeted with a friendly 'hip' staff. Location was fair. Minus the rainy weather we had, the hotel was a comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & professional hotel in absolutely superb location”
Reviews.Author: SJMoffoot
Reviews.Content: This is perfectly located in a pleasant area of Amsterdam, by the canal, a reasonable walking distance from all the major attractions. Staff were very professional and helpful - we arrived at around 11am on our first day to leave our bags until check-in time, and we were given a room straight away. Hotel was quiet, comfortable, and clean - although the cleaners did come into the room while we were still asleep one morning! Use the Do Not Disturb sign!! Personally, on my next visit I will look for a more 'Dutch' hotel, but if you want to be guaranteed all the comforts and service that come with a large hotel chain, then this place won't let you down! Some excellent deals to be had on late bookings too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for people who need an elevator”
Reviews.Author: HappyOnTheRiviera
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam hotels are often filled with treacherous, narrow stairs, so when I took my 82 year old mother to Amsterdam, I looked for a hotel with an elevator and a central location. The NH City Centre worked out very well. The location is terrific for well-priced, eateries, historic sightseeing and bargain shopping. The rooms that face the busy Spuistraadt are slightly noisy from traffic, but the double glazing on the windows help. Some rooms are renovated and get more light. Ask for a room facing the canals. The overall De Stijl decor in the hotel's common rooms is fascinating, and worth poking around to enjoy. My only disappointment was the shuttle that runs to and from the airport. I thought it would be a great help with my 82 year old mother, but it took us on too-long a milk run to other hotels and the NH hotel staff indicated to me it was unreliable. I ended up taking a taxi to the airport with my elderly mother, although had I been by myself, using public transportation from the hotel would have been easy.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, efficient, in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: traveler00962
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH City Centre for two nights while ending a business trip to Amsterdam. Upon checking in, I inquired whether there might be a room with a view, and I was upgraded to a larger room on the 5th floor (do ask about upgrades when checking in!). First the bad news - when finding my room number, I was a bit confused with two room numbers combined in one signage. Upon opening the secured door, I realized there were approximately 20 steep steps that required navigation up to my final destination, and with no bellman to greet me, I had to lug my 50+ lb suitcase up the steep flight. Upon entering the room, I found it reasonably spacious, clean, and surprisingly - the large windows opened up onto a rooftop patio, from which I could see the city below. Bed was comfy, room was quite (despite the comments of other reviewers, although it might have been because room 529/530 are secured behind a separate door). I agree with the other negative review about the toiletries in the room - poor quality, and no conditioner. Also no tub, just a shower. Small refrigerator in my room, with 2 large bottles of water for purchase inside. All in all, I would stay here again - nice enough hotel and the location is absolutely perfect for taking in the sights of Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location, just falls short of being an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NawabofDelhi
Reviews.Content: For folks visiting Amsterdam the first or second time on a tight time line, this is a fairly good choice. The location is handy, with almost all the major tourist sites being walking distance away or at best a short tram ride. The place is dotted with abundant cafes,bars & restaurants. Stayed here for 2 nights on the 19th & 20th of September,the property is a short tram ride away from Station Centraal (trams 1,2,& 5) pass meters away from here,was upgraded to a superior room on arrival. The good parts about the hotel, friendly staff, hearty functional breakfast, the superior room was certainly huge with ample space along with Kettle & provisions for tea & coffee. Now the not so good parts, the bathroom in contrast to the room is tiny. Didnt perticularly like the layout of the toilet either. The room I stayed in faced the street & was on the first floor, hence a fair bit of noise filtered in to the room. As one reviewer mentioned the walls do require padding up as noise from the halls outside & stairwell filter in to the room. Though they have renovated the hotel, yet the lobby does look dated. Hence while checking in do ask for a room on a higher floor & one overlooking the canal which runs just behind this hotel. Lighting in the rooms is inadequate & can not be centrally controlled, meaning one has to individually switch on or off the lights each time for all the light fixtures. Paid Euro 125 per night including breakfast which given the fact I got an upgrade was maybe just about a fair price, though for this property I feel a rate of Euro 90 for a standard room including breakfast can be considered to be a fair deal.

Reviews.Title: “noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: Snarkhunt
Reviews.Content: this is the noisiest hotel i've stayed in for a long while. the room doors slam so incredibly loudly it is ridiculous. paper thin walls to the corridor - hear every one entering/exiting their rooms. no minibar. no tub. stayed in the nh carlton a few months back - find it is cheaper and better.

Reviews.Title: “Very efficient and clean”
Reviews.Author: kappatraveler
Reviews.Content: City Center location great for easily walking to major sites. Room small but clean and beds comfortable. No airconditioning and we asked for a fan - which they had at the front desk. The soaps and shampoo smelled like melted popsicles - not so nice. No conditioner or lotion provided so make sure to bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for all tastes”
Reviews.Author: LaoTse
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in NH City Centre and, although we didn't have much time indoors, we utterly liked it. We started off on the wrong foot as the hotel was fully-booked when we arrived (our room had been booked several weeks earlier) and we had to move to another - terrible! - part of Amsterdam in another NH. However, they made up for their mistake by upgrading our room and providing us with breakfast every morning although we hadn't paid for it. It's location is fantastic (you can take the trams numbers 1, 2 and 5 from the tram station right behind the hotel) and it's only a 5-minute walk to the central square of the city (Dam Square). It's remarkably clean, you can enjoy a plentiful breakfast (since 7 am) and the reception staff was always incredibly helpful whenever we needed them. What else can you ask from a hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Suberb location & nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Xinu
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in NH city centre and we were really pleased with this hotel. The best thing was its location. Easy connection from airport to hotel by train+tram. Cafes, restaurants, shopping streets, sights and canals are all easily within walking distance from the hotel. The room was a positive surprise. It was newly renovated, clean and spacious (which I did not expect from A'dam hotel). I don't really have anything negative to say about this hotel. Maybe only that the breakfast was not included in roomrate and cost 12 eur per person... But you can get it outside with less money, so not a problem really. I don't think I could have spent my 90 eur better in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in a good quiet location at the city center”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Good things about this hotel:- Location. Within 2 minute walk to the Amsterdam Historic Museum and 5 minutes walk to shopping and food areas. 10 min walk to Dam Square and 20 min to Central Station. Basically you can walk to most attractions from this strategic location. Just 5 minutes away is the Flower market and also the Albert Heijn supermarket where you can stock up on supplies. The beds and sheets are good. Despite the close location to the city centre, the trams run on the next street. So it is peaceful. Bad things about this hotel: Some rooms have no view. These are the interior rooms where you can't see outside. Worse is that our windows cannot open.(some can but mine can't). It can be stuffy in summer. Fortunately the hotel staff handed me a table fan! I booked early and got a good rate. Perhaps that is the reason I was given a tiny claustrophobic room. I suspect they sell their worst rooms early to the early bookers. Since we paid less, I suppose we have less grounds to complain. Service level can be improved. The staff is generally friendly but obviously the service level is a bit lacking. I arrived early at around 10am...was told to wait till 2pm to be able to check in. Overall, great location, nice beds but tiny rooms and mediocre service. Check out the small cafes around the hotel. The corner one behind the hotel on Singel serves good breakfast setsfor 7 euros. Walk up the road behind the hotel (Singel) and you can rent a bike from Orange Bkes...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: athenor84
Reviews.Content: Quite large 5 stories three star hotel for the Amsterdam standards. Book this hotel if you're looking for a nice hotel with great location: you can get there by a short ride (3 stops) by tram from the Central Station (connected to Schipol airport by train, 25 minutes ride) or by foot (15 mins) and you can reach almost any part of the town walking. Lots of bars and restaurants mostly visited by international students from the near University just around the corner. My room on the second floor faced the (silent) Spuistraat, definitely small in size but cozy and with a renewed large bathroom with a powerful shower. Nice staff. Note you've got no minibar in room (you've got a fridge but it's empty) only vending and ice machines on each floor. Nice LCD screens in room. I do suggest to book early in order to get bargain (prepaid) rates.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and OK but with a Tinge of Spanish Monastery”
Reviews.Author: topmooi
Reviews.Content: Been to other NH hotels before -- Barcelona and Amserdam. This one is more spartan (therefore I found it less pleasant than the other ones). Middle-sized room with widescreen TV and signature Agua de la Tiera toiletries. Upgrade to superior room: Euros 25/night; to suite: Euros 100/night. Would have been interesting to see, but it was a waste for my short trip. Recption staff OK but not always helpful -- "Are you sure you're staying at this hotel?" Breakfast abundant and at very convenient hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, perfectly fine hotel but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: AFCW
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reading numerous positive reviews here on Tripadvisor. Overall, no complaints, the hotel is approximately a 20 minute walk from the main railway station, so no need for taxis or trams unless you cannot do a 20 minute walk. The area around the hotel has a few bars/cafes, and the rear of the hotel overlooks the canal. The main shopping area in Amsterdam is only a 10-15 minute walk away. Red Light District is 20 minute walk maximum, Van Gogh Museum 20 mins also, so no need to get on a tram at all during my 3 night stay. Hotel perfectly clean, the rooms were a modern style, but slightly showing a bit of wear and tear. Could probably have got a slightly better standard hotel further out for the same price, but could not beat this one for location. Breakfast expensive if not included in your price, 19 euros I think, although the breakfast room was large and not at all overcrowded, I'm assuming it would be much busier at weekends - I stayed tuesday to friday. Overall, I recommend this hotel if it fits in your budget range, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: courtchick54
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights on the weekend during a two-week trip around europe. the location is great, right on the main street through the city leading to the city centre. our room had a fabulous view of the canals. bathroom was decently sized. they offered sunday 5pm late checkout at no charge, which we gladly took advantage of. there was a bit of confusion with a trainee front desk staff member regarding our being charged for breakfast after i asked three times whether breakfast was included in the room, which was comp'd (thank you for that). our room had a kind of odd smell to it but nothing to really complain about. high speed internet was available at a rather hefty charge, which is apparently the norm in europe. i sure do love the US and their generous internet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant customer service”
Reviews.Author: MarkHimself
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to, and stayed in Amsterdam many times. Without question, the NH City Centre is by far the best place I've stayed. Now, lets just put this in perspective, yes, the rooms are a little small and perhaps compared to other cities, a bit pricey, but you have to compare this hotel, not to all hotels in the world but to other accommodation in Amsterdam - and it is by far and away the best deal you can get for your euro - for Amsterdam City centre, it is great value. The location is perfect - just off Spuis - which puts you on the main tram lines and within minutes walk of Jordaan, the best area of Amsterdam and within minutes walk of all the tourist attractions in Amsterdam. The decor is modern, and clean, simple, all you need for a weekend break. with a few nice touches that remind you, you are in a friendly place. I found our room to be spotless. Finally, the staff are Brilliant. Everyone from cleaning staff to reception and above had a warm smile and were always attentive and happy to help. I cannot rate their service highly enough. Considering the amount of tourist traffic this hotel gets, I can tell you this is no mean feat. In my opinion the reviews here that give this hotel less than 4 stars do not understand the accommodation market in Amsterdam or are expecting way too much for their euro. in short, perfect price, perfect location, perfect staff. [ by the way, if you do travel to Amsterdam, do yourself a huge favour - don't bother with the red light area, it's horrible. Hang around the Jordaan and go to the great art galleries and cafÃ©'s and eetcafÃ©s. You will go home relaxed and feeling brilliant, instead of frazzled, ripped off and vaguely disappointed in humanity ]

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to use a base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Rozzer80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the this hotel in mid-May 2009 for three nights as part of my wife's birthday. Prior contact with the hotel, ensured that when we arrived they had "upgraded" us to a superior room and arranged flowers and sparkling wine (at a cost!) on our arrival. A superior room just means that you get a view onto the canal and a slightly larger room, compared to standard. However, they are not that big to start with, and only have showers. Which don't have quite the same effect when all you want to do is soak in a bath after walking all day. The easiest way to describe NH City Centre is simple:- it's somewhere comfortable to sleep at night. We came to look at Amsterdam itself and not spend time in the hotel, and the hotel's location is brilliant for doing this. Arrive at Central Station, buy a "strippenkart" and then get the 1,2 or 5 tram to Spuis, walk round the corner of the street and there's the hotel. From there, you're right next to the flower market, and then walking distance to everywhere nearly. In fact the longest walk we did was to the Van Gogh Museum and that took 25 minutes at most. We paid only for the room, as there is a cafe on the canal side of the hotel that does huge breakfasts, and a pastry shop on the street side and both are better value for money. The only problem when we were there was that the hotel bar was shut for works being carried out, but seeing as though the hotel is on the same street as about 15 cafe's and "coffee shops" it really wasn't a problem. Oh and if you like cocktails and mexican food I would recommend Los Pilones, Kerkstraat 63. A tiny little restaurant, where the food is OK but the cocktails particularly the Margaritas are large and potent, you even get a little jug to top it up with!! all for 6.95 Euro. NH City Centre does what it says on the packet, it's a three star hotel, due to it's lack of amenities but has a five star location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but may be a little warm in July or August”
Reviews.Author: USParisian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently booked a last minute trip to Amsterdam and after checking Trip Advisor we stayed at the NH Amsterdam City Centre. The location of the hotel could not have been better. We walked everywhere! The rooms were quite spacious and very clean. The room was a little warm during the day and in the early morning. We had to be sure to keep the curtains closed or the room would really heat up. With only one window in the room, it was difficult to get a good air flow. I suspect that during the summer months, it could be uncomfortable. The hot water was a little finicky and could easily go from comfortable to scalding, but I really shouldn't complain about that. I would definitely stay at the NH City Center again, but probably not in July or August.

Reviews.Title: “Better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: PurpleCat33
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms even by Amsterdam standards, and expensive too. "Superior" rooms aren't. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: The_Last_Unicorn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH City Centre for 3 nights in May 2009 with my boyfriend. I was impressed and thought it was a perfect hotel for a city break. I found the hotel very well located - easy walking distance to all the main sights, there's a nice selection of bars/restaurants right outside and also a tram stop nearby. My room was clean, spacious and a decent size. Comfortable bed, nice large shower, tea & coffee making facilities, a safe, TV with a few english channels...everything I wanted really. It was also cleaned daily to a good standard. The staff were helpful and friendly during check in/check out and let us keep our bags stored for the day, free of charge. I cannot comment on the bar/restaurant as we didn't use it. I thought breakfast was quite expensive at 19euro each, so we decided to go elsewhere. All in all, very good hotel and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: melsadventures
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, within walking distance to all city centre attractions..... It is also beside a tram stop, that will bring you right up to the main train station. The rooms are very small and pokey but once you get over that, its clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: LondonMary
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a visit to Amsterdam. We stayed at the NH City Centre hotel. It was excellent. Its location is its main plus. You're right in the middle and so everything is quite close and certainly walkable. The room we had was large and light and overlooked the street. The bathroom was adequate with a good shower. I had tried to request a canal view but they don't have any twin rooms overlooking the canal unfortunately. The only downside was that the room was quite hot. and with only a small window it wasn't that easy to cool it down again. The tea and coffee making facilities were a bonus especially as the weak pound made everything very expensive. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel as it was 18 euros each which is too much - however nice the food is. The cafe that has been recommended elsewhere on the reviews of this hotel was excellent and there looked to be an amazing bakery just by the entrance to the hotel and we'd have tried it had we not been concerned for our figures!! Whatever you do if you're going to Amsterdam look in to buying tickets for all the major museums in advance. We booked Anne Frank House on the internet and whilst everyone else had a good few hours wait we walked straight in at the allotted time - and the same for the Van Gogh museum. There were other museums we didn't go to that also had queues. I would also recommend if you're planning on seeing a lot in Amsterdam that you look in to getting an I AMsterdam card (you can look it up on the internet). You pay 48 euros each for a 48 hour period and then get free entrance to museums and discounts in restaurants etc. We worked out that between us we spent 96 euros on the card but in total saved 260 euros so a net saving of 164 euros. As Amsterdam is such an expensive place this was a welcome saving! Lastly I must recomment Pasta e Basta restautant. It really was one of the best restaurants I have been to. The food was excellent but it was the singing waiters that made it so brilliant. It sounds cheesy but really it wasn't. I'd urge everyone to go (and you get 25% off with the Iamsterdam card!

Reviews.Title: “wheelchair friendly Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: chipsyrackwitz
Reviews.Content: It is first time I visited Amsterdam. It is really wheelchair friendly city. I like this city very much. I stayed at NH City Centre Hotel on this time. The hotel is quite old but is comfortable. It is not so clean that I expect but acceptable. The room is big enough for wheelchair people and the toilet is good too. Just one thing I don't like so much that is the entrance of the hotel. If you need to sit on wheelchair, you should use the side entrance to enter the hotel because there are 13 stairs in the front entrance.
