The lift for the wheelchair people is very slowly to move up and down. Other than hotel, Amsterdam is really great city that I couldnâ€™t image. I visited so many places by tram. Except the Anne frank house, nearly I can enter all museums around Amsterdam. And I also visited Keukenhof, it is very impressive. Much different kind of flowers is showed there. Of course the main flowers are tulips. And one thing I feel very impressive that is all of Dutch know speaking English. Overall, I strongly recommend you should visit this city if you want to have a travel. No matter you are handicap of not!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel location”
Reviews.Author: margaret279
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated hotel and in great location, between Dam Square and Leidseplein. Changed rooms as the first was opposite a lift, the second had no bath, only a shower, and the third had no view but really did not want to change again. The first receptionist was not too happy about us changing rooms, although we were not told about the shower before we went up to it. Breakfast was not included and I felt the rates were high enough to warrant an included breakfast (too expensive to buy!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Sherps03
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH City Centre while over for the Netherlands v Scotland game. Hotel is everything you'd expect, clean, modern and with good service. Beds were good, water was hot. Location is the best thing about it. 2 minutes walk from Dam Square and 10 minutes walk from Centraal Station. If you're a beer drinker there's also the fantstic Cafe Gollem in the alley between Spuistraat and Singel, to the left hand side of the hotel if coming out of the front door. You could probably find hotels with more character in Amsterdam, than this one, but this is definately a good, modern option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: X-Jillybean86-X
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's great location. It's very central and everything is within walking distance. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Most importantly it was very very clean. The room was a little small but was very lovely and we overlooked the single canal. Shuttle buses can also be organised from the tourist info at the airport straight to this hotel and coming back as well. I would definitely stay at the NH City centre again.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location, 10 mins walk from Centraal Station”
Reviews.Author: ArsenalMichael
Reviews.Content: Look, if you want a 5* hotel this is not for you, however if you want a reasonably priced, centrally located hotel then this is spot on! Small rooms, but clean and user friendly. Friendly staff, barman gave me a free beer because I waited more than 2 minutes! Great area, and does all you need it to. A bit oldy worldy having a "laundry room" on each floor with ironing boards and irons etc. but it all works.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Naz7
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at this hotel. Our room had a canal view (room 207). It was clean and there was a kettle, coffee and tea in the room. The hotel's location is excellent. There is a tram stop just a few minutes from the hotel. There is a great indonesian restaurant right across the street (Kantjil & de Tijger). Albert Heijn (grocery store chain) is a few minutes walking distance if you need anything. All in all, the hotel is good value for money. Our only dissapointment was the reception staff. They were very inexperienced and couldn't help us with any of our questions such as canal tour stops or transportain from the airport to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wew71
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with our two-year old son and had a standard room on the fourth floor with a nice rooftop view. The room was average size for Europe, but there was plenty of room for the three of us. The bathroom was well-appointed and spotless. There was even a little step stool so our son could reach the sink. The towels were quite large and soft. The room has 3 single beds, two of which were combined to make a comfy double. The other single bed is located across the room, almost like a daybed. There is a desk, flat screen, safe, and mini-fridge which was perfect for fruit, drinks and yogurt. The decor is neutral and modern and everything was very clean. There are two ah grocery stories within a few blocks of the hotel. Great location with tram stop just across the street, Dam a few minutes walk, basically in the center of everything but on a quiet street. With the little guy, we might stay closer to Vondelpark next time, but we were very pleased with the NH and the staff was very helpful and accommodating, especially to the baby. You must climb a set of stairs to enter the hotel, so it is a concern if your are hauling a sleeping child in a stroller or have mobility issues.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: nicola70000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well worth the money we paid, we went through lastminute.com. Brilliant location, only a few minutes from Dam Square. The rooms were a really good size, clean and had everything you need. The room was published as a double but it was two single beds pushed together. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were able to check-out late through the lazy Sunday promotion they offer. I would recommend this hotel and would certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely treat”
Reviews.Author: lilsooze
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as a valentines get away and I was surprised by the hotel. lovely and clean, helpful staff, excellent location and value for money but this was through a late deal on lastminute.com. I wouldn't have paid the full rate per night to stay here. The room on the whole was lovely, clean, modern, very good shower but I would recommend going for a superior suite/room as the standard was very crampt even with just the two of us in there. Cant complain about the view as we were lucky to get a the canal view especially at such a low cost. Didn't eat breakfast here as it was very expensive, there's a marvelous inexpensive cafe at the end of row of buildings as you go right out of hotels back entrance leading on to the canal, they serve the most delicious omelettes. Evening meals again were no problem as the hotel is surrounded by cafes and restaruants to suite all budgets. Overall a pleasant stay but next time I would come back in the spring or summer .

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but some problems”
Reviews.Author: MrToes
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located, clean, secure friendly staff. Price not bad in a very expensive city. A few oddities with the room - two single beds instead of a double, broken tap in the bathroom. Then there was no hot water at all on the second day, and no compensation to cover this, which is unacceptable for a Â£90/night room in the middle of winter. My girlfriend was not at all happy about this! If you're willing to bet the above incident doesn't occur, then it's probably an ok choice, but from our experience we can't really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for money”
Reviews.Author: Malenkij
Reviews.Content: Good location Good price Normal rooms Group Tours

Reviews.Title: “dependable quality”
Reviews.Author: numpty
Reviews.Content: I was dubious about booking a smaller hotel with 'character' after reading so many variable reviews on TA. So I played it safe and went for an NH, I was not dissapointed at all. I had room 123, non smoking and very clean, try to stay at the canal side. Rooms 121 and 125 are probably bigger, I had a single window, the other rooms have three window and they are double glazed, despite what others have said. Only down side, not the quietest of hotels. The internal walls don't keep out all of the noise from adjoining rooms. The doors tend to close with a bang. Not all the hotels fault, noisy neighbours would be problem anywhere, I don't know where they get the energy from!! There are some elements of the old art deco building left behind, in the stairwell and on the road elevation but I did not have time to investigate. I stayed four nights but I could not afford breakfast or dinner at the hotel. I would stay here again, I would not bother looking anywhere else to be honest. I walked everywhere, including from Centraal Station it is such a compact city, just watch out for dog's mess.

Reviews.Title: “InsatisfactionGguaranteed”
Reviews.Author: renegadeLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located close to Dam Square and The Royal Palace, adjacent to Singel Canal. The exterior of the building does not look like a hotel and once you enter, it still doesn't. Very small reception area and a restaurant can be found in the lobby. The access to rooms is via one extremely slow moving lift or stairs . The staircase will remind you of whiffs you smell in the hospitals and other not so good smelling places. We booked a Superior Room for more space and comfort, instead recieved a Superior Room with hardly any space left after the beds. Two chairs present but inadaquate space for their existence. The Dutch type of toilet put us right off. Beds were just totally insatisfactory. No width on them at all. You can easily fall off the other side if stoned or drunk at night. The windows were obsolete, not even double glazed. On top, the window didn't actually close and we had to sleep 2 nights in freezing cold. Despite that we didn't complain and the cleaning lady had the cheek to barge in our room and say she will not clean it because we are smoking ganja in the room and we should not be. It is Amsterdam for f**k sake. The experience we recieved was not what we expected, but we never complain. It was affordable atleast. You can get around Amsterdam pretty easily from the hotel location and it is close to major attractions. However I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “central located -great rates”
Reviews.Author: cros_i
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located into the centre of the city, and we have walked to the most of the places, also the tram stop is not far away from the Hotel. Out side from the Hotel there many places to eat. The room was clean and warm, the temperature outside was very low, wooden floors, TV, coffee and tea facilities in the room also was nice. The staff was helpful and friendly. We haven't taken breakfast because we found we expensive. In case we will be again in Amsterdam we will saty again here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: welshkid
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend break to celebrate our 40th immediately after Christmas and returning before the New Year 2008. The Hotel room was very pleasant and comfortable and were glad of the heat in the room after a day outside. Staff were very helpful and polite. Trams 1, 2, & 5 stopped at Spui and the Hotel was forward and around the corner and 5 to 600 yards down the road to an inset entrance identified by red carpet steps. I think they need a large illuminated sign outside so that it can be seen from the corner. I don't know if it's a NH Hotel thing but breakfasts were very expensive especially with the GBP value falling against the Euro. E18 per person for what I would consider a 2 star presentation. A BIG thank you for the person who wrote about the Broodje Bert, lunch cafe just up the street who do a large breakfast for 7 Euros, too much for one person, double fired egg, rashers of bacon with side salad on large white or brown bread with coffee and fresh orange drink. Mind you it was cold and you kept your coats on and had to eat it quickly against the minus deg temps. Our second visit we shared one large breakfast, very adequate with very nice helpful people. Next visit must be in Summer with B/B included.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, very central, very reasonable rates.”
Reviews.Author: EllieChester
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for three nights - end of October, beginning of November this year. We travelled by train from the airport, then were able to walk to the hotel, using a map, in about 15 minutes. Our room was of a good size and was pleasantly furnished, and warm. ( The weather was pretty cold outside!) We faced the inner courtyard, so had no views to speak of, but that was not a concern to us. There was tea and coffee making facilities in the room, which was good, and towels etc were plentiful and of good quality. You could even request special pillows, if you wanted, which was an unusual facility. The bed was comfortable, although our double was two singles pushed together. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, as it seemed rather pricey. Instead we found a nearby cafe, Broodje Bert, (behind hotel, facing the canal), which served a great breakfast for seven euros. The Spuistraat, the street the hotel is on, has very many eating and drinking places along it, so there is no need to travel far if tired after a hard day's sightseeing! There is even a coffee bar on the street, towards the station end, that serves delicious hash brownie cakes! (Abraxas). Would go back anytime - loved the whole experience!

Reviews.Title: “toned down”
Reviews.Author: John_Lewis
Reviews.Content: I posted a review of this hotel in May, having stayed for one night for business. I recently stayed again for a holiday with my girlfriend, and just wanted to slightly tone down the 5 star award I gave NH City Centre back in May, which I might have been a bit hasty in awarding due to the fact that I was upgraded for free to a suite on that occasion. This time, we stayed in a normal room, which was still very nice, but not quite the exceptional experience I had back then. The room was of a decent size, with a smallish, but very well maintained bathroom. It didn't have the outstanding view of the Singel canal I'd enjoyed on my previous visit, but that's only to be expected I suppose. Just to address something in a previous review, we didn't have any problems with water going everywhere from the shower, in fact I thought the shower was one of the best things about the room. Staying here isn't cheap though, but then that's Amsterdam for you, it's quite an expensive city to visit in general. Overall this stay was pleasant, and as ever the customer service was very good, but I think 4 star is a slightly more appropriate assessment than 5.

Reviews.Title: “Advantages and Disadvantages”
Reviews.Author: daribabe
Reviews.Content: Well, needless to say, I had a great time in amsterdam, but unlike most reviewers I'll tell you about the hotel - not my weekend because thats what I always want to know when searching for hotels. I find it very difficult choosing hotels and spend hours looking for the right one wherever I visit in the world (and I've been to over 40 countries) I believe that the following review will tell you exactly what to expect at the hotel and it is fair Advantages: 1. Central Location: The location couldn't be better. All the sights are nearby, coffeeshops, wax museum, anne frank house, bars and restaurants etc. 2. Rooms are clean with an average tiled bathroom and a wooden floor in the bedroom area which is spacious. In no way is it the most stylish room that you've ever seen, but its comfortable. 3. Smoking rooms ARE available (it took me ages to find this out about hotels in amsterdam). Most hotels do not have any smoking rooms and are entirely smoke-free 4. TV channels are good. BBC1 and BBC2 are available at no extra cost. Pay TV is also available. 5. Reception and staff are very friendly and very helpful. Customer service is great in amsterdam anyway, spoken english is perfect and the dutch are very friendly everywhere. 6. Suitcases and bags can be left at reception for no extra cost 7. Check in is at 3pm however we found that after 12 noon, you can return to the reception desk and ask if the room is ready. You will be checked-in promptly. 8. Check out time on a sunday only is 5pm! Pretty good if your trip ends on a sunday and you have a late flight to catch 9. There is a cafe (didn't use it though ... burgers and chips kinda food) Disadavantages: 1. The breakfast is expensive - its 17 euro each and is not included in the room price unless specifically asked for and I found that the breakfast is actually 22 euro each if booked as part of the room price. Eat out instead - O'Reillys Irish bar nearby does a cracking hot breakfast for 10 euro or one of the many cafe's also nearby sell coffee for 2 euro and a pastry for the same. 2. Internet charges are amazingly expensive!! Yeah there is WIFI but you have to pay for it. 17 euro for 24 hours or 10 euro for an hour. Download speed is poor anyway 251 kbps and upload speed is 250 kbps so watching your favorite youtube videos or a streamed movie (to beat the pay tv) is out of the question. Again, go to o'reillys bar which is nearby the hotel, WIFI is free. Ask the staff for the username and password. You will get 1 hour free, then buy another drink and get another free hour if you like. 3. The bathroom shower is nice, but it is over the bath tub with a small shower screen. Prepare to mop up the water from the floor after having a shower with a nominated towel of your choice. The water gets everywhere. 4. The minbar has two bottles of water - still and sparkling at 2.50 euro each. Buy stuff in the supermarket and use the mini bar fridge iinstead. 5. There is tea/coffee making in the room, but not much selection. 6. There is no air conditioning. In november why would you need it? Well it would be good to have it as a heater. The room has central heating only and is controlled by the hotel. So at night it can be pretty cold. 7. And finally my number one pet hate about hotels in europe - Two single beds pushed together to make a double! In some hotels the base of the bed is a double with two single matresses. Not here - its actually two singles pushed together and if there is any action (say no more) on the bed, a chasm will appear when the two beds move apart - quiet funny in the situation, but very uncomfortable to sleep over if you and your loved one like to cuddle at night. You both end up on one single because who's going to sleep over the middle bit :( Hope this helps....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ri_ra_2004
Reviews.Content: Great location, not far from anything, but a quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Fine location - very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: pastaS
Reviews.Content: - The location is excellent. Very central. There are cafÃ©s and bookstores just outside the hotel doors. If you are looking to explore the centre of Amsterdam, then this is an excellent location. You even have a number of trams passing just outside the hotel (apox 150 meters away). - There is another NH Hotel with a very similar sounding name - NH Center (I think). This should not be confused with the NH City Center. I initially went to the wrong one because the tram I was on (No. 1) was passing the other one. It's only a short walk to the other branch, but if you are with lots of bags or it is raining, it is not much fun. So best thing is to go by address - not hotel name. In fact Amsterdam is littered with NH hotels! - The rooms are really very clean, albeit a but small. However, I was on the 5th floor and had an excellent view over the roof-tops of the city. - Unlike the bedroom, the corridors are really somewhat sleepy. The carpets are worn-out, for example. However, if this does not bother you, then the nice rooms make up for the tired hallways. - The front desk was friendly and receptive. - There is no iron & board in the bedrooms. Instead, you have to use an ironing room on the 3rd floor. Would have preferred something in my room - but can not complain too much, since the ironing room was easy to access. As others have said, this is a large somewhat impersonal hotel, so you miss out on the charm of a smaller (or more exclusive) place. However, if your wish is to explore the city as opposed to spend it in the room, then this place is nice - and best of all, the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: SwaggerLikeUs
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Lastminute.com for our 3 night stay at the beginning of October, for my partners birthday. It was slightly out of my budget but was the best decision i made! Because where i spent a little extra on the hotel i saved on travelling to tourist attractions such as, Dam Square (2 streets away), Red Light District (on the other side of dam square), Madame Tussards (in Dam Square) as well as the many choices of places to eat and "Coffeeshops"! It felt like everything was a little walk here or a little walk there. Nothing strenuous or exhausting! Quite scenic and ideal in location. There are so many choices of restaurants, take away's and cafe's nearby (5 min walk). Your are away from the hustle and bustle of the areas i mentioned above so noise isn't a factor. On one side of the hotel you have the street and on the other you have a canal. We all know the weather isn't great at this time of year which is why this hotel is also ideal. The hotel itself is lovely. The staff are polite despite what some reviews have said, for example, they lent us an umbrella several times and held onto our luggage whilst we had to wait to check in and when we checked out of the hotel, due to early and late evening flights. The standard double room was very similar to a Premier Travel Inn (U.K) well equipped, nicely decorated and comfortable. We stayed on the 4th floor and couldnt complain. The window is a little high so there's not much of a view. There are vending machines on every other floor (just in case you get the munchies) which are good for the odd snack or drink. I would highly recommend this hotel to a family, couple and (well behaved) friends of all ages!

Reviews.Title: “Price and Quality are not equal”
Reviews.Author: JanosB
Reviews.Content: I used to go to Amsterdam several times a year, but it was a business trip this time and this hotel has booked by a travel agent. It is not that quality what I expected. I have got the smallest room in the whole building. Price was more than a hundred euros and expected to have a bigger room. Room has a bed and a desk. When I put my lagguage into the room, nobody else could come in and I was not able to move. I complained at the reception desk and finally I got one of the biggest room in the hotel. That was much better, but still the quality is not good for the price. I really disappointed in this hotel. Only the location was really good as it is in the city center. I think I'll use my preferred hotels next time (Novotel).

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: csbcsb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stylish and recently renovated, and location is good. However service is really not good. For example: - i asked for an umbrella and was treated by the concierge as a thief. He repeated 3 times "there is strong wind, i don't recommend it" (please note - no wind at all!), and when i insisted, he made me sign a form and emphasized the fact that it was EUR10 if i lost it (something which was already written on the form i had to sign!) - internet (EUR 22 per day!!!) did not work in my room, and when i asked for it to be fixed the reception said they were going to send a technician but did nothing at all - i left laudry in the bag close to the entrance, but it was not picked up by the maid Apart from bad service, and despite its 5 stars, hotel is a bit cheap on details (call them details...) i.e.: - mattress is uncomfortable, too soft in the middle - probably old despite renovation, and sheets are rough - toilet paper is the cheapest quality you can imagine, really rough & uncomfortable what a pity alltogether...

Reviews.Title: “Newly fitted room, expensive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mikieema
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s a big hotel in the middle of the city. Quite old even if the room and bathroom are newly fitted. Nice selection beauty products and itâ€™s possible to choose the most comfortable pillow. Itâ€™s quite an anonymous, therefore, if youâ€™re looking to something with a traditional Dutch atmosphere itâ€™s not the hotel for you. Breakfast is incredibly expensive and itâ€™s better to go to one of the bakeries or cafesâ€™ around. The restaurant in front of the hotel is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Turned out great!”
Reviews.Author: Kitty7London
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to be in New York to celebrate my partner's birthday but due to passport problems at the 11th hour reluctantly cancelled and took a few days in Amsterdam instead. As we were supposed to be basking in NY luxury, and although it was a quick last minute booking, my heart sank when given our room as it was very small, stuffy and quite scruffy. HOWEVER, when I voiced my disappointment and told the lady at reception of our story, she positively zoomed into action and upgraded us to a fantastic room with a view over the rooftops of Amsterdam-it couldn't have been better-spacious, comfortable,airy and sparkling clean! It also had a mini bar/fridge which I needed for my soya milk-the other room didn't. Our stay was transformed from a disappointing one to a splendid one...thank you! The location was great-everything was in walking distance....even the museums which are at the other side are still within easy walking distance-nothing is more than half an hour's walk away. All in all, my first visit to Amsterdam was a fantastic one and this was helped by the great service and care at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NH City Center”
Reviews.Author: shasa_ist
Reviews.Content: The location is great, everything is in walking distance. The rooms facing the main street can be a little bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Riesling
Reviews.Content: NH City Centre Amsterdam is a modern business style hotel. BOOKING AND CHECK IN Booking online was simple via the hotel's website and a confirmation email received. Check in was quick and polite (though it was late on a Thursday night). Reception staff spoke perfect English (as does everyone in Amsterdam). Don't be confused with NH Hotel Amsterdam Centre - a different hotel. The photos on the website are accurate. ROOM AND BATHROOM We booked a superior room @ 140 euro per night room only. It was reasonably spacious - approx 20 feet x 15 feet. I requested a top floor room online as I thought there might be traffic noise and received one. No traffic noise and great view across rooftops and the canal. 3 large windows letting in plenty of light, but with thick curtains and blinds to block out early morning sun. Modern minimalist decor in whites/creams/browns, white duvet cover. Large bed, at least a queen size. Tea and coffee tray. Fake wood floors. TV which worked fine. Phone which we didn't use. We didn't attempt any wi-fi/internet. Room service available but we didn't use it. In room electronic safe which worked fine. Range of lighting including reading lights on each side of the bed. Daytime temperature was around 18-19 celsius during our trip and the room was comfortable - I didn't notice it being either too hot or cold and can't recall using the air-con controls as a result. Reasonable size bathroom but not huge - approx 9 feet x 10 feet. Excellent shower. Very clean. Good hairdryer. Good selection of toiletries in NH's own range - inc shampoo, shower gel, toothbrush sets, shoe polisher, mini body sponge/scrubber, soaps, shower cap. Nice soft white towels - not super luxury ones but similar to ones I would use at home. No bathrobe/slippers. OTHER SERVICES No iron and ironing board in the room, but ironing room on 3rd floor. Vending machines for soft drinks and sweets/crisps on each floor. Lifts worked well, never waited long. On Sundays there is a FREE 5 PM CHECKOUT! You just need to advise the day before that you wish to stay. LOCATION Fantastic and lovely area for wandering all round the Centre, cafes, bars, and the shopping area of Leidesplein. 1 minute walk to the tram stop, which takes you direct to Central Station (1.60 euro single, pay on board). Otherwise approx 8 euro taxi to Central Station. At least a 30min walk to Central Station. OVERALL If you want a good quality, clean, mid-range, modern, chain-type hotel that does what it says on the box with no problems, this is a good 3.5 star choice. If you want luxury, budget, or unique/characterful, I would look elsewhere. RECOMMENDED, WILL STAY HERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great value--by a long shot”
Reviews.Author: mklein818
Reviews.Content: NH is an ambitious chain, with a bit of a trendy positioning and a generally high standard of standardised cleanliness. But there were some major off notes. Like the sign at the front desk advertising room upgrades for EUR 25. Normally, at any pleasant hotel, if there are excess rooms available, one can ask for and usually get a room upgrade for EUR 0. And while I wanted to get an upgrade after entering my EUR 155 single room, a room with a bathroom that took up 40% of the floor space, the thought of parting with extra Euros was even more offputting than that of staying in such an aggressively small space. The breakfast, which mercifully was included, was competent--having some non-pork protein options. Oh, the hotel also unblocked a group reservation we had made when we were unwilling to guarantee an excessively large group of rooms, resulting in major inconvenience for an event I was organising. In a city where rooms are as pricey as Amsterdam, the extreme commercial aggressiveness of the NH makes it tough to recommend. So I won't.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: Grisly
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Great location! My wife and I stayed for 4 nights and the location and quality of this hotel made our stay in Amsterdam a memorable one. The location is so close to the centre of the fun we had no need for public transportation, yet it is quietly situated on the Singel canal. It was also a nice surprise to find it was adjacent to the Five Flies restaurant, which has to be one Amsterdam's best. We chose the hotel based on Trip Advisor and I must say Trip Advisor provides a great set of reviews, good and bad. Time spent filtering through reviews is time well spent and in this case we weren't disappointed. I also find the Trip Advisor photos are very helpful and have included a couple with this review. Our room was on the 5th floor. It was very clean, spacious, with comfortable beds, large windows, a great bathroom, big tub and shower with modern fixtures. I didn't see any of the rooms on the lower floors but would definitely recommend, if possible, upgrading to a room on the fifth. Have fun in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManilaGlobetrotter30
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on trip advisor and expedia reviews. You never really know what to expect until you get there. Since I have had the pleasure of staying in 5 star hotels around the globe, I have some pretty high expectations for hotels. Surprisingly, this hotel was quite quaint and a perfect location to walk to the coffee shops, get to the square, nice shopping area and best of all the best restaurants the city had to offer all within walking distance. The rooms are quite small (my hotel in Tokyo was much bigger) but since we hardly stayed in the room it was fine (albeit our huge luggage took up much of the space). Our view of the canal and the city was fantastic with a great sunset view. We never ate at the hotel so we cannot comment but this hotel was well worth the price. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toujo
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at the hotel, part of a Trafalgar Tour so didnâ€™t have time to take photos, sorry. The room was basic and we had twin beds (mother and daughter traveling together) which were really comfortable. The room had a safe, mini bar and flat screen tv but no airconditioning or alarm clock. The bathroom was reasonably sized with the shower over a very high bath. There were loads of restaurants around the hotel with a lovely cafÃ© behind the hotel named Berts and many cafes on the same street as the hotel. Breakfast was wonderful with lots of cheeses and meats available. Sorry this review is short but we did only have a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing!!”
Reviews.Author: lilprincesshez
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (aged 24) and me (aged 21), both from Scotland, are not long back from a city break together in Amsterdam (first timers). Had a great time staying at the NH Amsterdam City Centre. Rooms were spacious, especially for Amsterdam, and heating was excellent - it was absolutely freezing and snowed for 3 of the 5 days we were in the Dam. Hotel is situated very close to the city centre and transport links are excellent. From Schipol airport, we got the train directly to Centraal Station (costs approx Â£4 each). Jumped on a tram at centraal station (i'm sure its 1, 2, and 5) and got of at the Spui, which is just round the corner from the hotel. We had priced the transfers through the hotel out of interest on our return and were quoted 20 euros, so go it alone! Its a good way to find your way about as well. Our room looked out on a street - Spuistraat. From what i have gathered from others, it is easy enough to get the room switched for a canal view though if you want to. To be honest, we were not fussed. We spent most of our days and nights out and about, and we only really slept in the room. The rooms are spacious though, the bathroom was a good size (a shower big enough for two anyways) and the beds are really comfy. We were up early twice during the stay, to go on trips, and had breakfast in the hotel. At 18 euros per person (buffet style), its a bit steep, but they had everything you could have possibly wanted from crepes, cereal, bacon, sausages, croissants, etc. The other mornings we headed down to the main centre and found something there, which was a lot better priced. Everybody goes to Amsterdam for different things. We really enjoyed our time there and made the most of the things on offer. We did find that eating out and drinking was more expensive than we thought it would be. However, it is a city so these prices should be expected. A few things we would recommend - Casi di David - a lovely italian restuarant which faces onto the Singel Canal (at the back of the hotel - only about 2 min walk away) - lovely food, reasonably priced. - If going for a smoke, the Stone's Cafe is a great place to go. - We went on a bike tour one afternoon. We had a tour guide called Peter who took us round the city on these granny bikes and got us cycling through red lights. We had a great time, though we were slightly under the influence! All in all an excellent time in Amsterdam. Hope you'se all enjoy your time in the Dam as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: DOHDublin
Reviews.Content: Nice 3 Star Hotel. Rooms were good size and everything was clean and well kept. Breakfast was good with a good selection of options. The location was excellent - very central. Broadband access in the room was extortionately priced at â‚¬22 for a day. When are hotels going to realise that this should be free - it doesn't cost a huge amount for them to put in place a wireless router that covers the whole building so the marginal cost of providing access for guests is minimal. I still find it very hard to get used to the fact that people smoke in the bar and in the halls. The Netherlands needs to put in place the same bans on smoking in the workplace that exist throughout many European countries. The absence of the smoking ban would stop me returning there on a personal trip (business this time).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doire
Reviews.Content: The NH is an excellent hotel.The staff were always very friendly and efficient. When my wife and I arrived quite late at night we asked for a room looking out over the Singel canal and this was arranged for us instantly.The room was very quiet and toasty warm during some very cold snowy weather.The hotel is within easy walking distance of most attractions and there's a tram stop 2 mins walk from the hotel entrance.There's an amazing selection of eating places nearby and fabulously historic pubs (no food or big screen TV's) such as Gollem, Hoppe and two of our favourites Het Dokterje and In De Wildeman, all within easy staggering distance. One small quibble is the breakfast which costs 18 Euro per day ,that's 36 Euro for a couple!!! An easy solution is to pop round to Bert's cafe just round the corner by the canal where a lovely breakfast can be obtained for a fraction of the hotel's price. Finally I must disagree with the 3 Irish sisters' comments about Amsterdam. It's a fabulous city, far safer than most Irish cities, there's LOADS to see and do and the locals are amazingly tolerant,honest and friendly.This was our second trip and we will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: KernowTraveller9
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great four night stay in Amsterdam. Had a double room with breakfast from otel.com for Â£90 a night. Small room but clean and perfectly adequate.Rooms are allocated on arrival so make sure you ask for a room with a canal view. We had to forgo a no smoking room to get this but it was well worth it and the room was fine, not smoky at all and at no extra cost. Breakfast was good. The great thing about this hotel is the position. You could walk to most places easily, or get the tram from the next street across. There were plenty of good bars and restaurants around but it was not noisy. Don't miss the little bar called Gollem in the alley just round the corner. Great atmosphere and an amazing selection of beers.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly great!”
Reviews.Author: everfair
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from a 4 night visit to Amsterdam. We stayed at the NH City Centre, which was booked in conjunction with airfare in a package from covacations.com. We liked the location. A little alleyway over were the tram stops, which, once we figured out how to take them, was very convenient. From the tram stop, it's only about two or three stops away from Leidsplein, a fun area with more restaurants and shops. The hotel is very close to the Spui Square, which had a few bars, coffeeshops, and restaurants nearby. The street the hotel itself is on has great restaurants: of note, an Indonesian restaurant across the street called Kantjil (definitely try the Rijstaftel) and a Dutch restaurant directly across the way (can't remember the name) that had delicious traditional Dutch food. In terms of things to do, Dam Square is about a 5 minute walk, with several shopping streets close as well. Magna Plaza is a nice shopping center to check out. When we travel, we love to check out the supermarket, so stop by an Albert Heijns store! The room itself was simply furnished with a modern color scheme. We had room 503 which was sort of awkwardly wedged in a corner, but the room itself was not cramped. There were tea making ammenities, a bottle each of still and sparkling water for purchase, along with a minifridge (no minibar in there for us though!). The bed was really comfortable. We never checked out their "pillow menu" but thought it interesting that it was an option. The bathroom was nice. My fiance's concern with hotels in Europe is that the shower stalls (or curtains) are claustrophobic, but we had no problem here. Their stall was basically just a glass partition from the toilet, with ample space to slip under the shower head. (We liked it so much that we were thinking to remodel our bathroom similarly!) They have their own line of colorful green and yellow toiletries (though I didn't really care for its fragrance), along with a comb, brush, loofah, sponge, and sewing kit. Their breakfast buffet was superb! There was a great assortment of rolls, cold cuts, cheeses, fruit and juices, yogurt, along with bacon and sausage, scrambled and hardboiled egg, tiny pancake bites, even apple pie and spanish tortilla! Sounds funny, but my favorite part of breakfast was their coffee machine. You put a little cup underneath, press the cafe au lait button, and it's the best coffee to start your morning! I think I've covered the basics, or rather the most important points. There is a computer for internet access in a corner of the lobby. You can ask the desk for a 15 minute complimentary voucher once for the duration of your stay. The staff is great and sincerely tries to make your stay pleasant. The hotel definitely made our stay excellent. We would not hesitate to book here again when we come back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff - out the way abit”
Reviews.Author: CaseyCoventry
Reviews.Content: We were told that check in was 2pm, so when we arrived at 10am we never expected that the room would be ready. But it was. We got in the room and it was clean and comfy. We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, the staff were friendly. The amenties were great. The only thing is if you want to be in the buzz of amsterdam. You really need to stay near Dam Square. Its about a 25min walk to the square and when your walking round all day, the last thing you want to do is walk back to the hotel. There are trams though very frequently so if you dont mind hoping on a tram then there is no problem, just make sure you have change. Amsterdam is very expensive, so the hotel was too. The mini bar was full of lovely stuff...BUT STAY AWAY as it will probabley cost you as much as the room for a night!!

Reviews.Title: “a fine place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: BayWalkerScotland
Reviews.Content: I found only one problem in my two-night stay at this comfortable, centrally located hotel close to Amsterdam's famed Dam Square. The problem related to the two lifts (elevators) which are two too few for a hotel of this size. In other respects I couldn't fault the place. Nice room, nice toilietries, plenty of food and drink available at the breakfast buffet and the staff were polite and helpful. Apart from the breakfasts I didn't eat in the hotel but i can recommend the nearby restarants November and D'Vieff Vlieghen - these are a bit pricey, but great for a special meal.

Reviews.Title: “A few misses, but otherwise fine”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED. This is a fine choice despite my 3* ranking. I travel a great deal and faithfully write Tripadvisor reviews. The problems are all rather minor. This hotel is located on a relatively low quiet street with numerous restaurants & pubs. It's is 20 min walk from the main station and Trams 1, 2, & 5 stop less than 1 block away with little waiting. The hotel is in a semi-tourist area with a nice mix. You're an easy walk to anything. Check-in was a tad slow. The property was well maintained. Likes most thirty Dutch, the use of low wattage lighting makes things rather dim. Rooms had wooden floors, which while nice, made the room a little cold. Bedding was excellent and bathroom very nicely done with plenty of hot water. Room to room noise was a problem, very thin walls and noise from the hallway also came into the room. Room size was quite large by normal Amsterdam standards. This is a great choice, I'm giving 3*, 4* in terms of value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: AbbyTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: There are 2 NH Amsterdam hotels- one is CITY CENTER and we stayed at the one that is just NH Amsterdam Center next to the Marriot is the easiest way to explain it to cab drivers. It is within walking distance to a square with many restaurants and bars. We walked everywhere. Close to Red Light District. Canal cruises are 1 block away. The rooms at this hotel are newly decorated, very clean and accomodating. We upgraded to a deluxe room. All have stocked mini refridgerators at a cost, coffee and tea. Comfy beds and pillows. Breakfast is included with some room types and it is well worth it. Very nice. The lounge is modern and quaint. The staff is over the top! Great concierge to help you find the best restuarants. The people gernerally in AMS are very kind and polite. We found that everywhere. The bellman has a great sense of humor so did the bartender. It was wonderful. Wi Fi is available for a fee of between 17 and 22 EUR a day. The NH is 1/2 hour approx. from the airport , cab fare is about 40EUR. This hotel isnt huge which is nice but has ammenities of a large hotel. The staff were like friends at the end of our stay . Great for vacation and excellent for business and also business conferences.

Reviews.Title: “lacked atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: marieIreland
Reviews.Content: hotel was good valu for money we booked with otel.com got one night free with breakfast,room was small but spotless and cleaned daily,bar was useless,closed at eleven sharp and dosent call last orders,but dont worry there is a few bars outside hotel to the right and across the road,get the train to central station when ther get tram tickets a no 2 or 5 three stops get out and look right you will see a sign for soap company turn up that street hotel just in front of you.this was a great location and the trams take you anywere its cheaper to get your tickets in station.we did the trip to the country seen clogs been made and a working windmill then a lovely village vg.canal boat trip very good and anne franks house get tickets on internet for anne franks and you wont have to que.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Helpful_tipper
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. Price is right for the location. Room was very small but clean. The staff was friendly and welcoming. Would recommend this place if you want to walk around Amsterdam and are looking for a decent hotel for a few nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: Vonsie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend when in Amsterdam for a wedding. The location of the hotel was excellent, it is really close to great boutique shops and cosy un-touristy restaurants. The hotel room we had was large, larger than some others at the same rate. In all cases they were clean, well serviced and had everything we needed. Trams stop right outside which go to the main train station - a better option than the â‚¬9 taxi I got. It is also only a minute from a busy shopping street. The staff were friendly and efficient. We didn't eat breakfast as it wasn't included in our rate, instead we checked out some of the cafes on the streets and canals behind the hotel which were great. I would happily stay here again if in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lovebridges
Reviews.Content: Found this a very modern and comfortable hotel. Within walking distance of Dam Square and all the other sites. We had buffet breakfast included in our stay and it was excellent. Plenty to eat and you could have as much as you wanted - orange juice was freshly squeezed. One negative point I would have is that there is no safety deposit box in the room but there is one available at hotel reception which was fine. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: jdtravels2
Reviews.Content: Stay for a weekend in January, the staff was very nice and the hotel was great. Perfect location between everything, would return for sure. Very nice experience. The hotel also allowed us to check in earlier and had a free late check out until 5pm.

Reviews.Title: “Should be rated 4-Star”
Reviews.Author: Euroglobe
Reviews.Content: With a quiet location on Singel canal and its own boat dock, this hotel is centered about halfway between Central Station and Museumplein. The hotel itself is made up of 5 historical buildings put together and doesnâ€™t look like much from the street. But the interior has an expansive and sleek lobby and a large restaurant where an excellent buffet breakfast is served. Spacious modern rooms were immaculate and had all the usual amenities. The hotel offers a â€œpillow menuâ€� where you can request your favorite. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient during my 3-night stay. This hotel is rated 3-star, but I would consider it a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoBroncos
Reviews.Content: About a 2km hike from the train station, although you can catch a tram instead once you know where the hotel is....this hotel is really pretty central to everything the tourist wants to see in Amsterdam. In a pretty nice area of town with good restaurants and bars and bakeries in adjacent buildings. Our room (and many I suppose) overlooked Singel canal. Room was pretty small and oddly shaped which didn't allow us to spread our gear out very much. Staff were helpful and obviously speak good english. Didn't try breakfast at 20 euro a head but it looked good. Overall, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: coco12365
Reviews.Content: Just had a few days break in this hotel..it was great,,had a brill time...Hotel was clean and staff were great..would deffinately stay at this hotel again..it was also in walking distance of pubs clubs...shops and all eating houses..GREAT...

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: RalR
Reviews.Content: We payed 399 Euros for 3 nights (thursday-sunday), we stayed on the third flr overlooking the canal (a must!!) The room was small but very clean and nice. Wonderful bed, clean and equiped bathroom. Great shower- hot water and pressure. We also had breakfast and it was amazing!! a big selection of food. We considered not paying for the brkfst but we would have ended up spending another 1-2 hrs every morning and eating less... The only thing that bothered me is that there was no free wifi, which I think a hotel should give. If you disagree or don't care then disregard...

Reviews.Title: “Greta hotell!”
Reviews.Author: idallas
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a fantastic location. Spotlessly clean with very helpful staff who really did go out of there way to help. In walking distance of everything you nee to see in Amsterdam. If we decide to go back this is where we would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Hotel Overlooking Canals”
Reviews.Author: Paulo1179
Reviews.Content: I love NH hotels, this one is great, the rooms are small (this is standard in Amsterdam) but clean and modern. Great location, with great views of the canals and handy for the local shops and restaurantes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location: not too far from the core, and not too rowdy.”
Reviews.Author: nekz
Reviews.Content: Great location: it's not too far from the action, yet far enough away so that it's not too rowdy. I'd recommend renting a bike to explore, if you can. The rooms are fairly modern and clean, but very tiny. The walls are particularily thin, you can hear everything. The walls tremble when the doors of other rooms are slammed shut. This happens by default, you need to be considerate to slow down the closing of doors. ** The housekeeping staff are very inconsiderate and loud, shouting to each other at the top of their lungs across the hallway. Very inconsiderate for those of us that have our Do Not Disturb signs clearly visible. I have submitted a complaint letter to the management. This is reason enough to not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Boltonian
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location close to the Singel Canal. A short walk to Dam Square and other popular areas. If you book a standard double room they are extremely small although you do get the option on check in to upgrade to a luxury room. Breakfast is excellent with plenty to choose from. Staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant/bar did not open during the day and during our stay only opened on Friday & Saturday evening. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance which offer a good menu choice

Reviews.Title: “Great American-style property”
Reviews.Author: Laulaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH City Centre in July 2007 for one night enroute from Paris to Frankfurt as part of my mother's 50th birthday trip to Europe. We found it convenient to the train station (about a ten minute walk with our luggage), but in a much nicer area than that directly surrounding the station. The front desk staff were quite friendly and provided us with maps, suggestions for restaurants and shopping, and an offer of an upgraded room fairly inexpensively (as well as speaking nearly unaccented English) but we stuck with our standard room, as we were only there for one night, and ended up quite impressed. Rooms were extremely large for Europe and very North American style. Minibar was well stocked, we had bathrobes and slippers in the room, and everything was very clean and well-maintained. We also found it quite convenient for sightseeing and had no problems walking to Anne Frank House, the Rijksmuseum, or the markets.

Reviews.Title: “great your love it”
Reviews.Author: magpie066
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel sep 4 07.for a change we had found a hotel that was well run the staff for once appeared to be enjoying there chosen job what a change.the room we had overlook the canal and yes the room is very important not this rubbish how you are only in it for a short time.we had a superior room it was large very clean the bed was very comfortable.the bathroom with shower very clean with free toiletries.the hotel is very close to dam sq and museums. great restaurant opposite Â£20 three course. one restaurant i would give a miss is gouchoes argentinian steak house over priced poor service and just to dam complacent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot - Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: jibs
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel on my last european adventure. We were only in Amsterdam for a couple of days so the price was ok for that. The hotel was easy to find - less than 5 minutes on the tram from the main train station. its a 10 minute walk to the main shopping strip, Red Light District , Anne Frank museum, etc. Also its a straight forward walk from the Bulldog (because if you're doing the bulldog - you'll need an easy trip home ;) The last night we stayed, we had some rowdy folks in the room next to us, but honestly can't fault the hotel for that - it could happen anywhere! Also recommend the shuttle to the airport - fair priced and pretty quick.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jammy79
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Very friendly staff, lovely room - we had a ball while staying there. there are also some lovely little cafes and resturants - in particular check out the Indonesian style one almost opposite the hotel - delicious lunches there and very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “As expected from reading previous reviews...”
Reviews.Author: mikki25
Reviews.Content: Take platform 3 for the train service from Schiphol to Centraal station (euros 3.6 - Â£2.50 one way) then get on any of tram numbers 1, 2 or 5. Get off at the Spui stop. Cost around Euro 1.6 - Â£1.10). Get on at the middle and pay the conductor. He/she will tell you when to get off. The hotel is just around the corner from the Spui tram stop. Pretty easy to find once you get your bearings. Stayed in a superior room which was worthwhile. Ground floor with canal view. Very comfy beds and I mean comfy. Longest curtains Iâ€™ve ever come across. So big in fact I could have used them as a marquee. Friendly staff. Clean towels every day with a free to use security safe within the wardrobe. Locked luggage room for those late departures. Bar shuts at 12 but there are a couple of small and quaint bars around the hotel. Didnâ€™t have breakfast, as it seemed expensive. Just as well as there is a nice little cafÃ© around the corner called Berts, which does a nice little brekki special for 7euros - Â£4.90. Tea/Coffee, juice plus adequate bread, salad plus filling. Room had lots of TV channels (naturally in Dutch)- however there was BBC World & Eurosport plus Pay TV. Cyclists absolutely everywhere so beware as you walk. An excellent base for walkabouts in Amsterdam and just a few minutes walk from Dam Square (one of the main landmarks of the city).

Reviews.Title: “Enormous Family Room”
Reviews.Author: snowwhite
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July and were delighted to have an enourmous family room with a kingsize bed for us and two separate singles for our children. The room had lots of furniture - too many little tables, a tv with 30+ channels including BBC 1 & 2 and lots of storage. There was tea and coffee in the room too. The windows were full length and the floor was laminate. The bathroom was good and there were lots of free products, not just the normal shampoo and shower gel but a comb, brush, a couple of sponges and body scubs etc all wrapped up individually. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and we made the most of the free sweets and apples. Breakfast was included in our stay and the range was super, we made up rolls and took wrapped gingerbread, biscuits and fruit with us for later. The staff were aware of this and still chatted happily to our 7 yo daughter. The location is good and we could walk every where we wanted to even with the kids. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: azuresky
Reviews.Content: The NH city centre is in a convenient location in between the Dam Square and the Flower Market. The street itself is a bit quiet as you are away from the main touristy area, but there were a few restaurants and coffeeshops close by. We had lunch at Cafe Luxemburg which is just down the street and they have very nice food at reasonable prices. There is also a croissanterie just a couple of metres away that had some delicious pastries - good option for breakfast if you want something quick and tasty. Additionally, one side of the hotel faces the canal which is not only nice for a walk, but also convenient if you want to take a hop on/off canal cruise as there is a dock right near the hotel entrance. Very easy access to trams as well - only about 15min to Centraal Station. Our standard room was on the small side but clean. The bathroom is pretty tiny but perfectly functional. We found staff to be helpful, friendly and well informed about the city and its attractions. Nothing particularly remarkable about this hotel in either positives or negatives, but is good for a short stay in Amsterdam. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a convenient base to explore the city but not particularly fussy about the overall hotel "experience"

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gaggleg
Reviews.Content: I have just spent this weekend (20th-22nd July) at the NH Hotel on Amsterdam's Spuistraat and was generally pleased with my experiences there. I'll start with the good. The spotlessly clean standard double was a good size with attractive, modern decor. For once a room that really does look like the ones on the website! The location was superb; at the right end of Spuistraat, a short walk to some of the city's top restaurants and bars (Envy, Vijff Vlieghen, Cafe Brix) and most beautiful canals (Singel, Herrengracht), a brisk 10-minute walk to the central station and near to a tram stop headed the same way. The reception staff were exceptionally polite and friendly. Now for the not so good: any noise from the corridor was very audible from inside the rooms and one morning we could hear housekeeping vacuuming a neighbouring room. The room was also rather stuffy and this was a lower than average temperature for July. I couldn't say the shower was weak, but it would hardly blast any dirt off you. I consider these things minor for a weekend break and would recommend this hotel to people and stay there again myself, except in the height of summer...

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Very Happy to Have Found This Place!”
Reviews.Author: jeffpeff
Reviews.Content: I had resigned myself to the notion that the only reasonably-priced hotels in a central part of Amsterdam are mouse-infested [--]. Read enough reviews here on TA and you'll think so, too. But this was before I found the NH Hotel City Centre. At around 170 USD a night, it isn't exactly cheap, but what you get for the money is quite good by Amsterdam standards. I've paid a similar amount for much less (see my review of the Hotel Nes here on TA). First off, the building itself is huge...Again, by Amsterdam standards. It's as if someone plunked-down a 'big city hotel' into the middle of Amsterdam's usual narrow/labarynthine walkup buildings, though you wouldn't really know it from the outside. A large lobby, a restaurant (which I never tried...17 Euros for breakfast is just too much to pay, especially considering that I found a cafÃ© right next door that has a perfect breakfast 7 days a week for about 10 Euros.), a similarly-massive lounge, and two full-size elevators (again...rare for central Amsterdam hotels). The location is excellent: A five minute walk to Dam Square, and about a twenty minute walk to either the train station or, in the other direction, the Leidseplein. The Spui tram stop is about 50 yards away from the front of the hotel, just around the corner from a (great) bookstore across the street. There is pay internet in the lobby (forgot the price), or for 10 Euros, you can purchase a password for 60 minutes of wifi (non-continuous over 24 hours, which is kind of handy). The staff I encountered were very friendly and efficient. My room was in the rear of the building, with a canal view (!) Rooms at the front will look out onto Spuistraat, which is full of pedestrian traffic day and night. Quiet and comfortable, a good bed, TV with Dutch channels and BBC. The bathroom was actually better-appointed than more expensive hotels I've stayed at, with quality soaps and such from some Spanish company whose name I forgot. As I'm a guy, I didn't delve too far into it : ) No individual air conditioning per room, but not once was I uncomfortable...Although it was kind of chilly and rainy, even in late June. Smartly, my smoking room had hardwood floors, which, I suppose, cuts down on lingering smoke oddor significantly. I was really pleased to find this place, and would wholeheartedly recommend it. It will be my first call hotel in Amsterdam from now on.

Reviews.Title: “loved our room”
Reviews.Author: oceansand
Reviews.Content: Great location and we had a large room for the 3 of us overlooking canal, so we had a great one week here. The breakfast was really good, but we only ate here a couple times. We went to Croissants nearby for delicous bakery items. Everything worked out pretty well. We did hear people pass by late at night or I should say early in the morning, but that is expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Craigmogs
Reviews.Content: This is an ok hotel in a good location. Dam Square, Leidesplein, RLD and Jordaan areas are all in walking distance from the hotel. Painfully long check in and even worse check out. The first room they gave us was tiny and the bathroom had no bath so I asked to be moved. They did move us to a bigger room next day but as we were there just 3 days not being able to unpack made it feel a bit as if we'd lost a night . There is a good Turkish ( I think ) coffee/sandwich bar just down the canal from the hotel reasonably priced. The train into Centraal from Schipol is fast and efficient and around 8 euros for 2. Taxi to the hotel was 15 euros. I wouldn't stay here again I much preferred the NH Amsterdam Center near the Leidesplein.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nicola_1717
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, lovely room, great staff, great location close to everything & near to tram - we had a lovely view of the canals too!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nexus_qc
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel with a Trafalgar tour. Clean, quiet, full amenities, full bathroom products. My girlfriend loved the bathroom products. Very comfortable beds. No window view to write home about, we got the inside court. Complete and good breakfast in a large and well done room. They were late (~15min) to open the breakfast room, being on a group tour that was negative. In front of a canal, adding charm. Close to the center and a lot of things to see and do. Free city maps and precise info.

Reviews.Title: “Good times, good location”
Reviews.Author: melmacaroni
Reviews.Content: Booked through booking.com. This place was a bit pricey but it was last minute. It ended up being a pretty good location once we got our bearings. You can walk from the train station if you arent lugging too much stuff since its about 10-12 min walk. Its right next to many different restaurants and bars. It was a really busy time during my visit and it would get loud at times on the streets. You know how dudes are that like to gather and sing songs together. Weirdness. There are two entrances one on Spuistraat and one on Singel. We rented bikes and locked them up over night on the back side of the hotel (Singel) that overlooked the canal. There is a bakery just a few steps from the hotel the smelled soooo good (never got a chance to eat there) and would be nice for breakfast. The hotel does have a 16 (EUR) per person breakfast buffet and although I was turned off by the price it is a good deal if you can eat a lot. They had a huge variety and it all looked good. Now im a sucker for free stuff and they really hook you up when it comes to shampoo and loofas and a brush and body wash and... some shoe ... polish. So all in all it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is the City Center”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug_Helper
Reviews.Content: Great price, nice big corner room, hearty breakfast. Best bang for the buck. Close to most major tourist attractions and University.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the NH City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fun loving Sun Seeker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH City Centre hotel from the 27th April - 1st May 07. Also stayed there last year 9th -12th Nov 06. Had a great stay in Nov 06, hence why I went back there again this year and had an equally good stay this year. Went to Amsterdam for Queens Day this year which was excellent fun, so the hotel and the whole of Amsterdam was extremely busy because of these celebrations but this did not effect the level of service at this hotel. Stayed in room 357 this year, the room was spacious, clean and of good condition, the view wasn't too great but the room is situated at the end of hotel building between the main street & the canal so it was perfect on this occasion as I requested a room away from the from street & the canal to avoid be disturbed by the partying that would be going throughout the weekend for Queens day and sure enough, we weren't disturbed so it was fine of this occasion to sacrifice a view for peace & quiet instead. Last year stayed in Rm 352 which faces the main street, this room was more spacious than 357 and of course had the view of Spuistraat St which was lovely. Both rooms were of good condition with tea/coffee making facilities, clean and had a modern style. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel during this stay but did try it last year when I was feeling lazy on my last morning so couldn't be bothered to go out for Breakfast, plus the bakers was closed (on Sundays). The breakfast is expensive but it was enjoyable and there are plenty of hot/cold choices to suit all tastes & preferences. However, I would recommend that you go to the local bakery called Croissants which is about 25 yards to the left of the front of the hotel. They serve very tasty, pastries, crossiants, pizza style rolls & pastries, freshly made rolls & yogurt drinks, excellent value for money and very yummy. Usually go buy my breakfast there and go back up to the hotel to have a coffee & eat my breakfast in the room before going out for the day. As all the reviews state this hotel is situated is such an ideal location, it's close to all the attractions but not too close to be effected by the noise of the crowds etc. The hotel is a modern contempary hotel, with very efficient, professional, helpful staff. The rooms are of good condition and are generally quite spacious, however I have seen that they do have some smaller double rooms so do request a bigger room, if required. You can ask for as much tea/coffee etc as you want, just go to reception and ask for more when your run out. Would always recommend this hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam and I would definitely stay there again on my next visit which will hopefully be real soon. P.S - Very nice restaurant to the left of the front of the hotel about 50 yards called Novembers - have eaten there twice, both times food & service was excellent and excellent value for money, not expensive. The restaurant is very beautiful inside and has a great atmosphere, do check it out

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: tagretchen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH City Centre for one week in April 2007. We were able to obtain a good rate through a corporate discount. I requested a queen room, but was given a twin. Additionally, my non-smoking room smelled of smoke. I complained and housekeeping came up with a can of odor neutralizer. This didn't really help the problem. I asked for an iron --I was told they didn't have them. My colleagues in other rooms had irons. I asked to use the internet --I was told it was broken. The rooms are alright, but have tiny bathrooms. The location is actually pretty nice, with a lot of restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: GloucesterTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Easter and found it a very good experience with the only down side being a very small room and could not change the room as hotel was full, well worth emailing the hotel a couple of days before asking for a particular room. We were on the 1st floor with the window facing on the main road which was a little bit noisy throughout the night but acceptable. Breakfast was included in our rate and was all you could ask for hot and cold buffet, some people were even making up rolls to take out for the day and no one complained. Can recommend the HaesJe Claes restaurant directly across from the hotel A1 Dutch food, try the Stampot. Also Humphreyâ€™s restaurant just off Nieuwe zijds street (one street across from the hotel) towards the station end, full address 23 Nieuwe zijds kolk. Open 17:00 to 22:00, great set three course menu that changes each month. We caught the train from the airport only â‚¬3.60 for a single and only 20 minutes to Amsterdam central station then 10 minute walk to hotel. The trains run every 15 minutes from platform 13A and you can get your ticket the day before you depart as well. You can also catch a train to visit the gardens of Keukenhof with their flower displays. You need to catch the number 54 bus once you arrive at Lieden station and the bus ticket, â‚¬18, includes entry to the gardens. Hotel was excellent value and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend break!”
Reviews.Author: hornet123
Reviews.Content: We spent three days and two nights at the hotel from the 5th April until the 7th. We decided to use the Connexion Shuttle from the airport, a quick easy way to get straight to the hotel. We arrived at about noon a room was ready but as it didnt have a view. We asked to be moved to a room with a canal view. No problem, we just had to wait until 3pm. We walked to Dam Square (10 minutes slow walk) had a light lunch and wandered back buying a few presents en route. Checked into our room small, but perect view of the Singel Canal, room was clean and had everything we needed. We opted for the buffet breakfast-not cheap @ 17 euros but worth every cent as we didnt bother with lunch. Hotel in walking distance to the Rijk and Van Gogh museums and Hard Rock Cafe(about 20 mins) . Ten minutes from the Anne Frank House- a must for everyone- I would advise you to read the book before you go if you havent already. Allow 45 minutes queuing time it was the busiest attraction in Amsterdam by far. We bought a day pass on the canal bus and received slightly discounted tickets to the Van Gogh museum. The boat bus pass lasts for a day plus carries over until noon the following day. They have a great free map of Amsterdam behind reception. I used the internet once I wasnt asked my room number so I am sure I could have used it on an other days if I had wanted to. We opted to eat at the November restaurant on Friday night which had a set menu with quality food, with a good choice and very friendly, efficient staff. We made use of the little discount cards we found in the reception area for some of the attractions, including the Dungeons which was not cheap but a fun experience. All the staff in the hotel were friendly especially the barman who created a lovely cocktail for me! I would definitely stay in the hotel again if I went back to Amsterdam as it is in a wonderful, safe, and quiet position., yet only a few minutes walk from anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “What a location for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dunboy
Reviews.Content: Counties Kerry & Waterford Ireland " Fantastic Experience" Six of us spent three nights at the NH.City Centre,we read the reviews and they were right. A clean and friendly hotel ,located inthe center of Amsterdam. The breakfast was excellent, the staff spoke clear English. A word of warning when you step outside the hotel watch out for bicyles they have the right of way and donot stop for anyone. Also if there is at least six of you inthe group book a mini-bus taxi to the airport it costs sixty euros, the staff at the hotel will obligue. The bar inthe hotel is very lively and again staff very polite and friendly. We had the largest room of the group the other rooms were small. So if you need some space then let the staff know you require room to breathe. We all had a fabulous stay at the NH City Center and would recommend it to those who wish to see all the sights and delights that Amsterdam has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in the center of amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: trinity-tiger
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel in the center of amsterdam - i booked it through travelocity and got a good deal - it is located on spuistraat next to the singel canal and about a 5 minute walk from the dam square - one block over the the new zijds ... street where you can catch a tram to the central station or to go to the museums and the leidsplein the breakfast is very good with croissants, bread, rolls, sweet rools, bacon, sausage links, eggs, cereal, juice, fruit, and coffee - it's a tad expensive at 17 euros per person but you get enough to eat that you don't need to eat lunch the room is clean, but the bathroom doe snot have plugs for american style razors the hotel does offer 15 minutes of complimentary internet service - the official answer is once per stay, but they will let you do it once per day if they don;t run out of the complimentary vouchers - this is conveneint for checking email i would recommedn this hotel for anyone traveling to amsterdam for pleasure or business

Reviews.Title: “so glad I chose the hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvonne84
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel Saturday - Tuesday, it was excellent in every way, location, facilities and service. we arrived on an early morning flight and made our way to the hotel, we were able to check in and leave our luggage in a secure room, leaving us free to explore for the rest of the day. We had decided to take the train from the airport to the central station, this was an easy procedure and we then caught a tram outside the station, three stops and we were just around the corner from the hotel, cheaper than the hotel shuttle service and no problems.The hotel was situated near to the shopping streets, Dam square the flower market and easy walking distance of Anne Franks house. a very convenient location to most places. We had asked for a room overlooking the canal, the room was excellent, clean towels , tea and coffee making facilities, it was very clean, spacious and the decor was pleasant, Our deal came with free breakfast, there was something for everyone, nice bread, cereals, pancakes, cooked breakfast the usual meat and cheeses and fresh fruit, I would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again or recommending it to anyone for a pleasant stay, At the back of the hotel across the canal from the hotel is Cassa David an Italian restraunt , excellent pasta, pizza and steaks , we ate there 2 of the nights and really enjoyed the meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, modern, friendly barman”
Reviews.Author: tiredbunny
Reviews.Content: Fantastic central location so almost no need to get trams. If you do get a tram they are caught from the parallel running street - easy! Our room was overlooking the street rather than the canal but still not a back view and not too noisy as it is a quieter street. Very little noise heard from other rooms, just people in the corridor on their way in or out. Twin beds pushed together - this seems to be standard - bed linen clean and fresh. Room a decent size with a working TV and plenty of wardrobe space. Spare pillow and blanket available. Tea making facilities and a minibar - we didnt use that. A radiator kept us warm and we were able to turn it up and down. A small window can be opened for fresh air. Heavy curtains to keep the street light out. Bathroom good - not huge but fine for visit - had a plastic footstool in it for children to wash at the basin. Clean towels when want. The only niggle was one of the bedside lights didnt work and never got fixed in the three days we were there - despite reception saying they had reported it - I think someone let her down. That wasnt good. Reception okay - the blokes a bit more hostile than the women - the women were quick to serve and straight to the point but friendly too. The blokes were a bit dozy, not really bothered and pretty rude. The bar was okay - the barman friendly. We will stay there again. Incidently, we were in a non-smoking room which was fresh. however there are guests there that will smoke weed in the rooms. This isnt allowed so if it bothers you report it. it didnt bother us and the smell didnt go in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lisainglasgow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a quiet convenient location walking distance to shops, bars and restaurants. Also there are tram stops nearby for further destinations. We booked the hotel for a cheap break through expedia for 2 nights. I wasnâ€™t sure what to expect at that price but I was very surprised. The hotel was very clean. Checking in was a quick process. There where plenty of leaflets and things to do in noted in the lobby. The room was very clean and spacious The drinks in the bar were expensive compared to other bars. There was a very good selection at the buffet breakfast. The only downfall was we werent staying longer

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home base”
Reviews.Author: Tom&Terry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Amsterdam City Centre Hotel over the Christmas holiday and loved it! We booked a hotel/air package through Northwest Airlines that included breakfast. The staff was wonderful, especially the crew in the breakfast room. We enjoyed a 4th floor room overlooking the canal. The room was small but comfortable with a great bed.
