The bathroom was good size and nicely appointed. The hotel's bar was very nice and had great snacks. The breakfast buffet had great variety and kept us going all day. The staff was especially friendly and very welcoming. I will definately come back to the NH City Centre again!

Reviews.Title: “I love the NH!”
Reviews.Author: ninoouk
Reviews.Content: I would (and often do) advise people to stay at the NH hotel. It is dead central in Amsterdam and has everything you need nearby... great restaurants, bars, coffee shops and is in the middle of all the shopping areas! The hotel itself is always very clean, and with very modern rooms. The beds are super comfy and i always get a good sleep. The area where the hotel is situated is very clean and is really festive during the winter months. The staff are very helpful too. The only minor moan i have it that there is no mini bar in the rooms, and not enough tea/coffee making facilities... oh and the soap/shampoo they provide you with doesnt smell too good! I have stayed at this hotel at various times of the year and it has always been pleasant. Highly recommend the NH!

Reviews.Title: “Very ugly building but a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ria_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec-2006 & it was just lovely. We paid Â£68 for a double room. We had room number 321 on the 3rd floor, it was very airy & bright with a lovely view over the canal. It was small but not tiny & modern - it was also very quite we slept like babies. The bed was comfortable & the room was clean. The bathroom was nice too with a good size shower which had good water pressure. The hairdryer was also very efficient. The staff were very friendly & helpful in every way we could even check in early. They were more than happy to provide maps & show where things were in relation to the hotel. Also, left luggage was in a secure room & you got a unique number for your bag which we always appreciate as our flights are always late back. Our booking didn't include breakfast & we decided that â‚¬16 each was too much so we went to the end of the street & had a lovely breakfast at a cafe for less than a third of the price. The location was great, sure the other one in the chain was more central but this hotel was in a less touristy area which was nice. It was within easy walk of the station, Dam Square was just a few minutes walk & Anne Franks house was about 15min walk. It is also near some very lovely brown pubs!

Reviews.Title: “Clean,friendly and central location”
Reviews.Author: SortedGuy
Reviews.Content: It took us 20minutes to walk from Central station to the hotel. We didn't rush because we wanted to absorb the architecture and various sights. We saw Dam Square and 'The 9 Streets' just off from Spuistraat, the route we had taken. Once inside the room was clean, the view was good and the hotel staff friendly. We chose not to eat breakfast here, but instead along the road at Cafe Luxemberg. For 20 euros we enjoyed a good breakfast which kept us going for most of the day. The evening meal was difficult because all along the Spuistraat were some really classy restaurants. We dined in Restaurant Luden about 3 doors from the Hotel. Weird having a cat around our legs whilst dining. Despite this the meal was superb. A bar with a relaxed atmosphere was opposite the Hotel. There were various shops off the Spui in a predestrianised zone as well as all kinds in the '9 Streets' location. The Abraxis coffee shop is along the Spuistraat, where we had a small amount of the Hash Brownie Cake (which an hour later made us both feel relaxed). The staff were friendly and helpful. An Irish pub is just off Spuistraat which served up a great Steak & Guiness pie. Other sights we visited were the Museums, Red Light Area (preferred the daytime than the evening to visit) and department stores. Also worth doing is the candlelight cruise. A 2hr gentle boat cruise around the canal waterways. Wine and cheese and a guide made it very enjoyable, not sure about the Shadows music in the background. Amazing to see how many live in houseboats. We had a great 2 nights in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: iamamsterdam
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, and 2 friends stayed here in early November 2006 for 5 days and we had a very enjoyable experience. My room was small compared to American standards but we had a nice view of the city. My friends' room was much bigger and cozier but their room had no view. The hotel is at an excellent location. 10 minutes to the Leidesplein and Rembrantsplein. 10-15 to Central Station and Red Light District. For the back-packing crowd there are a few coffeeshops on the same street or around the corner. The hotel is a business hotel so dont be surprised to see business men out and about just as one is stumbling back in. Never dined at the hotel as it was too pricey however there is no lack of places to eat nearby. Would DEFINTELY stay here again! Very pleased. Tip: Walk everywhere if you can. Theres no better way to experience the city than by foot!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to enjoy Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Brutus002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH City Centre this past fourth of July week. I have been meaning to post this review since we returned. Overall, this is a very nice hotel in a fantastic location. Our room was on the ground floor and had a canal view. I expected lots of traffic noise or lobby noise, but there was none. The room was very clean and spacious. I had hoped for a king or queen bed, but they pushed two doubles together. Not quite the same, but still very comfy. The bathroom was large, shower pressure good, and there was a toilet in the main bath and a half bath as well, which was a nice surprise. The lobby staff was very friendly and helpful, even though they were always busy helping customers. The best part of the hotel was the location. I can't say enough good things about it. We walked all over Amsterdam and this location afforded us that opportunity. It was less than a 10 minute walk to Dam Square, Red Light Distict, Anne Frank Haus and no more than 15 minutes to the Rembrandt museum, where we caught our bus tours each morning. The walks were beautiful each morning and we truly enjoyed all of the shops and restaurants along the canals. Also, two of our favorite dining experiences were right next door to the NH hotel. The Five Flies is a must do for any trip to Amsterdam. Bar none - best dining experience ever. A close second was the Indonesian restaurant, Kantjil & de Tijger. Great outdoor dining and an explosion of tastes in the sampling style of entrees. The only drawbacks - there was no air conditioning in the room and they ran out of ice in the ice machine 5 out of the 6 days we stayed. They did bring a fan to our room, but it was unseasonably hot in July and the fan offered little relief. I was able to go to the lobby bar for ice, but it was inconvenient. All in all, the good far outweighed the bad and I would stay here again on any future travels to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lynne50
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with 2 friends in October 2006. Arrived late at night found reception staff efficient and helpful. Gave us maps and pointed out major tourist attractions. Room modern, clean with clean towels every day. Did not have breakfast in hotel - thought expensive - 16 Euros - plenty of places to eat nearby. Had no problem operating lifts with door key card. Ideal location plenty bars/restaurants and 10min walk to Anne Frank House. Lovely restaurant couple of doors away - Luden also recomend Casa di David across canal on same street as flower market - but gets very busy, go early or book. Be warned if you request early morning call to get to airport etc - ours never arrived luckily we had back-up but thankfully the taxi was waiting for us as requested. So overall had great few days break definately would use hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at very good value”
Reviews.Author: Maya_tr
Reviews.Content: I frequently visit Amsterdam for business and NH City Center was the best hotel I've ever been in this city. The location is good, central but quite. The rooms are very clean, large and very well decorated. The breakfast is excellent and so are the other services provided in the hotel. The rooms are quite modern and relaxing. They even serve aromatherapic foams and soaps in the bathroom. Back side rooms are better since the back of the hotel faces a part of Amstel river. Not to mention that the value is great. Even in a very busy period in the city we got a very hot deal. I strongly recommend this hotel for everyone

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: milux
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel, for 4 days in october 2006, and it was very nice! It was a double standard room: small, 2 chairs, tv , with a machine to make tea or cofee.No mini bar, no safety box.the windows had 3 types of cortains, and the light/ sun, didnÂ´t enter!! ask a room, with a canal view! the breakfest is expensive: 16 â‚¬ person.so you can go around the corner: it has a lovely bakery!! Dinner: try the restaurant David, in the back of the hotel, very good food and clients, and try also the cafe Lexamburg ou Dante! The location is very good: Spui stop for the trem- 1, 2 and 5. the staff were all very nice and competent( deal very good with problem with my lost luggage, in the airport). i recommend! milux

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmills
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a good location. It is at the Flower market end of the Spuistratt. Takes about 10 to 15 minutes to walk from central station. The room was clean, had a TV, drink making facilities, hairdryer, toiletries, no fridge or mini bar. Average size with a very comfortable king size bed. You are given a swipe card for the key to the hotel room, you need this to operate the lift as well, although, each time we arrived back at the hotel we had to get ours re-programmed because apparently, it cannot be kept by a mobile phone or another credit card (but I only had my handbag to put it in!). Reception staff, ok, not especially friendly or competent, and did seem to be the same girl our entire stay. There are a couple of bars and several cafes/restaurants on the same street. It is a 10 minute walk to the red light district. 15/20 minute walk to Anne Franks House. The bar was ok, and had a happy hour 5pm until 6pm, drinks were half price. Didn't each breakfast because I think 16 euros was too much, there are cafes you can eat in for less on the same road. Hotels seem expensive in Amsterdam, so I would say that this is an ok hotel and would probably stay here again. Paid 298 euros for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jenny25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a couple of friends last week and had a great time. Brilliant location, right beside Dam Square and lots of shopping and resturaunts near by. Staff mostly friendly. Had a very grumpy receptionist when checking in but she seemed to be the only one. We had gotten married the previous week and the hotel had gotten wind of this and left a lovely basket of fruit in our room with a note congratulating us. Our room was very clean, spacious and modern. I recommend asking for a canal view room as we did due to someones recommendation on this site. Our window was very high up so there was a mezzanine level with a small table and 2 chairs so you could sit and see out over the canal. Our room had 2 double beds and two bathrooms. One of which just had a toilet. Our friends stayed in a room right next door but their room was a lot smaller so I would recommend staying in room 27 or similar. If I was to go back to Amsterdam I would definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Laurab7373
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I Stayed here for 7 nights and really enjoyed it. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant, assisting us many times! The rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable. They were also cleaned daily. The Location of the hotel was probably the best feature, with only a short walk to Dam Square, and many other attractions. There was more than one english channel which was good for us, room service is also reasonably priced. We will definately be making this our hotel for any future trips to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, but far from the best.”
Reviews.Author: ulster_tourist
Reviews.Content: Checked in on the 31st July for a 4 nite break with my wife. Exterior a tad gloomy looking, not very welcoming. The room, was very tired looking, dirty chairs, but I soon realiased the reason. The windows were about six foot above floor level, if you wanted to look out, you had to stand on the chairs to do so. Rest of room, reasonably clean. No fridge in room, or no mini bar. I like a fridge in warm weather. Good bathroom, good shower. Checkin girl very friendly, checkout guy very business like, no chat, strictly business. Breakfast far too expensive at â‚¬16:50 each, we got a good breakfast out in the numerous cafes, for around â‚¬7 each. Carpets in main hall area outside bedroom were both dirty and worn. Maids were quite friendly, and cleaned well in rooms. Best quality of hotel was it's convient location. 5 mins from Dam square. I don't think it deserves the rave reviews earlier. I don't think I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but no AC!”
Reviews.Author: GoodyMember
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days at the beginning of July 2006. It's conveniently located to get to the trams or to walk directly to the Dam. Our room was larger than expected (Superior Room), but the air conditioning is very limited - it was hot at night and the cooling unit could not keep up!! Other than that, clean and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no A/C, safe or mini-bar”
Reviews.Author: baileyfirestone
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the NH Amsterdam City Centre at the end of June and were pleasantly surprised with some things and disappointed with others. To be fair, we thought we had booked a hotel with air conditioning and were surprised to find that it did not - especially since Amsterdam was experiencing a heat wave. The staff provided us with a fan which helped cool off the room - especially at night. Things we liked: Location: The location was fabulous. Near great restaurants and shops, within walking distance of most attractions and a block from the tram. Room: The room had been re-modeled and was very clean. The bed was very comfortable and we loved the comforters and wall-mounted lamps next to the beds. View: Even though we were on the street side rather than the canal, it had nice windows, a good city view and great natural light. Shower: Good water pressure and very hot water. Bakery: There is a wonderful bakery next door. We had fresh squeezed orange juice, warm croissants and caffe latte every morning. Shuttle to airport: The airport shuttle picked us up at the hotel and was convenient and reasonable. Staff: The staff was very accommodating to our requests for an extra pillow and the fan. Disappointments: No A/C, No mini-bar, no safe: What 3-star European hotel does not have a safe? Room Size: The room was small with no space to store luggage. And we were supposedly upgraded to a superior room. Common Areas: While the rooms had been re-modeled, the common areas (hallways, lobby, elevators) were old and tired looking. There is a great Indonesian restaurant across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: coolinarrig
Reviews.Content: Just back from a work trip to this hotel and I found the location was great, breakfast perfect and rooms nice and modern. Request a room towards the back of the hotel for lovely views of the canal. Also a lovely restaurant recommended by hotel staff (Casa David) is located at the back of the hotel and across the canal - food was great. We also visited one of the oldest pubs which is just down the road from the hotel (out the front door and turn left), the door was a split door and there was sawdust on nthe floor but they supplied a great pint of Amsel and a great red wine! Would recommend this hotel for a family or couples visiting Amsterdam, near the trams and only a 10 min walk to the second tram line, which brought us to places like the Heineken expereience - great tour! Missed out on Anne Franks house but will definitely return on a family trip at some stage, and will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is average, ok but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: antoniogambadoro
Reviews.Content: It's an average 3 star hotel, with wonderful central location: everything was withing 1 km! We spent 2 nights in a double room and paid 350 euros without breakfast (would have paid +16 euros/ person/day) or extras. I found it a bit expensive since the hotel and the rooms are ok, but nothing special. No minibar, no shops, understaffed. No problem, but nothing that would make us want to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good, nice courteous helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bigbenj
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel two weeks ago when i was on a business trip. Pros - good location, being 10 minute walk away from the Centraal Station, nice courteous and helpful staff, Wifi connection in the rooms (you can buy the prepaid internet card in the reception desk or pay using your credit card online - in some cases it's cheaper to buy the prepaid card). The only con i have is the smallish rooms. It's enough for 1 person, but a bit crowded for 2. If you have two pieces of big luggage it's a problem. Definitely the rooms are smaller than those i have stayed in other hotels during my other business trips. Another thing i liked is that only hotel guests have access to the rooms. You need to swipe your key card on the elevator before you can press the floor where you are staying. This is an added security feature i suppose since hotels in Europe usually don't have security personnel unlike most hotels in Asia (too expensive probably). But it's clean, well maintained and conveniently located. The tram stop (Spui tram stop) is only a minute away (by foot). It's unfortunate i had to check out after 3 days and transfer to another hotel bec they were fully booked, bec. the location is good. I would recommend this place for tourists as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Amber29
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay here and we loved it. We booked a superior room which was spacious and immaculately clean. It was very modern, with incredibly comfortable beds, laminate floor, lovely toiletries and lots of hot water. The staff were pleasant and helpful and we enjoyed having a drink in the bar during the evenings. We found the hotel to be very convenient and was near to everywhere we wanted to go. We were able to walk everywhere which meant that we really saw the beauty of the canals and the architecture. It is very close to the shops and the Anne Frank house. This is a must for any visit. Thought provoking and atmospheric, and with a peaceful cafe to sit and reflect on what you have experienced. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and we will be going back and when we do, we will definitely stay at the NH city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: designjb
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel. If you are used to American-standard hotels, this is the place for you. It has modern rooms and conveniences. It's not your typical smaller European hotel. The rooms were very clean, large and above average in comfort. The hotel overall was contemporary and felt more like an American hotel. It is conveneintly located to so much! Easy walk to the tram stop. Just one block. Many cafes, bars and restaurants within walking distance. Visit the Hoppe pub just up the street. Over 300 years old. And get a glass of jenever. You can easily walk to the easy shopping street, and the Amsterdam historical Museum is very close. We walked all over the place while we stayed there. We only took the tram to go to the train station with our luggage. But we are walkers. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. They spoke very English well, as most people in Amsterdam did. Who cares how fast the elevator travels? Is that really important? It didn't matter to us. We got to our room just fine. And a great room it was. I would definately recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “OK but with problems”
Reviews.Author: Ed05
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three or four times now ( my company get some sort of deal). The rooms are OK if small. but modern and attractive. There is no mini bar. Depending on the room you get the hotel can be horribly noisy. The lifts are incredibly slow as is the service at recption which is woefully understaffed at busy times. Breakfast is good and plentiful for a European hotel. In short this hotel is just about OK but I would not spend my own money on it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting Amsterdam for the first time, for a trade conference and also a small holiday. After hearing some horror stories about the cheaper Amsterdam hotels we spent an afternoon on this site trying to find something nice that wouldn't break the bank. We were very happy with the NH City Centre, the reviews here were spot on. It was right in the centre of the town, a small walk away from most places (and next to the tram stop for ones further away). The rooms were designed well, modern and very clean. The bathroom and shower was great, the NH hotels all give away a great set of shampoo/gel/soap. We even bought a pack when we left! The staff were very friendly, giving us a map and marking where we were heading each time. Only slight down-point was that the room was a little cold and the bed covers not too thick but to be fair to the hotel we didn't bring this to their attention. We'll definitely be back there though next year.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in an evene greater location”
Reviews.Author: DavideB
Reviews.Content: I spent the Easter holidays in Amsterdam with my wife. After a long evaluation I choosed to stay at the NH City Centre because of the location and the price. This has been my third trip to Netherland's capital and this hotel is the best I remember of. The location is great, 10 minutes south of Dam square and close enough to the museums (Van Gogh...) to think about going there by foot. The tram stops at the next road. The hotel's front side is quite large for a building in the Amsterdam's centre and many rooms face the Singel canal. I booked a superior room and ended up in a huge 4 bed room in the top floor, the view was marvellous, I like to think it was the best room... Breakfast is great, pastries and croissants are delicious (crispy and delicate as it should be) I am glad I haven't payed for breakfast in advance because a discount was offered to us during check in. The room was very clean (dust is a problem for me...so I check it) and stylish. My wife really loved the place. Last but not least, 3 of the best restaurants in Amsterdam (according to Lonely Planet guide) are next to the hotel. The dutch restaurants "Haesje Claes" and "De Vijff Vlieghen" are excellent, something to experience if you plan to visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: JamesRye
Reviews.Content: We were so glad that we found this hotel. Initially we thought it might be disappointing. It is located in the University district and the external facade looked mundane and the entrance lobby could best be described as "stylish, but slightly old-fashioned". However, we soon learned that intitial appearances can be deceptive. The rooms were spotlessly clean and we loved the decor. However, what really impressed us were the gems behind the reception desk. All the staff seemed exceptionally well trained, were fluent in between two and four languages, and seemed to give the impression that they were there to be helpful rather than to pass the time of day waiting for a pay cheque. The location was central, and therefore close to shopping and within walking distance of all the major attractions - including the more distant Van Gogh museum. Central shopping was just across the road and through a side street. And Dams Square was just up the road. Being close to the University there were lots of cafes and restaurants on the doorstep. The one disappointment with the hotel was the standard of the room service food. The lettuce was going brown at the edges and the burger was black. Pity the catering that we saw didn't match the front of house skills. Perhaps it was a good thing that breakfast wasn't included in our tariff and we opted to go to a local cafe instead. The hotel is also on the Shuttle Service route from the airport. It's relatively cheap and hassle free. We will be coming back. The location and quality of staff service are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: redwhite
Reviews.Content: Have just spent five days here, and enjoyed the time spent in the hotel. It is an art deco building thoughout, and is very well located. The room was spacious, spotless and quiet. A 10-15 minute stroll brings you to Dam Square, a 2 minute walk brings you to the Spui square. There is a book market on Saturday and an art market on Sundays at the Spui. If you pre-pay the breakfasts, you get money off, the breakfast is very good, served from 7am to 11am. The evening restaurant is limited but good, we ate there twice. There are numerous restaurants around the hotel, directly accross the road is a vey good 'Dutch' restaurant, next door is the 'Five Flies' supposedly the best in Amsterdam. From the airport we got the connexion coaches, follow signs for hotel coaches, 11 euro each to the hotel. Our flight back was early so we got a taxi to the airport, 60 euro! One tip is to use the trams, they go everywhere and save the walking, and are cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went away for girls weekend. Centrally located hotel. The rooms were clean and hotel staff very helpful. Close to bars, shops and Red Light District.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good points- The hotel was right next to everything! The spa is right across the street as soon as you walk out for a nice relaxing massage. Restuarants everywhere! The Van Gogh & the Anne frank is within walking distance. If Dutch food is not your style, you can always walk to the supermarker .10 of a mile away. bad-1/2 a mile from the hotel (to the right) is where the "red light" district starts.

Reviews.Title: “excellent refuge from a busy city”
Reviews.Author: Icexpat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a brutal week of business travel in the south of Holland, this hotel was a wonderful surprise. My company booked me here on very short notice, and I got a 5th floor room that was flooded in sunlight and had a panoramic view of the Amsterdam skyline (#501). The decor is subdued and comfortable, and the deco style (with many original details) of the building is great and different in teh middle of all the 17th century architecture. It's also the best-smelling bathroom I have ever experienced in a hotel- fresh and kind of citrussy (Not usually something you think about in a hotel but it was really noticeable here). Breakfast was decent, with a discount if you requested it on check-in. The homemade bread full of seeds was particularly good, and the yogurt-type stuff for fruit was great too. The place was very clean, comfortable, and I had no problems with noise. The ONLY caveat I would mention is that I had a non-smoking room but there was a smoking place just one meter outside the door, so sometimes it seeped through under the door. Otherwise I loved it and would definitely stay there again if I went back. Also, the airport shuttle was a great worry-free way to get home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fulfilled all our requirements, clean, friendly and extremely central. Wished they could have made the weather warmer though but still a wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, helpful, perfect situ.”
Reviews.Author: MKG79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights for a friends 30th birthday in November 2005. Excellent service - our bags were bought up to our modern, very clean rooms without prompting. Reception staff were fantastic - even giving us a local map highlighting various points of interest we wanted to visit. Was able to walk everywhere or easily jump on a tram making everything accessible. Also easy to get a cab to and from the airport for transfers. Lovely hotel - great service.

Reviews.Title: “Total winner!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bluey1981
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews i wasn't sure what to expect but have been totally won over by this hotel and the staff! Its in the heart of Dam only a 2minute walk to the square and 5-10 minutes walk from everything you'd wish to visit. Originally located the wrong room but our friendly receptionist rectified the error immediately!! It was bright and airy and clean i had no complaints and a lovely view at the back over the Singel canal. Gerzonis is worth a visit for dinner the guy behind the bar was a gem. Can't fault this place at all would totally recommend to anyone!! Def going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH City Centre for our only night in Amsterdam (mid-September) and had a great experience. The room was spacious and bathroom/shower very nice - loved the toiletries! Enjoyed a fantastic Indonesian meal just down the street and had lovely pastries for breakfast at a nearby bakery. We found the hotel's location quite convenient and the staff very helpful. In our 24 hour stay, we did a canal tour, visited the Heineken Experience, saw the floating flower market, and visited the Anne Frank house. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but perfectly fine - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: spacekid
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the NH City Centre and the main reason I booked it was because it is right next to my favourite restaurant in Amsterdam, Luden (highly recommended!). The hotel is in an excellent location, right next to the main shopping area and near good restaurants and bars (another tip - if you like whisky, you'll love De Stijl which is just up the road from the hotel and has hundreds of types of whisky). My room was very small but I was travelling alone so it wasn't a problem (although I wondered where I could put my suitcase!). The interior was quite modern and the room was clean. Bottled water is available in the room for 2 euros. I didn't bother with breakfast as I was catching an early train from Centraal station so I can't comment on that. I wouldn't stay here as a tourist (I would want a bit more character e.g. Canal House, or I would rent an apartment overlooking one of the canals) but it is absolutely fine for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at NH City Centre Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ally47
Reviews.Content: Arrived in this hotel on friday 4th November 05. We had booked two double rooms through the NH hotel website and confirmed by phone. The cost of the room was â‚¬150.00 and we decided to upgrade to a superior room for â‚¬20.00 per night. We have previously stayed in a 3 star in amsterdam and had a terraible experience so were very weary as to what would greet us! Once we opend the bedroom door what a surprise - the room was very spacious and on two levels. Everything was very clean and the bed was a kingsize with crisp white linen. The decor was modern in style and the room had tea and coffee making facilties. The second room was almost the same but on one level with two seperate toilets?? We found the hotel staff efficent and helpful. We did not eat in the hotel but had breakfast in one of the many cafe locally. The location of the hotel was excellent - within walking distance of dam square, flower market and anne franks house. We were located on the ground floor of the hotel but found it quiet and restfull. The shuttle bus "connections" is available to and from the airport at a cost of â‚¬11.00 per person - however as there was four of us we took a taxi which cost us â‚¬35.00 from the hotel to the airport aprox 20mins. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would return to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location to explore...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The NH City Centre from Oct 8th - 15th, in a Superior King Size room. The room was very clean and of nice size. We had a canal side room however no view of the canal as the 5th floor rooms have an overhang below which blocks the view. Room pictures were exactly as our room looked. No noise issues as we weren't on the street... but if your worried about noise why would you book a hotel in the center of a city? Booked the stay thru NH site directly, pricing was the same as thru expedia and other sites. We confirmed our reservation with both the central booking and by email directly with the hotel and had no problems. Hotel location is ideal. Easy walk from central station, very close to Dam Square and all centrum sites, cafes and coffee shops steps from hotel. We stayed at Krasnapolsky 2 years ago and would have again but rates had gone way up. Our room at City Centre was very similar , just a tad bit smaller but very nice and still convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and tiny bedroom.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent position right in the centre of Amsterdam. However two negative points about the hotel were: 1. Noise. Our bedroom overlooked the front of the hotel on the third floor. My wife and I were awakened several times every night by the road noises from outside. 2. Very small bedroom. Our so called double bedroom was in reality a small single room. with insufficient room to even allow for a second bedside table! Hotel facilities were oterwise good but the night noise and cramped bedroom did spoil our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at NH Amsteram Centre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a 3-day weekend with my wife at this hotel. The main reason for my choice was the good location. WeÂ´ve got a little bit disapointed arriving at the hotel, knowing we will spend 2 nigths at a 5-star hotel. The reason was that we saw photos of the hotel online, which obviously shows rooms, entrances and halls we didnÂ´t see being there. Tip: never act in accordance with picutres in brochures or online websites. Behind the window we saw the hotelÂ´s backyard with its noisy aircondition facility. We were at the 6th floor and with the window opened you canÂ´t get asleep because of the noise. Fortunately we didnÂ´t have a room in the 1st or 2nd floor as the noise would be more bothering. TIP: after check-in you should let check the content of the minibar to avoid misunderstandings. They wanted to charge me 42 euros for beverages I ostensible had use. After a gratuitous discussion at the reception they made some calls and finally didnÂ´t charge me anything. The staff at the reception wasnÂ´t friendly and didnÂ´t excuse for their mistake! Not very professional for a 5-star hotel staff. TIP FOR CAR TRAVELERS: As the hotel does not have an own parking area, you have to park at a park block 100m away. 24h of parking will cost you 36 euros. Parking blocks in the center of Amsterdam costs 40 up to 50 euros for 24h. One hour costs 3-4 eur depends on location. Almost the same price you have to pay if you want to park in the streets. You can save 40 eur for 24h of parking if you park on a sunday in the streets, as then it is for free ;-).

Reviews.Title: “Happy Chappies!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time here. Great room, bit small, but great views of the canal. Wood floors, very clean, good bathroom with shower. Would stay again. Lovely art deco styling.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, but problem with late arrival.”
Reviews.Author: lady_voyager
Reviews.Content: We only had one problem with this hotel ... we booked online and telephoned as requested to inform them of our late arrival, the person we spoke to was rather dismissive and said it was fine (should had smelled a rat). When we arrived at 9.30pm they said that our booking was only secured until 8.00pm and that they didn't have a room for us. Now having first hand experience of 'Dutch Customer Service' we switched to Dutch and stood our ground, explained that we had in fact telephoned two weeks earlier, explained about the dismissive girl etc. in the end they 'found' a room for us. The room we had was quite large, very dark (for sleeping) and very quiet so we had some of the best nights sleep we've ever had in a hotel. The bathroom was nice, good toiletries, etc. Everything was very clean. The location is also fantastic, 5 minutes from the Kalverstraat shopping street and 10 minutes from the Leidseplein but far enough away from the tourists who congregate on the Damrak, Red light district. It was very accessible by tram too. The price was also very reasonable. The reception service was a bit 'hit and miss' they did loan me a UK adaptor, however they did forget to book my friends airport shuttle bus (luckily she is also quickly learning about 'Dutch customer service', so she booked the one before the one she really needed) and I heard antoher customer complaining about the cost of the parking which hadn't been made clear at the time of booking) All in all I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_Meehan
Reviews.Content: I went over with another female colleague for 2 nights. On arrival we got a bit lost but then found it ok (after seeing 2 trams collide). We arrived around 2pm so put our luggage in a holding room where they give you a ticket for each item and then had a walk around until check in time at 3pm. The tram stop SPUI is just one street away. You can get the 1, 2 or 5 from Centraal Station. We asked for a twin room with a canal view. The room was small but fine as we were only there 2 nights. The 2 beds were together which were a little too close. You get complimentry soap, shampoo & shower gel - the soap is lovely. The reception staff were always friendly and courteous and the sweets in the glass jar on reception were very nice. We found the local bars and restaurants very good. The food was great at Luxembourg (turn right out of entrance) and there was a band on. For our other meals we ate either in town or in Leidseplein. After a canal tour we walked back to the hotel from Centraal Station and found a Red Light Area at the bottom of Spuistraat which was a bit of a surprise as we expected them all to be in the one area. When we checked out at 11am they let us use the holding room for our luggage so we didn't have to carry it around all day. We went to the Albert Cuyp market in De Pijp which is past the Rijk Museum. What a great market. Full of local people so it must be good. We sat and had a drink whilst listening to a man busking playing a double bass. We did a lot of walking although we could have took the tram to a lot more places and saved the aching hip, calf and feet. We had 3 full days but could have done with more time. The weather was perfect. All in all the NH City Centre is a very nice hotel in a great location just out of the hustle and bustle (safe enough for 2 girls to walk to at night). We have both said we would definately go to this hotel again. (I'll take my husband next time and then he can carry all my bargains from the market).

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: Overall I was happy. The location is great, although next time I might stay in Leidesplein (but thats just a personal preference). Decent cafes nearby, including the Luxembourg Cafe. A decent Shaorma Restaurant across the street. This hotel is in a quiet neighborhood, close to tram and witin walking distance of EVERYTHING! The main shopping district is around the corner, literally a 2 minute walk. The hotel had a very comfortable bed, decent furnishings and although the room was small, I was happy. Better than Holiday Inn Quality, but not the Marriott if this is a helpful comparision. 15 Euros a day for wi-fi, but hey, it Europe they seem to have high internet prices here. I wil stay here again but not in the summer, I do not think the hotel is airconditioned, at least I couldn't find it. But then again, many hotels here have no a/c.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE Stayed here in early March of 05. The price was right, i believe we paid 65Euro not incl breakfast the location is perfect. very close to most everything but also just away from all the action, nice and quiet. tram stop right out front.... the room was not large but nice. bathroom is fine. i read below that the bathroom was small, i didnt think so. rijstaffel across the street is a must Kantjil %Tiger is great all in all a very good value for price paid- i would not hesitate to return here

Reviews.Title: “Well Chuffed!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa1001
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and myself stayed at this hotel last week (31/8-2/9) and we had a great time. The hotel looks very smart not what I was expecting at all. The check in was smooth and hassle free (even though we where a bit early), but there was a moment of panic when I realised we had to put down a deposit for the room (â‚¬200) but this was an error on my part really. The rooms looked great, clean, tidy and well decorated too. Most of all though they felt very comfortable and safe. The location of the hotel was ideal, everything being only a short walk away. There was an ample selection of coffee shops, bars and cafes to chose from just outside the hotel. My fav part of hotels are the showers (I have a thing about them!) and Iâ€™m glad to say this one was excellent! The only grip about the whole trip is that I wish we stayed longer to explore the area more. But weâ€™ll be back and Iâ€™d recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean, and good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was great! The hotel is in reasonable walking distance of almost anything you want to see - The Van Gogh museum, The Anne Frank house, the train station etc. My boyfriend tried the restaurant in the hotel and said it was pretty good but pricey. I went to the restaurant on the corner (on the canal side of the hotel) as other people on TripAdvisor suggested and wasn't disappointed! A great meal for the price and very nice staff - full of locals! As someone else stated the front desk is a little understaffed we had to wait a while both checking in and checking out... but all in all the hotel was safe, clean, and great location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: doctke
Reviews.Content: For 3 first time friends visiting Amsterdam we could no have asked for a better location. Located at the base of one of the inner canals we were extremely close/in all the action. There were several coffee shops within a minute walk of the front door, including the Dampkring from Ocean's 12. As for the hotel, our room was clean and we had no problems with it. The only knock is that you are lead to believe that breakfast was free and they get you for 16 Euros. Chalk that one up to us being beginners in Europe. I would definately stay at this hotel again as I felt that I was in the center of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, located in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ralfvd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Amsterdam, a 15 minute walk from the Central Station. Tram and bus stops are nearby. Hotel staff is friendly. They might want to have a bit more staff on duty, checking out at 8am took +- 15 minutes. My room was a small room, the bathroom is small as well, the shower is good enough. All over the room were little 'flyers' of the NH brand. On your pillow is a 'sleep well' card. Nice thought. The bed is of reasonable quality. The room size is a bit of a downside, but if you just want to sleep (come home late, leave early), it is perfect. If you want to work / leisure on the room, I suggest phoning in in advance to check if they have more spacious rooms available. Overall, great hotel if you are not too afraid of small locations. The fact that it is in the heart of Amsterdam, is very attractive to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent locale. 3 coffeeshops within 1 minute's walk”
Reviews.Author: millionaire64
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself and the room we had was clean and looked nice & simple. Nothing fancy, but better than Best Western. The room was small even though we were assured it was a Superior Room with a double bed. Definitely would not wanna stay for more than 5 days because of the small size of the room, but it sufficed for 4. In fact, it more than sufficed because there were no bedbugs or leaky ceilings or other mishaps! The bathroom only had a shower. The floor leading to the shower and the showerfloor itself were slippery. They did not have any perma-grit for traction. Other than that, the bathroom was clean and modern. The toilet was a source of endless fascination... The room was clean & fresh every day even though it was a smoking room. Our room faced the canal at the rear of the building. Quite a pretty view but the noise from the obnoxious-sounding scooters at all hours of the day and night can take some getting used to. You don't really wanna shut the windows...but sometimes you have to just to get a night's rest (or a late afternoon nap). The ice is free. There are softdrinks in machines on the 2nd & 4th floors. They each cost 2 euros. That's about what they cost throughout central Amsterdam. The candy machines: Put your coins in first, then make your selection. The candy machine on the 2nd floor stole about 1.60 euros. Use the 4th floor. About one minute away, across the street and down the 1st alley to the right of the Italian Ristorante is Kadinsky Coffeeshop. Good prices and selection. We sat at the front window and got mellow. The other 2 coffeeshops within a minute's walk are to the right as you exit the front of the hotel. You walk past the cafe tables and make a right down the 1st (or 2nd) alley and you'll find Tweede Kamer, and then a few steps away, on the corner, is Dutch Flowers. If you just start walking in any direction from the hotel you're bound to come across a coffeeshop. Behave yourself, be discrete, use your good manners, and smoke much less than you normally would, and you'll have a good time. This is supposed to be a review of the hotel... Bottom line: It was clean and safe. The front desk is understaffed but the available staff are courteous. We would go there again---unless we could find a bigger room somewhere else for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: UKlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the NH City Centre for 2 nights in July 2005. If you're travelling from the Schipol airport to this hotel, be sure to take the Connexions shuttle bus service from outside the airport arrivals - 17.50euros for a return ticket and they drop you right outside the door to the hotel! You can book your return pick-up time at the Hotel reception. We arrived at the hotel at 11am so didn't expect a room to be ready, they did hold our luggage for us until 3pm though. Apparently all the hotel rooms differ in size so I can't directly compare our room, it was a fair size for the two of us for two nights, but I wouldn't want to stay for much longer in such a small room. However it was spotlessly clean, the beds were very comfy, nice modern decor, the shower was powerful and noise from other guests wasn't a major problem. The best feature of the hotel is the location - 10 mins from Dam Square and the Royal Palace, 3 mins from Flower Market, 10 mins from Leidseplein, 10 mins from Anne Frank's house (walking distances) - we didn't get a bus or tram anywhere because we were so central to everything. They definately need more reception staff at this hotel as whenever we needed to visit reception we had to wait 5/10 mins (even just to re-programme our room key as it wouldn't let us in). I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a clean, comfortable and affordable base to explore gorgeous Amsterdam! I will be back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: marayga
Reviews.Content: The location was good for shopping and close to Madame Tussaud's. The rooms were clean and spacious. The first floor corner room my parents had was two levels with a king size bed. Our room was next door with twin beds, a tall ceiling and a small street level window. It would have been nice to have a small fridge in the room. Though they seemed to be a bit under staffed at the front desk they were friendly and courteous. The breakfast buffet was excellent, although pricey, but this typical. There are two wonderful restaurants just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the Centre!”
Reviews.Author: silvergirlracer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night break in Amsterdam. We booked the NH Ciry Centre hotel using bookings.nl and got a pretty good deal. The reception area was big and clean as were all of the other public areas. We arrived before the normal check in time but we were allowed to complete registration and store our bags in a locked room until 3:00 pm. The staff were very friendly and helpful - we had a problem with the noisy stairs door which was next to our room on the first night but we were quickly moved without any fuss at all. We never ate in the hotel but they offer a three couse meal for 19.95 euros which I thought was pretty good value. The rooms are not huge but the two we had were very tastefully decorated with modern colours and furniture. Security is good too as you cannot enter the lift or stairs area without a room key. Excellent central location only a few minutes walk from Dam Square and The Leidseplein. All in all lovely hotel with a good location. Would stay again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: wardw
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my trip to Amsterdam. The NH City Centre Hotel was very nice. Both my friend and I stayed on the 5th floor. These rooms had been recently renovated. The only problems I had with the hotel was that there were no washclothes in the bathrooms and the rooms did not have air conditioning. From what I understand, not having air conditioning is pretty common through out Europe. This in itself would not have been bad, but it got rather warm for this type of year. The only other complaint is the maid staff was a little noisy. But considering my friend and I were out partying until 3am and not getting up until 11am or so, this is not really all that bad. We needed to get up anyway. I could not have asked for a better location. From the hotel, it was either a few minute walk or up to about 20 minute walk to just about anything we wanted to see and do. We could have used the tram system, but I really did not understand the Strippenkart and the different zones. Great shopping within 5 minutes on Kalverstraat. There is a great Indonesian restaurant right down the street. We ate dinner in the hotel one night and we both really liked our meal. The price, of our meal, was very comparable to eating in other restaurants. We never got up early enough to try the breakfast. The price of the breakfast had been reduced to 13,50 Euros. Overall, the price of the hotel was great given the location. I would definitely consider staying here again, but I would bring my own washcloth and would try to go when I knew it would be rather cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cheerfulchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days and enjoyed the hotel. It was clean, the room was a good size, the service was good. We liked being able to safely open the window of our third floor room for fresh air. The location is great in that it is easy to walk to most tourist places easily. The tram stop is just down the road - less than 5 minutes walk. There are numerous good restaurants handy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: barbados14uk
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here for the weekend 8-11th april. Taxi from the airport was 45eu but we did get to see apart of the town we wouldnt normally have!! i would like to mirror the previous writers comments. The breakfast was ok but not worth the 16eu per person. it wasnt til the last day that we found a great place to eat for breakfast, in dam square to the left of the palace as you view it , new cafe (seating outside).apart from that the hotel was clean and the staff friendly. we visited the sex museam ok and the torture museam not so ok. we recommend tour company Best of holland and in particular the city tour by coach and boat 32eu. the hardrock cafe was, as usual good value and for a late nite drink try cafe alto. live jazz . This was abit difficult to find, pick up one of the cards in reception but its only 10mins walk from the hard rock, if you find bergerking then its just to the right of that. excellent get there early!! we also found just off dam square (facing monument , road to the right dam street about 100yds on rh side) argentinos (blue canopy over window) steak to die for, really did melt in the mouth!!! there is alot of construction in the redlight area and alot of weirdos but the women in the larder fridges were an interesting diversion!! have fun

Reviews.Title: “Only if there was nothing else available”
Reviews.Author: quilt00
Reviews.Content: I might have been spoiled after spending 5 days in an amazing hotel in London (the Queensgate), but the NH wasn't really anything to write home about. It smelled like cigarette smoke everywhere, from the lobby to the elevator to the room. The bed was not comfortable and the room just felt dirty. On the plus side, the room was larger than anything I've come across in Europe and reception was pleasant and helpful. The best part of the hotel was its location -- it was central and allowed for easy access to all the majot sites. I suppose if the price was right, I could make a reservation again. Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: metalliam
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the guy who said it stank and the location is bad was on about. The staff are helpful, the location is great and the luggage storage room was very good, they give you a ticket, unlike some other hotels i've stayed at. It's a 5 to 10 minute walk max to the main areas of town, and all the good coffee shops. There's one just down the street called Kajinksy or something, nice friendly place. I asked for a room with 2 single beds, when we got to the room it was one big bed but you could split them. The beds seemed soft enough to me, but after the days I had anything would have been ok. I really don't understand it when someone says a room stinks, man, just go ask for another room. If you really want to be sure of success, do it when other guests are around. I used TripAdvisor to scout this hotel, and as usual, I got what I expected. I'm going back at the end of May to celebrate my 21st...i'm glad I know how good the hotel is already!

Reviews.Title: “Mercedes Like (Nordic, Spartan, Functional, Clean) Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seneca44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here February 2 through 8, 2005 as part of a Gate1Travel package. We had newly refurbished rooms which were quite large by European standards. I thought this was very much like an American Chain hotel in that everything worked and the rooms and common areas were kept clean. I usually stay in Prinsengracht or Jordaan, and this hotel does not have the "character" of those areas, but a little character wears thin after 2 or 3 days of ascending steeply pitched stairs. The buffet breakfast was great, but I did not eat any other meals in the restaurant. There are lots of good restaurants in the neighborhood (including a very expensive French one next door). The Indonesian place across the street was fantastic and quite reasonable even in devalued US dollars. Location wise, this hotel is ideal for tourists in Amsterdam because it is near everything yet still relatively quiet. The major tram line (Spui stop) is one block away and Albert Hejn supermarket is one tram stop away. Many restaurants and coffee shops right in the neighborhood; the major shopping street of downtown Amsterdam is two blocks over. All in all, a great hotel. A little lacking in Dutch "quaintness" if that is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterUKAndy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a short weekend in March 2005, the locations very good, right in the centre of Amsterdam (within walking distance of the Central Station) the room are very small (and the bathrooms even smaller) although spotlessly clean. Didnâ€™t have a breakfast in the hotel so canâ€™t comment whether they are good or bad (there is a very good Dutch bar approx 100 metres up the road next to Bobs Youths hostel that does very nice breakfast though, sorry remember the name in Dutch but translates to the â€˜crew loungeâ€™ or similar in English. There is a â€˜mini red light districtâ€™ at the rear of the hotel, but this wasnâ€™t a problem, and the carpet throughout the hotel is positively disgustingâ€¦..enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us good for the weekend.”
Reviews.Author: travel23
Reviews.Content: The NH Amsterdam City Centre is a nice clean hotel located off the Spui right near the 1/2/5 tram line and is only a 3-5 min ride to Centraal Station. There is a small alley that you can cut through to get from the tram stop to the hotel, this walk less than 5 mins. We booked a superior room on expedia for 2 nights and arrived Friday morning at 8am. When we arrived at the hotel, we checked in and they stored our bags an told us the room will be ready at 11am. We went and did the Heineken brewery tour and by the time we were done it was time to check in. We got a room on the 4th floor and it was nice and clean, a little on the small side but overall very nice for Europe standards. I then called the front desk to ask if this was a regular or superior room and it was a regular room. So we went back to the front desk and changed keys to get our superior on the 1st floor. The superior room is a bit larger BUT the bathroom seemed to be a bit smaller and the shower stall was not as nice as the regular room. Both bathrooms were clean, soft towels, soap, shampoo and even a little shoeshine kit. I also noticed the laminate wood flooring was very nice, the maid service was very good and overall I would stay at this hotel again. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, so I canâ€™t comment on that; we chose to eat at the Luxembourg CafÃ© a few doors down. Great location to the tram stop!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A 'diamond' in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SBarnesDarlington_UK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 5 day break in Amsterdam - we were first time visitors and we can't wait to return!!! The NH City Centre should be reclassified - it is well above 3* status. We found everything about it excellent - the staff, the food, the room and the location which meant that we could walk to all the "must see" sights very easily. Local restaurants were very good; we ate at the Tapas bar, the Tiger Javanese restaurant and the Caprese Italian place which were all just across the road from the NH front door. The Luxembourg bar which is just up the road is superb for both snacks and more substantial meals and the staff there are very friendly and helpful. Some other reviewers have commented on the small size of the rooms at the NH- to us they were comparable to British "chain" hotels and we were happy with the tea+coffee and TV which had BBC1+2 and a pay to view facility. The shower was powerful and toiletries and towels were replaced every day.Beds were very comfortable and immaculately clean. Travel from the Central Station was cheap, fast and efficient - we visited Haarlem(very attractive) and Zaanse Schans (commercialised but quaint too). When we return we will visit Rotterdam and The Hague-both equally easy to reach and trains are regular and punctual. We have nothing but praise for Amsterdam and the Dutch people we encountered. We may not wait until next year to return and we will DEFINITELY stay at the NH City Centre again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: davybabyests
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam in early February and found this hotel to be in a great location for all the attractions of the city. Our room, on the fourth floor, overlooked the Singel canal and was clean and quiet. It seemed to us that the bathroom had been added at a later date which made the room an odd shape and somewhat cramped but as we did`t spend too much time there it was not a problem. The staff were helpfull and the buffet breakfast was fine. There are lots of resturants and bars close by and we found the Spui bar, a few doors from the hotel to be welcoming. We would certainly return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but.... small room”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaKoko
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was excellent. It was close to everything and a walking distance to the Red Light District and a few stations away from the Anne Frank Museum. But..... the rooms are very small..... kind of has the feel of a business hotel instead of a tourist hotel. And beware of their elevator.......... very very wierd.... at least to us who are used to modern amenities. Just for one night to explore Amsterdam.......? We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We'll go there again!”
Reviews.Author: T0ul0use
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Amsterdam and we stayed in the NH Amsterdam City Centre for 5 nights (Jan '05). Booked it through Bookings and got a deal which was good. The hotel is ideally situated on the Spuistraat which is nice and quiet when you want to sleep. Dam Square is less than a five minute walk away as is the Floating Flower Market. There's also a couple of nice coffee shops and a smart shop on the same street if you're into that kind of thing. We were so impressed with the location that we'll be booking this hotel again when we come back. The staff were all lovely and very helpful. Nice italian restaurant downstairs and you can order this food for your room if so inclined. The first night we did this there was a problem in the kitchen, no food after an hour. I rang them back to make sure they hadn't forgotten us and the waiter told me about the problem and he had also knocked 10% off the price of both our orders. Got the food straight away. Very impressed. The room itself was very pretty, nice comfortable bed, window on one whole side of the room, heating that you can adjust yourself (it was freezing when we were there), wooden floors, big shower and MTV and BBC on the telly, woohoo :) The only quibbles I had were both to do with the cleaning staff. Our room was very dusty, looked like it hadn't been done in weeks and the dust bunnies under the bed were as big as my terrier. There was even a layer of dust in the bathroom. The cleaning staff themselves were very loud in the mornings, shouting from one room to the other which woke us up a couple of times. But we'll definitely go back, a 4* masquerading as 3* if you ask me :)

Reviews.Title: “Smashing hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights over Christmas 2004. There was no problem with the booking process and on arrival the receptionist was very helpful in giving us the type of rooms we wanted, a standard double and superior twin with canal views. The rooms were done in a modern, simple style and were clean, comfortable and roomy. The location couldn't have been better - one side of the hotel overlooks the Singel Canal - and it's right next to the "Nine Streets", which are full of different little shops and cafes, and it's very easy to get to the other main tourist areas by foot. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, so I can't comment on that, but we had one evening meal in the hotel restaurant, which was fine. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to return there myself.

HotelInfo.Address: Spuistraat 288-292, Amsterdam 1012 VX, The Netherlands
